Special Conversion Rights<br /><br />
------------------------The<br /><br />
conversion<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock has a special<br /><br />
right that becomes effective upon the occurrence of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
certain types of significant transactions affecting ownership or<br /><br />
control of the Company or the market for the Common Stock. The<br /><br />
purpose of the special conversion right is to provide (subject to<br /><br />
certain exceptions) loss protection upon the occurrence of a<br /><br />
Change in Control (as defined below) or a Fundamental Change (as<br /><br />
defined below) at a time when the Market Value (as defined below)<br /><br />
of the Common Stock is less than the then prevailing Conversion<br /><br />
Price. In such situations, the special conversion right would,<br /><br />
for a limited period, reduce the then prevailing Conversion Price<br /><br />
to the Market Value of the Common Stock.<br /><br />
The special conversion right is intended to provide loss<br /><br />
protection to investors in certain circumstances while not giving<br /><br />
holders a veto power over significant transactions affecting<br /><br />
ownership or control of the Company.<br /><br />
Although the special<br /><br />
conversion right may render more costly or otherwise inhibit<br /><br />
certain proposed transactions, its primary purpose is not to<br /><br />
inhibit or discourage takeovers or other business combinations.<br /><br />
Each holder of Amended Series A Preferred Stock will be entitled<br /><br />
to a special conversion right if a Change of Control or<br /><br />
Fundamental Change occurs. A Change of Control will occur if a<br /><br />
person or group acquires more than 50% of the Common Stock. A<br /><br />
Fundamental Change is, generally, a sale of all or substantially<br /><br />
all of the Company's assets or a transaction in which at least<br /><br />
66% of the Common Stock is transferred for, or is converted into,<br /><br />
any other assets. However, if the majority of the value of the<br /><br />
consideration received in a transaction by holders of Common<br /><br />
Stock is Marketable Stock or if the holders of Common Stock hold<br /><br />
a majority of the voting stock of the Company's successor, the<br /><br />
transaction will not be a Fundamental Change, and holders of the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock will not have special conversion<br /><br />
rights as a result of such transaction. In addition, the special<br /><br />
conversion right arising upon a Change of Control shall only be<br /><br />
applicable with respect to the first Change of Control that<br /><br />
occurs after the first date of issuance of any shares of Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock. The full definitions of the terms<br /><br />
"Change of Control" and "Fundamental Change" appear below.<br /><br />
A<br /><br />
<br /><br />
special conversion right will permit a holder of Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock, at the holder's option during the 30day period described below, to convert all, but not less than<br /><br />
all, of the holders' Amended Series A Preferred Stock at a<br /><br />
Conversion Price equal to the Market Value of the Common Stock. A<br /><br />
holder exercising a special conversion right will receive Common<br /><br />
Stock if a Change of Control occurs and, if a Fundamental Change<br /><br />
occurs, will receive the same consideration received for the<br /><br />
number of shares of Common Stock into which the holder's Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock would have been convertible at the<br /><br />
Market Value of the Common Stock. In either case, however, the<br /><br />
Company or its successor may, at its option, elect to provide the<br /><br />
holder with cash equal to the Market Value of the number of<br /><br />
shares of Common Stock into which the holder's Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock is convertible.<br /><br />
The Company will mail to each registered holder of Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock a notice setting forth details of any<br /><br />
special conversion right occasioned by a Change of Control or<br /><br />
Fundamental Change within 30 days after the event occurs. A<br /><br />
special conversion right may be exercised only within the 30-day<br /><br />
period after the notice is mailed and will expire at the end of<br /><br />
that<br /><br />
period.<br /><br />
Exercise of a special conversion right<br /><br />
is<br /><br />
irrevocable, and all Amended Series A Preferred Stock tendered<br /><br />
for conversion will be converted at the end of the 30-day period<br /><br />
mentioned in the preceding sentence.<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock that is not converted<br /><br />
pursuant to a special conversion right will continue to be<br /><br />
convertible pursuant to the general conversion rights described<br /><br />
above.<br /><br />
The special conversion right is not intended to, and does<br /><br />
not, protect holders of Amended Series A Preferred Stock in all<br /><br />
circumstances that might affect ownership or control of the<br /><br />
Company or the market for the Common Stock, or otherwise<br /><br />
adversely affect the value of an investment in the Amended Series<br /><br />
A Preferred Stock. The ability to control the Company may be<br /><br />
obtained by a person even if that person does not, as is required<br /><br />
to constitute a Change of Control, acquire a majority of the<br /><br />
Company's voting stock. The Company and the market for the Common<br /><br />
Stock may be affected by various transactions that do not<br /><br />
<br /><br />
constitute a Fundamental Change. In particular, transactions<br /><br />
involving transfer or conversion of less than 66% of the Common<br /><br />
Stock may have a significant effect on the Company and the market<br /><br />
for the Common Stock, as could transactions in which holders of<br /><br />
Common Stock receive primarily Marketable Stock or continue to<br /><br />
own a majority of the voting securities of the successor to the<br /><br />
Company. In addition, if the special conversion right arises as<br /><br />
the result of a Fundamental Change, the special conversion right<br /><br />
will allow a holder exercising a special conversion right to<br /><br />
receive the same type of consideration received by the holders of<br /><br />
Common Stock and, thus, the degree of protection afforded by the<br /><br />
special conversion right may be affected by the type<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
consideration received.<br /><br />
As used herein, a "Change of Control" with respect to the<br /><br />
Company shall be deemed to have occurred at the first time after<br /><br />
the first issuance of any Amended Series A Preferred Stock that<br /><br />
any person (within the meaning of Sections 13(d)(3) and 14(d)(2)<br /><br />
of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange<br /><br />
Act")) including a group (within the meaning of Rule 13d-5 under<br /><br />
the Exchange Act), together with any of its Affiliates or<br /><br />
Associates (as defined below), files or becomes obligated to file<br /><br />
a report (or any amendment or supplement thereto) on Schedule 13D<br /><br />
or 14D-1 pursuant to the Exchange Act disclosing that such person<br /><br />
has become the beneficial owner of either (a) 50% or more of the<br /><br />
shares of Common Stock then outstanding or (b) securities<br /><br />
representing 50% or more of the combined voting power of the<br /><br />
Voting Stock (as defined below) of the Company then outstanding,<br /><br />
provided that a Change of Control shall not be deemed to have<br /><br />
occurred with respect to any transaction that constitutes a<br /><br />
Fundamental Change. An "Affiliate" of a specified person is a<br /><br />
person that directly or indirectly controls or is controlled by<br /><br />
or is under common control with, the person specified. An<br /><br />
"Associate" of a person means (i) any corporation or organization<br /><br />
other than the Company or any subsidiary of the Company, of which<br /><br />
the person is an officer or partner or is, directly<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
indirectly, the beneficial owner of 10% or more of any class of<br /><br />
equity securities; (ii) any trust or estate in which the person<br /><br />
has a substantial beneficial interest or as to which the person<br /><br />
serves as trustee or in a similar fiduciary capacity; and (iii)<br /><br />
any relative or spouse of the person or any relative of the<br /><br />
spouse, who has the same home as the person or who is a director<br /><br />
or officer or the person or any of its parents or subsidiaries.<br /><br />
As used herein, a "Fundamental Change" with respect to the<br /><br />
Company means (a) the occurrence of any transaction or event in<br /><br />
connection with which all or substantially all of the Common<br /><br />
Stock<br /><br />
is exchanged for, converted into, acquired for<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
constitutes<br /><br />
solely the right to receive cash, securities,<br /><br />
property or other assets (whether by means of an exchange offer,<br /><br />
liquidation, tender offer, consolidation, merger, combination,<br /><br />
reclassification or otherwise) or (b) the conveyance, sale,<br /><br />
lease,<br /><br />
assignment, transfer or other disposal of all<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
substantially all of the Company's property, business or assets;<br /><br />
provided, however that a Fundamental Change shall not be deemed<br /><br />
to have occurred with respect to either of the following<br /><br />
transactions or events: (i) any transaction or event in which<br /><br />
more than 50% (by value as determined in good faith by the Board<br /><br />
of Directors of the Company) of the consideration received by<br /><br />
holders of Common Stock consists of Marketable Stock (as defined<br /><br />
below) or (ii) any consolidation or merger of the Company in<br /><br />
which the holders of Common Stock immediately prior to such<br /><br />
transaction own, directly or indirectly, (1) 50% or more of the<br /><br />
common stock of the sole surviving corporation (or of the<br /><br />
ultimate parent of such sole surviving corporation) outstanding<br /><br />
at the time immediately after such consolidation or merger and<br /><br />
(2) securities representing 50% or more of the combined voting<br /><br />
power of the surviving corporation's Voting Stock (or the Voting<br /><br />
Stock of the ultimate parent of such surviving corporation)<br /><br />
outstanding at such time. The phrase "all or substantially all"<br /><br />
as used in this definition in reference to the Common Stock means<br /><br />
66% or more of the aggregate outstanding amount. Depending upon<br /><br />
the circumstances, there may be some uncertainty under Delaware<br /><br />
law as to whether a specific transaction constitutes a sale of<br /><br />
"all or substantially all" of the property, business or assets of<br /><br />
a company. This uncertainty may make it difficult for a holder to<br /><br />
determine whether or not a "Fundamental Change" has occurred, and<br /><br />
thus whether such holder is entitled to a special conversion<br /><br />
right in respect of the shares of Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock held by such holder.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
As used herein, "Voting Stock" means, with respect to any<br /><br />
person, capital stock of such person having general power under<br /><br />
ordinary circumstances to elect at least a majority of the board<br /><br />
of directors, managers or trustees of such persons (irrespective<br /><br />
of whether or not at the time capital stock or any other class or<br /><br />
classes shall have or might have voting power by reason of the<br /><br />
happening of any contingency).<br /><br />
As used herein , "Market Value" of the Common Stock or any<br /><br />
other Marketable Stock is the average of the last reported sales<br /><br />
prices of the Common Stock or such other Marketable Stock, as the<br /><br />
case may be, for the five business days ending on the last<br /><br />
business day preceding the date of the Fundamental Change or<br /><br />
Change of Control; provided, however, that if the Marketable<br /><br />
Stock is not traded on any national securities exchange or<br /><br />
similar quotation system as described in the definition of<br /><br />
"Marketable Stock" during such period, then the Market Value of<br /><br />
such Marketable Stock is the average of the last reported sales<br /><br />
prices per share of such Marketable Stock during the first five<br /><br />
business days commencing on the day after the date on which such<br /><br />
Marketable Stock was first distributed to the general public and<br /><br />
traded on the New York Stock Exchange ("NYSE"), the AMEX, the<br /><br />
NASDAQ NSM or any similar system of automated dissemination of<br /><br />
quotations of securities prices in the United States.<br /><br />
As<br /><br />
<br /><br />
used herein, "Marketable Stock" means Common Stock or<br /><br />
common stock of any corporation that is the successor (or the<br /><br />
ultimate parent of such successor) to all or substantially all of<br /><br />
the business or assets of the Company as a result of a<br /><br />
Fundamental Change, which is (or will, upon distribution thereof,<br /><br />
be) listed or quoted on the NYSE, the AMEX, the NASDAQ NSM or any<br /><br />
similar system of automated dissemination of quotations or<br /><br />
securities prices in the United States.<br /><br />
Liquidation Rights<br /><br />
------------------In the event of any liquidation, dissolution or winding up<br /><br />
of the Company, after payment or provision for payment of the<br /><br />
debts and other liabilities of the Company, the holders of the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock shall be entitled to receive,<br /><br />
out of the remaining net assets of the Company available for<br /><br />
distribution to stockholders, liquidating distributions in the<br /><br />
amount of $85.00 per share, plus an amount equal to all dividends<br /><br />
accrued and unpaid on each such share (whether or not declared)<br /><br />
to the date fixed for distribution, before any distribution is<br /><br />
made to holders of the Common Stock or any other class of stock<br /><br />
of the Company ranking junior to the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock.<br /><br />
After receiving payment of the full amount of the<br /><br />
liquidating distribution to which they are entitled, the holders<br /><br />
of shares of Amended Series A Preferred Stock will not be<br /><br />
entitled to any further participation in any remaining assets of<br /><br />
the Company. If upon liquidation, dissolution or winding up of<br /><br />
the Company, the amounts payable with respect to the Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock and any other capital stock ranking as<br /><br />
to such distribution on a parity with the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock with respect to such distributions ("Parity<br /><br />
Stock") are not paid in full, the holders of the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock and of such other Parity Stock will share ratably<br /><br />
in any such distribution of assets in proportion to the full<br /><br />
respective preferential amounts to which they are entitled.<br /><br />
Currently, the Amended Series B Preferred Stock constitutes<br /><br />
Parity Stock. See "-- Description of Existing Capital Stock -Preferred Stock." Neither the consolidation or merger of the<br /><br />
Company with another corporation nor a sale, conveyance, lease,<br /><br />
transfer or exchange of all or substantially all of the Company's<br /><br />
assets will be considered a liquidation, dissolution or winding<br /><br />
up of the Company for these purposes.<br /><br />

Without the affirmative vote or consent of the holders of at<br /><br />

repeal any of the powers, rights or preferences of the holders of<br /><br />
the Amended Series A Preferred Stock so as to affect adversely<br /><br />
such powers, preferences or rights of the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock. Accordingly, the voting rights of the holders of<br /><br />
Amended<br /><br />
Series<br /><br />
A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock could,<br /><br />
under<br /><br />
certain<br /><br />
circumstances, operate to restrict the flexibility the Company<br /><br />
would otherwise have in connection with any future issuances of<br /><br />
equity securities or changes to its capital structure.<br /><br />

Board of Directors. No prediction can be made as to the effect,<br /><br />
if any, that future sales or the availability of shares for sale<br /><br />
will have on the market price of the Common Stock prevailing from<br /><br />
time to time.<br /><br />
Nevertheless, sales of substantial amounts of<br /><br />
Common Stock of the Company in the public market could adversely<br /><br />
affect the prevailing market price of the Common Stock and could<br /><br />
impair the Company's ability to raise capital through sales of<br /><br />
its equity securities.<br /><br />
Approximately 6.8 million shares of Common Stock (including<br /><br />
shares issuable upon exercise of outstanding options and warrants<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
conversion of convertible securities, the<br /><br />
"Restricted<br /><br />
Shares") are held by executive officers and directors of the<br /><br />
Company and affiliates of the Company and may be sold pursuant to<br /><br />
an effective registration statement covering such shares or<br /><br />
pursuant to Rule 144 of the Securities Act, subject to the<br /><br />
restrictions described below.<br /><br />
In general, under Rule 144, as currently in effect, a person<br /><br />
(or persons whose shares are aggregated), including an affiliate,<br /><br />
<br /><br />
who has beneficially owned Restricted Shares for a least one<br /><br />
year, is entitled to sell within any three-month period, a number<br /><br />
of shares that does not exceed the greater of (i) 1% of the then<br /><br />
outstanding shares of the Company's Common Stock or (ii) an<br /><br />
amount equal to the average weekly reported volume of trading in<br /><br />
such shares during the four calendar weeks preceding the date on<br /><br />
which notice of such sale is filed with the Commission.<br /><br />
Sales<br /><br />
under Rule 144 are also subject to certain manner of sale<br /><br />
limitations, notice requirements and the availability of current<br /><br />
public information about the Company. Restricted Shares properly<br /><br />
sold in reliance on Rule 144 are thereafter freely tradable<br /><br />
without restrictions or registration under the Securities Act,<br /><br />
unless thereafter held by an affiliate of the Company.<br /><br />
In<br /><br />
addition, affiliates of the Company must comply with<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
restrictions and requirements of Rule 144, other than the oneyear holding period requirement, in order to sell shares of<br /><br />
Common Stock which are not Restricted Shares. As defined in Rule<br /><br />
144, an "affiliate" of an issuer is a person that directly, or<br /><br />
indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls or is<br /><br />
controlled by, or is under common control with, such issuer.<br /><br />
If<br /><br />
two years have elapsed since the later of the date of any<br /><br />
acquisition of Restricted Shares from the Company or from any<br /><br />
affiliate of the Company, and the acquiror or subsequent holder<br /><br />
thereof is deemed not to have been an affiliate of the Company at<br /><br />
any time during the three months preceding a sale, such person<br /><br />
would be entitled to sell such shares in the public market<br /><br />
pursuant to Rule 144(k) without regard to volume limitations,<br /><br />
manner of sale restrictions, or public information or notice<br /><br />
requirements.<br /><br />
MATERIAL UNITED STATES INCOME TAX CONSIDERATIONS<br /><br />
The following discussion is a summary of material federal<br /><br />
income tax considerations relevant to the purchase, ownership and<br /><br />
disposition of the Amended Series A Preferred Stock and the<br /><br />
Common Stock, but does not purport to be a complete analysis of<br /><br />
all the potential tax effects thereof. The discussion is based<br /><br />
upon the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (the "Code"), Treasury<br /><br />
regulations, and Internal Revenue Service ("IRS") rulings and<br /><br />
judicial decisions now in effect, all of which are subject to<br /><br />
change at any time by legislative, judicial or administrative<br /><br />
action. No information is provided herein with respect to state<br /><br />
and local taxes or estate and gift tax considerations.<br /><br />
This<br /><br />
information is directed to the original investors who hold the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock and the Common Stock as "capital<br /><br />
assets" within the meaning of Section 1221 of the Code. In<br /><br />
addition, this discussion does not address the tax consequences<br /><br />
to certain holders as to whom special rules apply (including life<br /><br />
insurance companies, tax exempt organizations, banks and dealers<br /><br />
in securities). The Company has not sought, nor does it intend<br /><br />
to seek an opinion from tax counsel, or a ruling from the IRS<br /><br />
that the tax consequences described in the following discussion<br /><br />
will be accepted by the IRS. This discussion does not purport to<br /><br />
address all federal income tax aspects that may be relevant to<br /><br />
holders<br /><br />
in light of their particular circumstances.<br /><br />
Each<br /><br />
prospective investor should consult and should rely on his own<br /><br />
tax advisor concerning the tax consequences to him of the<br /><br />
purchase, ownership and disposition of the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock and the Common Stock.<br /><br />
Taxation of the Amended Series A Preferred Stock and Common Stock<br /><br />
- ----------------------------------------------------------------Dividends on Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common<br /><br />
Stock<br /><br />
---------------------------------------------------------Dividends paid on the Amended Series A Preferred Stock or<br /><br />
Common Stock will be taxable under Section 301 of the Code as<br /><br />
ordinary income to the extent of the Company's current and<br /><br />
accumulated "earnings and profits" (as defined in the Code).<br /><br />
Dividends received by corporate holders of the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock or Common Stock out of such earnings and profits<br /><br />
generally will qualify, subject to the limitations under Sections<br /><br />
246(c) and 246A of the Code, for the 70% dividends received<br /><br />
deduction allowable to corporations under Section 243 of the Code<br /><br />
(although the benefits of such deduction may be reduced or<br /><br />
<br /><br />
eliminated by the corporate alternative minimum tax). Under<br /><br />
Section 246(c) of the Code, to be eligible for the dividends<br /><br />
received deduction, a corporate holder must hold its shares of<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common Stock for at least 46<br /><br />
days during the 90-day period beginning 45 days before the date<br /><br />
on which the shares became ex-dividend (91 days during the 180day period beginning 90 days before the shares became ex-dividend<br /><br />
in the case of a preferred dividend attributable to a period or<br /><br />
periods aggregating more than 366 days). A taxpayer's holding<br /><br />
period for these purposes is suspended during any period in which<br /><br />
the taxpayer has an option to sell, is under a contractual<br /><br />
obligation to sell, has made (and not closed) a short sale of, or<br /><br />
has granted an option to buy, substantially identical stock or<br /><br />
securities, or holds one or more other positions with respect to<br /><br />
substantially similar or related property that diminish the risk<br /><br />
of loss from holding such stock. Under Section 246A of the Code,<br /><br />
the dividends received deduction may be reduced or eliminated if<br /><br />
a holder's shares of Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common<br /><br />
Stock are debt financed.<br /><br />
Section 1059 of the Code requires a corporate stockholder to<br /><br />
reduce its basis (but not below zero) in the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or Common Stock by the nontaxed<br /><br />
portion<br /><br />
(generally the portion eligible for the dividends received<br /><br />
deduction described above) of any "extraordinary dividend" if the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common Stock has not been<br /><br />
held for more than two years before the date of announcement or<br /><br />
agreement with respect to such dividend.<br /><br />
In addition,<br /><br />
a<br /><br />
corporate holder of Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common<br /><br />
Stock would recognize additional gain on the disposition of such<br /><br />
stock equal to any nontaxed portions of any extraordinary<br /><br />
dividend that would have reduced such holder's basis but for the<br /><br />
limitation on reducing basis below zero.<br /><br />
An "extraordinary<br /><br />
dividend" generally is a dividend that (a) equals or exceeds 5%<br /><br />
in the case of preferred stock, or 10% in the case of common<br /><br />
stock, of the holder's adjusted basis in such stock, treating all<br /><br />
dividends having ex-dividend dates within a period of<br /><br />
85<br /><br />
consecutive days as one dividend or (b) exceeds 20 percent of the<br /><br />
holder's basis in such stock, treating all dividends having exdividend dates within a period of 365 consecutive days as one<br /><br />
dividend, provided that in either case fair market value of the<br /><br />
stock on the day before the ex-dividend date, if it can be<br /><br />
established by the holder, may be substituted for the stock<br /><br />
basis. In addition, an amount treated as a dividend in the case<br /><br />
of a redemption of the Amended Series A Preferred Stock that is<br /><br />
either non-pro rata as to all stockholders or in partial<br /><br />
liquidation would also constitute an "extraordinary dividend"<br /><br />
without regard to the length of time the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock has been held. Special rules apply with respect<br /><br />
to a "qualified preferred dividend," which would include any<br /><br />
fixed dividend payable with respect to the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock, provided it is not in arrears as to dividends<br /><br />
when acquired and the actual rate of return on the Amended Series<br /><br />
A Preferred Stock does not exceed 15% calculated by reference to<br /><br />
the lower of the holder's basis in the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or its liquidation preference. The extraordinary dividend<br /><br />
rules will not apply to a qualified preferred dividend if the<br /><br />
holder has held the Amended Series A Preferred Stock for more<br /><br />
than five years. If the holder disposes of the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock before it has been held for more than five years,<br /><br />
the aggregate reduction in basis will not exceed the excess of<br /><br />
the qualified preferred dividends paid during the period the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock was held by the holder over the<br /><br />
qualified preferred dividends which would have been paid during<br /><br />
such period on the basis of the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock's stated rate of return calculated by reference to the<br /><br />
lower of the holder's basis in the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or its liquidation preference.<br /><br />
To the extent that a distribution on Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or Common Stock exceeds the current<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
accumulated<br /><br />
earnings<br /><br />
and profits of<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Company,<br /><br />
such<br /><br />
distribution will be treated as a nontaxable return of capital<br /><br />
which reduces the holder's basis in its Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock or Common Stock. Any such distribution in excess<br /><br />
of a holder's basis will be treated as short-term or long-term<br /><br />
capital gain, depending on whether the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or Common Stock has been held for more than one year.<br /><br />
At the present time, the Company has no accumulated earnings<br /><br />
<br /><br />
and profits for federal income tax purposes, and it is uncertain<br /><br />
whether and to what extent the Company will have current or<br /><br />
accumulated earnings and profits in the future.<br /><br />
Accordingly,<br /><br />
there can be no assurance that distributions to corporate holders<br /><br />
of the Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common Stock will<br /><br />
qualify for the dividends received deduction.<br /><br />
Redemption Premium on Amended Series A Preferred Stock<br /><br />
-----------------------------------------------------Under Section 305 of the Code and applicable Treasury<br /><br />
regulations, if the redemption price of redeemable preferred<br /><br />
stock exceeds its issue price and part (or all) of such excess is<br /><br />
considered an unreasonable redemption premium, the entire amount<br /><br />
of such excess is treated as distributed over the period during<br /><br />
which the preferred stock cannot be redeemed. The amount treated<br /><br />
as distributed each year would be determined on a constant yield<br /><br />
to maturity basis that would result in the allocation of a lesser<br /><br />
amount of distributions to the early years and a greater amount<br /><br />
to the later years of such period. Any such constructive<br /><br />
distribution would be classified as a dividend, a non-taxable<br /><br />
recovery of basis or an amount received in exchange for the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock pursuant to the rules summed up<br /><br />
under " -- Dividends on Amended Series A Preferred Stock or<br /><br />
Common Stock." Any such constructive distribution would be taken<br /><br />
into account for proposes of applying the extraordinary dividend<br /><br />
rules discussed above.<br /><br />
Under recently issued Treasury Regulations, a redemption<br /><br />
premium that would be paid in the event of an issuer call is<br /><br />
considered unreasonable only if, based on all the facts and<br /><br />
circumstances as of the issue date, redemption pursuant to the<br /><br />
call is more likely than not to occur. Even if a redemption is<br /><br />
considered more likely than not to occur, the redemption premium<br /><br />
is not subject to the current inclusion rule if it is solely in<br /><br />
the nature of a penalty for premature redemption. A redemption<br /><br />
premium is considered a penalty for premature redemption only if<br /><br />
it is paid as a result of changes in economic or market<br /><br />
conditions over which neither the issuer nor the holder has legal<br /><br />
or practical control.<br /><br />
Under a safe harbor, a redemption is not treated as more<br /><br />
likely than not to occur if (i) the issuer and holder are not<br /><br />
"related," (ii) there are no plans, arrangements, or agreements<br /><br />
that effectively require or are intended to compel the issuer to<br /><br />
redeem the stock (other than a mandatory redemption right<br /><br />
exercisable by the holder), and (iii) exercise of the call right<br /><br />
would not reduce the yield of the stock, as determined under<br /><br />
principles similar to the principles of section 1272(a) of the<br /><br />
Code and the Treasury Regulations under sections 1271 through<br /><br />
1275. The Company anticipates that any call of the Amended Series<br /><br />
A Preferred Stock will fall within this safe harbor, although no<br /><br />
assurance can be given that it will fall within the safe harbor.<br /><br />
Assuming that the redemption does not fall within the safe<br /><br />
harbor discussed above, the Company believes, based upon the<br /><br />
facts and circumstances existing at the time of issuance, that it<br /><br />
is not more likely than not that the redemption will occur. The<br /><br />
Company further believes that, even if the IRS were to treat the<br /><br />
redemption as more likely than not to occur, the redemption<br /><br />
premium should be considered a penalty paid for premature<br /><br />
redemption of the Amended Series A Preferred Stock.<br /><br />
Redemption or Sale of Amended Series A Preferred Stock<br /><br />
-----------------------------------------------------A redemption of Amended Series A Preferred Stock for cash<br /><br />
will be treated, under Section 302 of the Code, as (i) a<br /><br />
distribution treated as a taxable dividend, (ii) a nontaxable<br /><br />
recovery of basis, or (iii) an amount received in exchange for<br /><br />
the Amended Series A Preferred Stock pursuant to the rules<br /><br />
described under " -- Dividends on Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or Common Stock," unless the redemption (a) results in a<br /><br />
"complete termination" of the stockholder's interest in the<br /><br />
Company<br /><br />
under<br /><br />
Section 302(b)(3) of<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Code;<br /><br />
(b)<br /><br />
is<br /><br />
"substantially disproportionate" with respect to the stockholder<br /><br />
under Section 302(b)(2) of the Code; or (c) is "not essentially<br /><br />
equivalent to a dividend" under Section 302(b)(1) of the Code. In<br /><br />
determining whether any of these tests have been met, shares<br /><br />
considered to be owned by the stockholder by reason of certain<br /><br />
<br /><br />
constructive ownership rules in Sections 302(c) and 318(a) of the<br /><br />
Code, as well as shares actually owned, must be taken into<br /><br />
account. If any of these tests are met, the redemption of the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock for cash would be treated as a<br /><br />
sale or exchange for tax purposes.<br /><br />
A redemption will be "not essentially equivalent to a<br /><br />
dividend" as to a particular stockholder if it results in a<br /><br />
meaningful reduction in that stockholder's interest in the<br /><br />
Company. If, as a result of the redemption of the Amended Series<br /><br />
A Preferred Stock, a stockholder of the Company, whose relative<br /><br />
interest in the Company is minimal and who exercises no control<br /><br />
over corporate affairs, suffers a reduction in his proportionate<br /><br />
interest<br /><br />
in<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Company<br /><br />
(taking<br /><br />
into<br /><br />
account<br /><br />
shares<br /><br />
constructively owned by the stockholder and, in certain events,<br /><br />
dispositions of the stock that occur contemporaneously with the<br /><br />
redemption), that stockholder should be regarded as having<br /><br />
suffered a meaningful reduction in his interest in the Company.<br /><br />
If, under the foregoing rules, a redemption of Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock is treated as a sale or exchange, rather<br /><br />
than as a distribution, or if the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock is sold, the holder would recognize taxable gain or loss<br /><br />
equal to the difference between the amount realized and the<br /><br />
holder's tax basis in the Amended Series A Preferred Stock. For<br /><br />
these purposes, the amount realized will generally be measured by<br /><br />
the amount of cash and the fair market value of any other<br /><br />
property received. The holder's initial cost basis in the Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock will be that portion of the initial<br /><br />
Equity Unit price that is allocated to the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock based upon the relative fair market values of the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock and the Warrants. Each holder<br /><br />
should consult his tax adviser regarding the determination of the<br /><br />
initial cost basis of the Securities comprising the Units.<br /><br />
If a redemption of Amended Series A Preferred Stock is<br /><br />
treated as a distribution, the amount of the distribution will<br /><br />
generally be measured by the amount of cash and the fair market<br /><br />
value of any other property received. The stockholder's basis in<br /><br />
the redeemed Amended Series A Preferred Stock will be transferred<br /><br />
to any remaining stockholdings in the Company.<br /><br />
A distribution to a corporate stockholder in redemption of<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock that is treated as a dividend<br /><br />
may also be considered an "extraordinary dividend" under Section<br /><br />
1059 of the Code. See " -- Dividends on Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock or Common Stock." A redemption that is treated as<br /><br />
a dividend that is not pro rata as to all stockholders may be<br /><br />
treated as an extraordinary dividend without regard to the period<br /><br />
during which the stockholder held the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock.<br /><br />
Conversion of Amended Series A Preferred Stock Into Common<br /><br />
Stock<br /><br />
----------------------------------------------------------In general, no gain or loss will be recognized for federal<br /><br />
income tax purposes on conversion of Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock solely into shares of Common Stock, except with respect to<br /><br />
any cash received in lieu of fractional shares of Common Stock.<br /><br />
If dividends on the Amended Series A Preferred Stock are in<br /><br />
arrears at the time of conversion, however, a portion of the<br /><br />
Common Stock received in exchange for Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock could be viewed under Section 305(c) of the Code as a<br /><br />
distribution with respect to the Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock, taxable as a dividend. The tax basis for Common Stock<br /><br />
received on conversion will be equal to the tax basis of the<br /><br />
Amended Series A Preferred Stock converted, reduced by the<br /><br />
portion of basis allocable to any fractional share exchanged for<br /><br />
cash. The holding period of the shares of Common Stock will<br /><br />
include the holding period of such Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock.<br /><br />
Adjustment of Conversion Price<br /><br />
-----------------------------Section 305 of the Code treats holders of convertible<br /><br />
securities<br /><br />
as having received a constructive<br /><br />
distribution<br /><br />
(taxable as a dividend to the extent of the issuing corporation's<br /><br />
current<br /><br />
or accumulated earnings and profits) when certain<br /><br />
<br /><br />
adjustments are made to the conversion price and conversion ratio<br /><br />
of such securities. For example, a constructive distribution<br /><br />
results when the conversion price is adjusted to reflect certain<br /><br />
taxable distributions with respect to the stock into which<br /><br />
preferred stock is convertible. Adjustment of the Conversion<br /><br />
Price and the Conversion Ratio at which the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock can be converted (which may occur under certain<br /><br />
circumstances) could cause the holders thereof to be viewed under<br /><br />
Section 305 of the Code as having received a deemed distribution<br /><br />
taxable as a dividend whether or not such holders exercise their<br /><br />
conversion rights.<br /><br />
Foreign Holders<br /><br />
- --------------The following discussion is a summary of material United<br /><br />
States federal income tax consequences to a Foreign Person that<br /><br />
holds a Security. The Company has not sought, nor does it intend<br /><br />
to seek, an opinion from tax counsel or a ruling from the IRS<br /><br />
with<br /><br />
respect<br /><br />
to the matters addressed in the<br /><br />
following<br /><br />
discussion. The term "Foreign Person" means a nonresident alien<br /><br />
individual or foreign corporation, but only if the income or gain<br /><br />
on the Security is not "effectively connected with the conduct of<br /><br />
a trade or business within the United States." If the income or<br /><br />
gain on the Security is "effectively connected with the conduct<br /><br />
of a trade or business within the United States," then the<br /><br />
nonresident alien individual or foreign corporation will be<br /><br />
subject to tax on such income or gain in essentially the same<br /><br />
manner as a United States citizen or resident or a domestic<br /><br />
corporation, as discussed herein, and in the case of a foreign<br /><br />
corporation, may also be subject to the branch profits tax.<br /><br />
In general, gain (to the extent it is not "effectively<br /><br />
connected with the conduct of a trade or business within the<br /><br />
United<br /><br />
States") recognized by a Foreign Person upon<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
redemption, sale, exchange or other taxable disposition of a<br /><br />
share of Amended Series A Preferred Stock or of shares of Common<br /><br />
Stock will not be subject to United States federal income tax<br /><br />
unless such Foreign Person is an individual present in the United<br /><br />
States for 183 days or more during the taxable year in which the<br /><br />
disposition occurs and certain other requirements are met, or<br /><br />
unless the Company was a United States real property holding<br /><br />
corporation at any time during the five years preceding the<br /><br />
disposition while the Foreign Person held an interest in the<br /><br />
Company. Although the Company has previously been treated as a<br /><br />
United States real property holding corporation for United States<br /><br />
federal<br /><br />
income tax purposes because of its ownership<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
substantial real estate assets in the United States, the Company<br /><br />
believes that it is not presently a United States real property<br /><br />
holding corporation because the fair market value of its United<br /><br />
States real property interests now constitutes less than 50% of<br /><br />
the total fair market value of its real estate assets, including<br /><br />
its Chinese assets. If the Company were again to become a United<br /><br />
States real property holding corporation in the future, either<br /><br />
because of a change in the fair market values of its current<br /><br />
properties or through acquisitions of real property interests, a<br /><br />
Foreign Person who holds Amended Series A Preferred Stock or<br /><br />
Common Stock would generally be subject to United States federal<br /><br />
income tax on any gain recognized from sale or other disposition<br /><br />
of Amended Series A Preferred Stock or Common Stock, unless the<br /><br />
Common Stock is traded on an established securities market and a<br /><br />
Foreign Person does not directly or constructively own Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock or Common Stock with a fair market value<br /><br />
on the date of acquisition of more than 5% of the fair market<br /><br />
value of the outstanding Common Stock on such date. If subject to<br /><br />
United States federal income tax, the gain would be treated as<br /><br />
effectively connected with the conduct of a trade or business<br /><br />
within the United States and the sale or other disposition<br /><br />
generally would be subject to withholding tax equal to 10% of the<br /><br />
amount realized therefrom.<br /><br />
Distributions paid on the Amended Series A Preferred Stock<br /><br />
or Common Stock to a Foreign Person (other than distributions<br /><br />
that constitute income effectively connected with a United States<br /><br />
trade or business) will be subject to United States federal<br /><br />
income tax withholding at a rate of 30% of the amount of the<br /><br />
distribution (unless the rate is reduced by an applicable tax<br /><br />
treaty). If the Company derives at least 80% of its gross income<br /><br />
from the active conduct of a trade or business outside the United<br /><br />
States for a period of three years prior to the taxable year of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the distribution (or for the taxable year of the distribution if<br /><br />
the Company has no gross income for such three-year period), then<br /><br />
distributions to Foreign Holders of Amended Series A Preferred<br /><br />
Stock or Common Stock will not be subject to withholding.<br /><br />
Any Foreign Person that recognizes gain upon the redemption,<br /><br />
sale, exchange or other taxable disposition of a share of Amended<br /><br />
Series A Preferred Stock or of shares of Common Stock or receives<br /><br />
a dividend on the Common Stock that is "effectively connected<br /><br />
with the conduct of a trade or business with the United States"<br /><br />
will be subject to tax in essentially the same manner as a U.S.<br /><br />
person, as discussed above. A Foreign Person that is a foreign<br /><br />
corporation engaged in a U.S. trade or business also may be<br /><br />
subject to the branch profits tax with respect to such gain or<br /><br />
dividend.<br /><br />
Backup Withholding<br /><br />
- -----------------A noncorporate holder may be subject, under certain<br /><br />
circumstances, to backup withholding at a 31% rate with respect<br /><br />
to payments received with respect to the Amended Series A<br /><br />
Preferred Stock and the Common Stock. This withholding generally<br /><br />
applies only if the holder (i) fails to furnish his, her or its<br /><br />
social security or other taxpayer identification number ("TIN"),<br /><br />
(ii) furnishes an incorrect TIN, (iii) is notified by the IRS<br /><br />
that he, she or it has failed to report properly payments of<br /><br />
interest and dividends and the IRS has notified the Company that<br /><br />
he, she or it is subject to backup withholding, or (iv) fails,<br /><br />
under certain circumstances, to provide a certified statement,<br /><br />
signed under penalty of perjury, that the TIN provided is his,<br /><br />
her or its correct number and that he, she or it is not subject<br /><br />
to backup withholding. Any amount withheld from a payment to a<br /><br />
holder under the backup withholding rules is allowable as a<br /><br />
credit against such holder's federal income tax liability,<br /><br />
provided that the required information is furnished to the IRS.<br /><br />
Certain holders (including, among others, corporations<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
foreign<br /><br />
individuals who comply with certain<br /><br />
certification<br /><br />
requirements) are not subject to backup withholding. Holders<br /><br />
should consult their tax advisors as to their qualification for<br /><br />
exemption from backup withholding and the procedure for obtaining<br /><br />
such an exemption.<br /><br />

GLOSSARY OF TERMS<br /><br />
Unless otherwise indicated in this Prospectus, natural gas<br /><br />
volumes are stated at the legal pressure base of the State or<br /><br />
area in which the reserves are located at 60 degrees Fahrenheit.<br /><br />
Natural gas equivalents are determined using the ratio of six Mcf<br /><br />
of natural gas to one barrel of crude oil, condensate or NGLs.<br /><br />
The following definitions shall apply to the technical terms<br /><br />
used in this Prospectus.<br /><br />
"Bbl" means barrel or barrels.<br /><br />
"Bcf" means billion cubic feet.<br /><br />
"BOE" means barrel of crude oil equivalent.<br /><br />
"BOPD" means barrel per day.<br /><br />
"DD&amp;A" means depletion, depreciation and amortization.<br /><br />
"Developed acreage" means acreage which consists<br /><br />
acres spaced or assignable to productive wells.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"Developed well" means a well drilled within the proved<br /><br />
area of a crude oil or natural gas reservoir to the depth of<br /><br />
stratigraphic horizon (rock layer or formation) known to be<br /><br />
productive for the purpose of extraction of proved crude oil<br /><br />
or natural gas reserves.<br /><br />
"Dry hole" means an exploratory or development well<br /><br />
found to be incapable of producing either crude oil or gas<br /><br />
in sufficient quantities to justify completion as a crude<br /><br />
oil or natural gas well.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"EBITDA" means earnings from continuing operations<br /><br />
before income taxes, interest expense, DD&amp;A and other noncash charges.<br /><br />
"Exploratory well" means a well drilled to find and<br /><br />
produce crude oil or natural gas in an unproved area, to<br /><br />
find a new reservoir in a field previously found to be<br /><br />
producing crude oil or natural gas in another reservoir, or<br /><br />
to extend a known reservoir.<br /><br />
"Farmout" means a leasehold held by the owner thereof<br /><br />
under an agreement between operators, whereby a lease owner<br /><br />
not desirous of drilling at the time agrees to assign the<br /><br />
lease, or some portion of it (in common or in severalty) to<br /><br />
another operator who is desirous of drilling the tract.<br /><br />
"Finding cost", expressed in dollars per BOE, is<br /><br />
calculated by dividing the amount of total exploration and<br /><br />
development capital expenditures (excluding any amortization<br /><br />
with respect to deferred financing fees) by the amount of<br /><br />
proved reserves added during the same period<br /><br />
(including<br /><br />
the effect on proved reserves of reserve revisions).<br /><br />
"G&amp;A" means general and administrative.<br /><br />
"Gross" natural gas and crude oil wells or "gross"<br /><br />
wells or acres is the number of wells or acres in which the<br /><br />
Company has an interest.<br /><br />
"LOE"<br /><br />
<br /><br />
means<br /><br />
<br /><br />
lease operating expenses and<br /><br />
<br /><br />
production<br /><br />
<br /><br />
taxes.<br /><br />
"MBbl" means thousand barrels.<br /><br />
"MBOE" means thousand barrels of crude oil equivalent.<br /><br />
"Mcf" means thousand cubic feet.<br /><br />
"Mcfpd" means thousand cubic feet per day.<br /><br />
"MMBbls" means million barrels of crude oil.<br /><br />
"MMBOE" means million barrels of crude oil equivalent.<br /><br />
"MMBTU" means million British Thermal Units.<br /><br />
"MMcf" means million cubic feet.<br /><br />
"MMcfpd" means million cubic feet per day.<br /><br />
"Net" natural gas and crude oil wells or "net" acres<br /><br />
are determined by multiplying "gross" wells or acres by the<br /><br />
Company's working interest in such wells or acres.<br /><br />
"NGL" means natural gas liquid.<br /><br />
"Production costs" means lease operating expenses<br /><br />
taxes on natural gas and crude oil production.<br /><br />
"Productive wells" means producing<br /><br />
capable of production.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
wells<br /><br />
<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
wells<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"Proved developed reserves" means reserves that can be<br /><br />
expected to be recovered through existing wells<br /><br />
with<br /><br />
existing equipment and operating methods and those reserves<br /><br />
that exist behind the casing of existing wells when the cost<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
making such reserves available for production<br /><br />
is<br /><br />
relatively small compared to the cost of a new well.<br /><br />
"Proved reserves" or "reserves" means the estimated<br /><br />
quantities of crude oil, natural gas, and NGLs which<br /><br />
geological and engineering data demonstrate with reasonable<br /><br />
certainty to be recoverable in future years from known<br /><br />
reservoirs under existing economic and operating conditions,<br /><br />
i.e., prices and costs as of the date the estimate is made.<br /><br />
Prices include consideration of changes in existing prices<br /><br />
provided only by contractual arrangements, but not on<br /><br />
escalations based upon future conditions.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"Proved undeveloped reserves" means reserves that are<br /><br />
expected to be recovered from new wells on undrilled<br /><br />
acreage, or from existing wells where a relatively major<br /><br />
expenditure is required for recompletion.<br /><br />
Reserves on<br /><br />
undrilled acreage shall be limited to those drilling units<br /><br />
offsetting productive units that are reasonably certain of<br /><br />
production<br /><br />
when drilled.<br /><br />
Proved reserves<br /><br />
for<br /><br />
other<br /><br />
undrilled units can be claimed only where it can be<br /><br />
demonstrated with certainty that there is continuity of<br /><br />
production from the existing productive formation. Under no<br /><br />
circumstances<br /><br />
should estimates for proved<br /><br />
undeveloped<br /><br />
reserves be attributable to any acreage for which an<br /><br />
application of fluid injection or other improved recovery<br /><br />
technique is contemplated, unless such techniques have been<br /><br />
proved effective by actual tests in the area and in the same<br /><br />
reservoir.<br /><br />
"Service well" is a well used for water injection in<br /><br />
secondary recovery projects or for the disposal of produced<br /><br />
water.<br /><br />
"Undeveloped acreage" means leased acres on which wells<br /><br />
have not been drilled or completed to a point that would<br /><br />
permit the production of commercial quantities of crude oil<br /><br />
and natural gas, regardless whether or not such acreage<br /><br />
contains proved reserves.<br /><br />

REPORT OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS<br /><br />
<br /><br />
To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
XCL Ltd.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
We have audited the consolidated financial statements and the<br /><br />
financial statement schedule of XCL Ltd. and Subsidiaries listed<br /><br />
in<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Index on page F-1.<br /><br />
These consolidated financial<br /><br />
statements<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
financial<br /><br />
statement<br /><br />
schedule<br /><br />
are<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is<br /><br />
to express an opinion on these consolidated financial statements<br /><br />
and financial statement schedule based on our audits.<br /><br />
We conducted our audits in accordance with generally accepted<br /><br />
auditing standards. Those standards require that we plan and<br /><br />
perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether<br /><br />
the financial statements are free of material misstatement.<br /><br />
An<br /><br />
audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting<br /><br />
the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements.<br /><br />
An<br /><br />
audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and<br /><br />
significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating<br /><br />
the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that<br /><br />
our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.<br /><br />
In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above<br /><br />
present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated<br /><br />
financial position of XCL Ltd. and Subsidiaries as of December<br /><br />
31, 1997 and 1996, and the consolidated results of their<br /><br />
operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in<br /><br />
the period ended December 31, 1997, in conformity with generally<br /><br />
accepted accounting principles. In addition, in our opinion, the<br /><br />
financial statement schedule referred to above, when considered<br /><br />
in relation to the basic consolidated financial statements taken<br /><br />
as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the<br /><br />
information required to be included therein.<br /><br />
The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been<br /><br />
prepared assuming that the Company will continue as a going<br /><br />
concern.<br /><br />
As discussed in Note 2 to the consolidated financial<br /><br />
statements, the Company is generating minimal revenues and<br /><br />
although the Company has cash (including its restricted cash) in<br /><br />
the amount of approximately $32 million as of December 31, 1997,<br /><br />
and a positive working capital position, it must generate<br /><br />
additional cash flows to satisfy its development and exploratory<br /><br />
obligations with respect to its China properties. There is no<br /><br />
assurance that the Company will be able to generate the necessary<br /><br />
funds to satisfy these contractual obligations and to ultimately<br /><br />
achieve profitable operations, which creates substantial doubt<br /><br />
about its ability to continue as a going concern. Managements'<br /><br />
plans in regard to these matters are described in Note 2.<br /><br />
The<br /><br />
consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments<br /><br />
that might result from the outcome of this uncertainty.<br /><br />

&lt;PAGE&gt;<br /><br />
XCL Ltd. and Subsidiaries<br /><br />
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(1)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Summary of Significant Accounting Policies:<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Principles of Consolidation:<br /><br />
--------------------------The consolidated financial statements include the accounts<br /><br />
of XCL Ltd. and its wholly owned subsidiaries ("XCL" or the<br /><br />
"Company") after the elimination of all significant intercompany<br /><br />
accounts and transactions.<br /><br />
Certain reclassifications have been<br /><br />
made to prior year financial statements to conform to current<br /><br />
year presentation. These reclassifications had no effect on net<br /><br />
loss, cash flows or shareholders' equity.<br /><br />
Use of Estimates in the Preparation of Financial Statements:<br /><br />
- ----------------------------------------------------------The preparation of the Company's financial statements, in<br /><br />
conformity<br /><br />
with<br /><br />
generally accepted accounting<br /><br />
principles,<br /><br />
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect<br /><br />
reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses,<br /><br />
and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities.<br /><br />
Actual<br /><br />
results could differ from those estimates.<br /><br />
Cash and Cash Equivalents:<br /><br />
------------------------The Company considers deposits which can be redeemed on<br /><br />
demand and investments which have original maturities of less<br /><br />
than three months, when purchased, to be cash equivalents. As of<br /><br />
December 31, 1997, the Company's cash and cash equivalents were<br /><br />
deposited primarily in three financial institutions.<br /><br />
Concentration of Credit Risk:<br /><br />
---------------------------The Company operates exclusively in the oil and gas industry<br /><br />
and receivables are due from other producers who may be affected<br /><br />
by economic conditions in the industry. The Company has not<br /><br />
experienced any material credit losses.<br /><br />
The Company's financial instruments that are exposed to<br /><br />
concentrations<br /><br />
of credit risk consist primarily<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
cash<br /><br />
equivalents/short-term investments and trade receivables.<br /><br />
The Company believes that no single short-term investment<br /><br />
exposes the Company to significant credit risk. Additionally,<br /><br />
creditworthiness of its counterparties, which are major financial<br /><br />
institutions, are monitored. As of December 31, 1997, the Company<br /><br />
had cash in financial institutions in excess of the insured<br /><br />
amounts.<br /><br />
Fair Value of Financial Instruments:<br /><br />
----------------------------------For the purposes of disclosure requirements pursuant to<br /><br />
Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 107 "Disclosures<br /><br />
About Fair Market Value of Financial Instruments," fair value of<br /><br />
current assets and liabilities approximate carrying value, due to<br /><br />
the short-term nature of these items. The Company believes the<br /><br />
fair value of long-term debt approximates carrying value. Fair<br /><br />
value<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
such<br /><br />
financial instruments is not<br /><br />
necessarily<br /><br />
representative of the amount that could be realized or settled.<br /><br />
Oil and Gas Properties:<br /><br />
---------------------The Company accounts for its oil and gas exploration and<br /><br />
production activities using the full cost method of accounting.<br /><br />
Accordingly, all costs associated with acquisition, exploration,<br /><br />
and development of oil and gas reserves, including appropriate<br /><br />
related costs, are capitalized. The Company capitalizes internal<br /><br />
costs that can be directly identified with its acquisition,<br /><br />
exploration and development activities and does not capitalize<br /><br />
any costs related to production, general corporate overhead or<br /><br />
similar activities.<br /><br />
The capitalized costs of oil and gas properties, including<br /><br />
the estimated future costs to develop proved reserves, are<br /><br />
amortized on the unit-of-production method based on estimates of<br /><br />
proved oil and gas reserves. The Company's domestic oil and gas<br /><br />
<br /><br />
reserves were estimated by Company engineers in 1997 and 1996,<br /><br />
and foreign reserves in 1997 and 1996 by independent petroleum<br /><br />
engineers.<br /><br />
Investments in unproved<br /><br />
properties<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
major<br /><br />
development projects are not amortized until proved reserves<br /><br />
associated with the projects can be determined<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
until<br /><br />
impairment occurs. If the results of an assessment indicate that<br /><br />
properties are impaired, the amount of the impairment is added to<br /><br />
the capitalized costs to be depleted. The Company capitalizes<br /><br />
interest on expenditures made in connection with exploration and<br /><br />
development<br /><br />
projects<br /><br />
that are<br /><br />
not<br /><br />
subject<br /><br />
to<br /><br />
current<br /><br />
amortization.<br /><br />
Interest is capitalized for the period that<br /><br />
activities are in progress to bring these projects to their<br /><br />
intended use.<br /><br />
During the fourth quarter of 1995, the Company decided to<br /><br />
concentrate on the development of its China investments, and<br /><br />
decided to dispose of its domestic properties. Accordingly, the<br /><br />
recorded value of the Company's domestic properties was reduced<br /><br />
to their estimated fair market value and the resulting balances<br /><br />
were transferred to assets held for sale.<br /><br />
The Company reviews the carrying value of its oil and gas<br /><br />
properties each quarter on a country-by-country basis, and limits<br /><br />
capitalized costs of oil and gas properties to the present value<br /><br />
of estimated future net revenues from proved reserves, discounted<br /><br />
at 10 percent, plus the lower of cost or fair value of unproved<br /><br />
properties as adjusted for related tax effects and deferred tax<br /><br />
reserves. If capitalized costs exceed this limit, the excess is<br /><br />
charged to depreciation, depletion and amortization expense<br /><br />
("DD&amp;A") in the period in which it occurs.<br /><br />
Proceeds from the sale of proved and unproved properties are<br /><br />
accounted for as reductions to capitalized costs with no gain or<br /><br />
loss recognized unless such sales would significantly alter the<br /><br />
relationship between capitalized costs and proved reserves of oil<br /><br />
and gas. Abandonments of properties are accounted for<br /><br />
as<br /><br />
adjustments of capitalized costs with no loss recognized.<br /><br />
The Company accounts for site restoration, dismantlement and<br /><br />
abandonment costs in its estimated future costs of proved<br /><br />
reserves.<br /><br />
Accordingly, such costs are amortized on a unit of<br /><br />
production basis and reflected with accumulated depreciation,<br /><br />
depletion and amortization. The Company identifies and estimates<br /><br />
such costs based upon its assessment of applicable regulatory<br /><br />
requirements, its operating experience and oil and gas industry<br /><br />
practice in the areas within which its properties are located.<br /><br />
To date the Company has not been required to expend any material<br /><br />
amounts to satisfy such obligations. The Company does not expect<br /><br />
that future costs will have a material adverse effect on the<br /><br />
Company's operations, financial condition or cash flows.<br /><br />
The<br /><br />
standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows includes<br /><br />
a deduction for any such costs.<br /><br />
Other Property and Equipment:<br /><br />
---------------------------Other property and equipment primarily consists of furniture<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
fixtures, equipment and software.<br /><br />
Major renewals and<br /><br />
betterments are capitalized while the costs of repairs and<br /><br />
maintenance are charged to expense as incurred.<br /><br />
The costs of<br /><br />
assets retired or otherwise disposed of and the applicable<br /><br />
accumulated depreciation are removed from the accounts, and the<br /><br />
resulting gain or loss is reflected in operations.<br /><br />
Other<br /><br />
property and equipment costs are depreciated using the straightline method over the estimated useful lives of the assets, which<br /><br />
range from 3 to 15 years.<br /><br />
Capitalized Interest and Amortized Debt Costs:<br /><br />
--------------------------------------------During fiscal 1997, 1996 and 1995, interest and associated<br /><br />
costs of approximately $5.8 million, $2.8 million and $3.1<br /><br />
million, respectively were capitalized on significant investments<br /><br />
in<br /><br />
oil<br /><br />
and gas properties that are not being currently<br /><br />
depreciated, depleted, or amortized and on which exploration or<br /><br />
development activities are in progress.<br /><br />
Deferred debt issue<br /><br />
costs and discount on senior secured notes are amortized on the<br /><br />
straight-line basis over the term of the related debt agreement.<br /><br />
The discount on senior secured notes is the amount attributable<br /><br />
to the detachable Common Stock purchase warrants.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Income Taxes:<br /><br />
-----------The Company accounts for income taxes in compliance with<br /><br />
Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 109 (SFAS No.<br /><br />
109) "Accounting for Income Taxes." Requirements by this standard<br /><br />
include recognition of future tax benefits, measured by enacted<br /><br />
tax rates, attributable to: deductible temporary differences<br /><br />
between financial statement and income tax bases of assets and<br /><br />
liabilities; and, net operating loss carryforwards.<br /><br />
Recognition<br /><br />
of such tax assets are limited to the extent that realization of<br /><br />
such benefits is able to be reasonably anticipated.<br /><br />
Revenue Recognition:<br /><br />
------------------Oil and gas revenues are recognized using the accrual method<br /><br />
at the price realized as production and delivery occurs. Amounts<br /><br />
which are contingently receivable are not recognized until<br /><br />
realized.<br /><br />
Foreign Operations<br /><br />
-----------------The Company's future operations and earnings will depend<br /><br />
upon the results of the Company's operations in China. There can<br /><br />
be no assurance that the Company will be able to successfully<br /><br />
conduct such operations, and a failure to do so would have a<br /><br />
material adverse effect on the Company's financial position,<br /><br />
results of operations and cash flows. Also, the success of the<br /><br />
Company's operations will be subject to numerous contingencies,<br /><br />
some<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
which<br /><br />
are beyond management's<br /><br />
control.<br /><br />
These<br /><br />
contingencies include general and regional economic conditions,<br /><br />
prices for crude oil and natural gas, competition and changes in<br /><br />
regulation.<br /><br />
Since the Company is dependent on international<br /><br />
operations, specifically those in China, the Company will be<br /><br />
subject to various additional political, economic and other<br /><br />
uncertainties. Among other risks, the Company's operations will<br /><br />
be subject to the risks of restrictions on transfer of funds;<br /><br />
export duties, quotas and embargoes; domestic and international<br /><br />
customs and tariffs; and changing taxation policies, foreign<br /><br />
exchange restrictions, political conditions and governmental<br /><br />
regulations.<br /><br />
Stock Based Compensation:<br /><br />
-----------------------Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.<br /><br />
123<br /><br />
"Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation," ("SFAS No. 123")<br /><br />
encourages, but does not require companies to record compensation<br /><br />
costs for stock-based compensation plans at fair value.<br /><br />
The<br /><br />
Company has chosen to continue to account for stock-based<br /><br />
employee compensation using the intrinsic value method prescribed<br /><br />
in Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25, "Accounting for<br /><br />
Stock Issued to Employees." Accordingly, compensation cost for<br /><br />
stock options, awards and warrants is measured as the excess, if<br /><br />
any, of the quoted market price of the Company's stock at the<br /><br />
date of the grant over the amount an employee must pay to acquire<br /><br />
the stock.<br /><br />
Earnings Per Share:<br /><br />
-----------------During 1997, the Company adopted Statement of Financial<br /><br />
Accounting Standards No. 128 "Earnings Per Share" ("SFAS No.<br /><br />
128")<br /><br />
and has restated all years presented in accordance<br /><br />
therewith.<br /><br />
SFAS No. 128 requires a dual presentation of basic<br /><br />
and diluted earnings per share ("EPS") on the face of the<br /><br />
statement of operations. Basic EPS is computed by dividing income<br /><br />
available to common stockholders by the weighted average number<br /><br />
of common shares for the period. Diluted EPS reflects the<br /><br />
potential dilution that could occur if securities or other<br /><br />
contracts to issue common stock were exercised or converted into<br /><br />
common stock or resulted in the issuance of common stock that<br /><br />
would then share in earnings.<br /><br />
Environmental Expenditures<br /><br />
--------------------------<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Environmental expenditures relating to current operations<br /><br />
are expensed or capitalized, as appropriate, depending on whether<br /><br />
such expenditures provide future economic benefits. Liabilities<br /><br />
are recognized when the expenditures are considered probable and<br /><br />
can be reasonably estimated. Measurement of liabilities is based<br /><br />
on currently enacted laws and regulations, existing technology<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
undiscounted<br /><br />
site-specific<br /><br />
costs.<br /><br />
Generally,<br /><br />
such<br /><br />
recognition coincides with the Company's commitment to a formal<br /><br />
plan of action.<br /><br />
Common Stock Reverse Split<br /><br />
-------------------------Effective December 17, 1997, the Company amended and<br /><br />
restated its Certificate of Incorporation to effect a one-forfifteen reverse split of the Company's Common Stock. All share<br /><br />
amounts presented herein have been adjusted to reflect the<br /><br />
reverse split.<br /><br />
Recent Accounting Pronouncements<br /><br />
-------------------------------In June 1997, the FASB issued SFAS No. 130, "Reporting<br /><br />
Comprehensive Income", which is effective for the Company's year<br /><br />
ending December 31, 1998. SFAS No. 130 establishes standards for<br /><br />
the reporting and displaying of comprehensive income and its<br /><br />
components.<br /><br />
The Company will be analyzing SFAS No. 130 during<br /><br />
1998 to determine what, if any, additional disclosures will be<br /><br />
required.<br /><br />
In June 1997, the FASB Issued SFAS No. 131, "Disclosures<br /><br />
about Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information", which<br /><br />
is effective the Company's year ended December 31, 1998.<br /><br />
This<br /><br />
statement establishes standards for reporting of information<br /><br />
about operating segments. The Company will be analyzing SFAS No.<br /><br />
131 during 1998 to determine what, if any, additional disclosures<br /><br />
will be required.<br /><br />
(2)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Liquidity and Management's Plan<br /><br />
<br /><br />
The Company, in connection with its 1995 decision to dispose<br /><br />
of its domestic properties, is generating minimal annual revenues<br /><br />
and is devoting all of its efforts toward the development of its<br /><br />
China properties. Although the Company has cash available in the<br /><br />
amount of approximately $32 million as of December 31, 1997<br /><br />
(including restricted cash of approximately $10 million) and a<br /><br />
positive working capital position, management anticipates that<br /><br />
additional funds will be needed to meet all of its development<br /><br />
and exploratory obligations until sufficient cash flows are<br /><br />
generated from anticipated production to sustain its operations<br /><br />
and to fund future development and exploration obligations.<br /><br />
Management plans to generate the additional cash needed<br /><br />
through the sale or financing of its domestic assets held for<br /><br />
sale and the completion of additional equity, debt or joint<br /><br />
venture transactions. There is no assurance, however, that the<br /><br />
Company will be able to sell or finance its assets held for sale<br /><br />
or to complete other transactions in the future at commercially<br /><br />
reasonable terms, if at all, or that it will be able to meet its<br /><br />
future contractual obligations. If production from the China<br /><br />
properties commences in late 1998 or the first half of 1999, as<br /><br />
anticipated, the Company's proportionate share of the related<br /><br />
cash flow will be available to help satisfy cash requirements.<br /><br />
However, there is likewise no assurance that such development<br /><br />
will be successful and production will commence, and that such<br /><br />
cash flow will be available.<br /><br />

(5)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Assets Held for Sale and Investments<br /><br />
Assets Held for Sale<br /><br />
-------------------Domestic Oil and Gas Properties<br /><br />
--------------------------------<br /><br />
<br /><br />
During 1996, the Company was engaged in attempts to sell its<br /><br />
remaining domestic oil and gas properties and had a contract in<br /><br />
place for the sale of the property. Prior to the sale being<br /><br />
consummated, the Company received service of three lawsuits filed<br /><br />
by lessors of the most productive remaining leases, effectively<br /><br />
thwarting the Company's ability to consummate the sale by casting<br /><br />
doubt as to the Company's rights to certain interests in the<br /><br />
leases and demanding damages. While the Company believes that<br /><br />
the charges are without merit, it is of the opinion that the<br /><br />
property cannot be sold until such time as the litigation is<br /><br />
concluded or settled. In response to a request by the lessors'<br /><br />
counsel, the Company has granted the lessors an extension of time<br /><br />
to respond to discovery demands made by the Company and to allow<br /><br />
sufficient time to pursue settlement of this litigation (see Note<br /><br />
11).<br /><br />
As a result of these lawsuits the Company took an<br /><br />
additional writedown of these properties aggregating<br /><br />
$3.85<br /><br />
million during 1996.<br /><br />
Lutcher Moore Tract<br /><br />
------------------During 1993, the Company completed the acquisition of a<br /><br />
group of corporations which together owned 100 percent of an<br /><br />
unevaluated 62,500-acre tract in southeastern Louisiana (the<br /><br />
"Lutcher Moore Tract"). This property is pledged as collateral<br /><br />
for the Lutcher Moore limited recourse debt (see Note 6).<br /><br />
This<br /><br />
property is being held for sale.<br /><br />
