WARRANT CERTIFICATE<br /><br />
THE WARRANTS REPRESENTED BY THIS CERTIFICATE HAVE NOT BEEN<br /><br />
REGISTERED UNDER THE UNITED STATES SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS<br /><br />
AMENDED (THE "ACT"), OR ANY OTHER FEDERAL OR STATE SECURITIES OR<br /><br />
BLUE SKY LAWS OF ANY OTHER DOMESTIC OR FOREIGN JURISDICTION. NO<br /><br />
OFFER, SALE, TRANSFER, PLEDGE OR OTHER DISPOSITION (COLLECTIVELY,<br /><br />
A "DISPOSAL") OF THE WARRANTS REPRESENTED BY THIS CERTIFICATE MAY<br /><br />
BE MADE UNLESS (i) REGISTERED UNDER THE ACT AND ANY APPLICABLE<br /><br />
STATE SECURITIES OR BLUE SKY LAWS OR (ii) XCL LTD. (THE "CO<br /><br />
MPANY") RECEIVES A WRITTEN OPINION OF UNITED STATES LEGAL COUNSEL<br /><br />
IN FORM AND SUBSTANCE SATISFACTORY TO IT TO THE EFFECT THAT SUCH<br /><br />
DISPOSAL IS EXEMPT FROM SUCH REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS.<br /><br />
No. PBC-9<br /><br />
WARRANTS TO PURCHASE<br /><br />
COMMON STOCK OF XCL LTD.<br /><br />
Initial Issuance on June 30, 1998<br /><br />
Void after 5:00 p.m. New York Time, June 30, 2003<br /><br />
<br /><br />
THIS CERTIFIES THAT, for value received, PATRICK B. COLLINS<br /><br />
or registered assigns (the "Holder") is the registered holder of<br /><br />
warrants (the "Warrants") to purchase from XCL Ltd., a Delaware<br /><br />
corporation (the "Company"), at any time or from time to time<br /><br />
beginning on June 30, 1998 and until 5:00 p.m., New York time, on<br /><br />
June 30, 2003 (the "Expiration Date"), subject to the conditions<br /><br />
set forth herein, at the initial exercise price of $3.75 per<br /><br />
share (the "Initial Exercise Price"), subject to adjustment as<br /><br />
set forth herein (the "Exercise Price"), up to an aggregate of<br /><br />
seventeen thousand (17,000) fully paid and non-assessable common<br /><br />
shares, par value $0.01 per share (the "Common Stock"), of the<br /><br />
Company (the "Shares") upon surrender of this warrant certificate<br /><br />
(the "Certificate") and payment of the Exercise Price multiplied<br /><br />
by the number of Shares in respect of which Warrants are then<br /><br />
being exercised (the "Purchase Price") at the principal office of<br /><br />

written opinion of United States legal counsel in form and<br /><br />
substance satisfactory to it to the effect that such Disposal is<br /><br />
exempt from such registration requirements..<br /><br />

(f)<br /><br />
For the purposes of any computation under this<br /><br />
Section 7, the "Market Price per share" of Common Stock on any<br /><br />
date shall be deemed to be the average of the closing bid price<br /><br />
for the 20 consecutive trading days ending on the record date for<br /><br />
the determination of the shareholders entitled to receive any<br /><br />
rights, dividends or distributions described in this Section 7,<br /><br />
and the "Market Value per share" of Common Stock on any date<br /><br />
shall be deemed to be the closing bid price on the date of the<br /><br />
issuance of the securities for which such computation is being<br /><br />
made, as reported on the principal United States securities<br /><br />
exchange on which the Common Stock is listed or admitted to<br /><br />
trading or if the Common Stock is not then listed on any United<br /><br />
States stock exchange, the average of the closing sales price on<br /><br />
each such day during such 20 day period, in the case of the<br /><br />
Market Price computation, or on such date of issuance, in the<br /><br />
case of the Market Value computation, in the over-the-counter<br /><br />
market as reported by the National Association of Securities<br /><br />
Dealers' Automated Quotation System ("NASDAQ"), or, if not so<br /><br />
reported, the average of the closing bid and asked prices on each<br /><br />
such day during such 20 day period in the case of the Market<br /><br />
Price computation, or on such date of issuance, in the case of<br /><br />
the Market Value computation, as reported in the "pink sheets"<br /><br />
published by the National Quotation Bureau, Inc. or any successor<br /><br />
thereof, or, if not so quoted, the average of the middle market<br /><br />
quotations for such 20 day period in the case of the Market Price<br /><br />
computation, or on such date of issuance, in the case of the<br /><br />
Market Value computation, as reported on the daily official list<br /><br />
of the prices of stock listed on The London Stock Exchange<br /><br />
Limited ("The Stock Exchange Daily Official List").<br /><br />
"Trading<br /><br />
day" means any day on which the Common Stock is available for<br /><br />
trading on the applicable securities exchange or<br /><br />
in<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
applicable securities market. In the case of Market Price or<br /><br />
Market Value computations based on The Stock Exchange Daily<br /><br />
Official List, the Market Price or Market Value shall be<br /><br />
converted into United States dollars at the then spot market<br /><br />
exchange rate of pounds sterling (UK) into United States dollars<br /><br />
as quoted by Chemical Bank or any successor bank thereto on the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
date of determination. If a quotation of such exchange rate is<br /><br />
not so available, the exchange rate shall be the exchange rate of<br /><br />
pounds sterling in United States dollars as quoted in The Wall<br /><br />
Street Journal on the date of determination.<br /><br />

not as to fractional Shares). Upon the exercise of less than all<br /><br />
of the Warrants evidenced by this Certificate, the Company shall<br /><br />
forthwith issue to the Holder a new certificate of like tenor<br /><br />
representing the number of unexercised Warrants.<br /><br />
(e)<br /><br />
Subject to compliance with all of<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
conditions set forth herein, upon surrender of this Certificate<br /><br />
to the Company at its principal office, together with the form of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
election to purchase attached hereto duly completed and signed,<br /><br />
and upon payment of the Purchase Price, the Company shall cause<br /><br />
to be delivered promptly to or upon the written order of the<br /><br />
Holder and in such name or names as the Holder may designate, a<br /><br />
share certificate or share certificates for the number of whole<br /><br />
Shares purchased upon the exercise of the Warrants. Such share<br /><br />
certificate or share certificates representing the Shares shall<br /><br />
be free of any restrictive legend. The Company shall ensure that<br /><br />
no "stop transfer" or similar instruction or order with respect<br /><br />
to the Shares purchased upon exercise of the Warrants shall be in<br /><br />
effect at ChaseMellon Shareholders Services, IRG Plc or any suc<br /><br />
cessor transfer agent for the Common Stock of the Company (the<br /><br />
"Transfer Agent").<br /><br />
2.<br /><br />
Payment of Taxes. The Company will pay all documen<br /><br />
tary stamp taxes, if any, attributable to the issuance and<br /><br />
delivery of the Securities; provided, however, that the Company<br /><br />
shall not be required to pay any taxes which may be payable in<br /><br />
respect of any transfer involved in the issuance or delivery of<br /><br />
any Securities or any Shares in any name other than that of the<br /><br />
Holder, which transfer taxes shall be paid by the Holder, and<br /><br />
until payment of such transfer taxes, if any, the Company shall<br /><br />
not be required to issue such Securities.<br /><br />
3.<br /><br />
Compliance with Securities Laws. The Securities<br /><br />
have not been, and are not required<br /><br />
to be, registered under the<br /><br />
United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Act"), or<br /><br />
any other securities or blue sky laws of any other domestic or<br /><br />
foreign jurisdiction (collectively, the "Securities Laws"). No<br /><br />
offer, sale, transfer, pledge or other disposition (collectively,<br /><br />
a "Disposal") of the Securities may be made unless (i) registered<br /><br />
under the Act and any other applicable Securities Laws or (ii)<br /><br />
the Company receives a written opinion of United States legal<br /><br />
counsel in form and substance satisfactory to it to the effect<br /><br />
that such Disposal is exempt from such registration requirements.<br /><br />

6.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Adjustment of Exercise Price and Number of<br /><br />
Shares Issuable.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
The number and kind of Shares purchasable upon the exercise<br /><br />
of each Warrant and the Exercise Price shall be subject to<br /><br />
adjustment from time to time as follows:<br /><br />
(a)<br /><br />
Stock Splits, Combinations, etc. In case<br /><br />
the Company shall hereafter (A) pay a dividend or make a<br /><br />
distribution on its Common Stock in shares of its capital<br /><br />
stock (whether shares of Common Stock or of capital stock of<br /><br />
any other class), (B) subdivide its outstanding shares of<br /><br />
Common Stock or (C) combine its outstanding shares of Common<br /><br />
Stock into a smaller number of shares, the (a) number of<br /><br />
Shares purchasable upon exercise of each Warrant immediately<br /><br />
prior thereto shall be adjusted so that the holder of any<br /><br />
Warrant thereafter exercised shall be entitled to receive<br /><br />
the number of Shares which such holder would have owned<br /><br />
immediately following such action had such Warrant been<br /><br />
exercised immediately prior thereto, and (b) the Exercise<br /><br />
Price shall be adjusted by multiplying such Exercise Price<br /><br />
immediately prior to such adjustment by a fraction, the<br /><br />
numerator of which shall be the number of Shares purchasable<br /><br />
upon the exercise of each Warrant immediately prior to such<br /><br />
adjustment, and the denominator of which shall be the number<br /><br />
of Shares purchasable immediately thereafter. An adjustment<br /><br />
made pursuant to this Section 6(a) shall become effective<br /><br />
immediately after the record date in the case of a dividend<br /><br />
and shall become effective immediately after the effective<br /><br />
date<br /><br />
in<br /><br />
the case of a subdivision, combination<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
reclassification.<br /><br />
If, as a result of an adjustment made<br /><br />
pursuant to this Section 6(a), the holder of any Warrant<br /><br />
thereafter exercised shall become entitled to receive shares<br /><br />
of two or more classes of capital stock of the Company, the<br /><br />
Board of Directors of the Company (whose determination shall<br /><br />
be<br /><br />
conclusive) shall determine the allocation of the<br /><br />
adjusted Exercise Price between or among shares of such<br /><br />
classes of capital stock.<br /><br />
(b)<br /><br />
Reclassification, Combinations, Mergers,<br /><br />
etc.<br /><br />
In case of any reclassification or change<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
outstanding shares of Common Stock (other than as set forth<br /><br />
in paragraph (a) above and other than a change in par value,<br /><br />
or from par value to no par value, or from no par value to<br /><br />
par value), or in case of any consolidation or merger of the<br /><br />
Company with or into another corporation or other entity<br /><br />
(other than a merger in which the Company is the continuing<br /><br />
corporation<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
which<br /><br />
does<br /><br />
not<br /><br />
result<br /><br />
in<br /><br />
any<br /><br />
reclassification or change of the then outstanding shares of<br /><br />
Common Stock or other capital stock of the Company (other<br /><br />
than a change in par value, or from par value to no par<br /><br />
value, or from no par value to par value or as a result of a<br /><br />
subdivision or combination)) or in case of any sale or<br /><br />
conveyance to another corporation or other entity of all or<br /><br />
substantially all of the assets of the Company, then, as a<br /><br />
condition of such reclassification, change, consolidation,<br /><br />
merger, sale or conveyance, the Company or such a successor<br /><br />
or purchasing corporation or other entity, as the case may<br /><br />
be, shall forthwith make lawful and adequate<br /><br />
provision<br /><br />
whereby the holder of such Warrant then outstanding shall<br /><br />
have the right thereafter to receive on exercise of such<br /><br />
Warrant the kind and amount of shares of stock and other<br /><br />
securities<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
property<br /><br />
receivable<br /><br />
upon<br /><br />
such<br /><br />
reclassification, change, consolidation, merger, sale or<br /><br />
conveyance by a holder of the number of shares of Common<br /><br />
Stock issuable upon exercise of such Warrant immediately<br /><br />
<br /><br />
prior<br /><br />
to such reclassification, change, consolidation,<br /><br />
merger,<br /><br />
sale or conveyance and enter into a warrant<br /><br />
amendment so providing. Such provisions shall<br /><br />
include<br /><br />
provision<br /><br />
for adjustments which shall be<br /><br />
as<br /><br />
nearly<br /><br />
equivalent as may be practicable to the adjustments provided<br /><br />
for in this Section 6.<br /><br />
If the issuer of securities<br /><br />
deliverable upon exercise of Warrants under the supplemental<br /><br />
warrant agreement is an affiliate of the formed, surviving<br /><br />
or transferee corporation or other entity, that issuer shall<br /><br />

<br /><br />
consideration, if any, received by the Company upon such<br /><br />
Distribution, and the denominator of which shall be the<br /><br />
product of (A) the total number of shares of Common Stock<br /><br />
outstanding (exclusive of any treasury shares) immediately<br /><br />
after such Distribution multiplied by (B) the current Market<br /><br />
Price per Share of Common Stock (determined pursuant to<br /><br />

to<br /><br />
be<br /><br />
outstanding and the Company shall be deemed to have received<br /><br />

(d)<br /><br />
Dividends and Distributions. In the event<br /><br />
the Company shall, at any time or from time to time after<br /><br />
the date hereof, distribute to all the holders of Common<br /><br />
Stock any dividends or other distribution of cash, evidences<br /><br />
of its indebtedness, other securities or other properties or<br /><br />
assets (in each case other than (i) dividends payable in<br /><br />
Common Stock, Options or Convertible Securities and (ii) any<br /><br />
cash dividend from current or retained earnings), or any<br /><br />
options, warrants or other rights to subscribe for or<br /><br />
purchase any of the foregoing, then (A) the Exercise Price<br /><br />
shall be decreased to a price determined by multiplying the<br /><br />
Exercise Price then in effect by a fraction, the numerator<br /><br />
of which shall be the current Market Price per Share of<br /><br />
Common Stock (determined pursuant to Section 6(f)) on the<br /><br />
record date for such distribution less the sum of (X) the<br /><br />
cash portion, if any, of such distribution per share of<br /><br />
Common Stock outstanding (exclusive of any treasury shares)<br /><br />
on the record date for such distribution plus (Y) the then<br /><br />
fair market value (as determined in good faith by the Board<br /><br />
of Directors of the Company) per share of Common Stock<br /><br />
outstanding (exclusive of any treasury shares) on the record<br /><br />
date for such distribution of that portion, if any, of such<br /><br />
distribution consisting of evidences of indebtedness, other<br /><br />
securities, properties, assets (other than cash), options,<br /><br />
warrants or subscription or purchase rights, and<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
denominator of which shall be such current market price per<br /><br />
share<br /><br />
of Common Stock and (B) the number of Shares<br /><br />
purchasable upon the exercise of each Warrant shall be<br /><br />
increased to a number determined by multiplying the number<br /><br />
of shares of Common Stock so purchasable immediately prior<br /><br />
to the record date for such distribution by a fraction, the<br /><br />
numerator of which shall be the Exercise Price in effect<br /><br />
immediately prior to the adjustment required by clause (A)<br /><br />
of this sentence and the denominator of which shall be the<br /><br />
Exercise Price in effect immediately after such adjustment.<br /><br />
The adjustments required by this Section 6(d) shall be made<br /><br />
whenever any such distribution occurs retroactive to the<br /><br />

to receive such distribution.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(e)<br /><br />
Self-Tenders. In case of the consummation<br /><br />
of a tender or exchange offer (other than an odd-lot tender<br /><br />
offer) made by the Company or any subsidiary of the Company<br /><br />
for all or any portion of the Common Stock to the extent<br /><br />
that the cash and value of any other consideration included<br /><br />
in such payment per share of Common Stock exceeds the first<br /><br />
reported sales price per share of Common Stock on the<br /><br />
trading day next succeeding the last time tenders or<br /><br />
exchanges may be made pursuant to the tender or exchange<br /><br />
offer (the "Expiration Time"), the Exercise Price shall be<br /><br />
reduced so that the same shall equal the price determined by<br /><br />
multiplying the Exercise Price in effect immediately prior<br /><br />
to the Expiration Time by a fraction, the numerator of which<br /><br />
shall be the number of shares of Common Stock outstanding<br /><br />
(including any tendered or exchanged shares)<br /><br />
at<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Expiration Time multiplied by the first reported sales price<br /><br />
of the Common Stock on the trading day next succeeding the<br /><br />
Expiration Time, and the denominator of which shall be the<br /><br />
sum of (A) the fair market value (determined by the Board of<br /><br />
Directors of the Company, whose determination shall be<br /><br />
conclusive and described in a resolution of the Board of<br /><br />
Directors)<br /><br />
of the aggregate consideration payable<br /><br />
to<br /><br />
stockholders based on the acceptance (up to any maximum<br /><br />
specified in the terms of the tender or exchange offer) of<br /><br />
all shares validly tendered or exchanged and not withdrawn<br /><br />
as of the Expiration Time (the shares deemed so accepted, up<br /><br />
to any such maximum, being referred to as the "Purchased<br /><br />
Shares") and (B) the product of the number of shares of<br /><br />
Common Stock outstanding (less any Purchased Shares) on the<br /><br />
Expiration Time and the first reported sales price of the<br /><br />
Common Stock on the trading day next succeeding<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Expiration<br /><br />
Time,<br /><br />
such reduction to become<br /><br />
effective<br /><br />
immediately prior to the opening of business on the day<br /><br />
following the Expiration Time.<br /><br />
(f)<br /><br />
Current Market Price. For the purpose of<br /><br />
any computation of current market price, the current "Market<br /><br />
Price per Share of Common Stock" at any date shall be (x)<br /><br />
for purposes of Section 7 herein (dealing with fractional<br /><br />
interests), the closing price on the trading day immediately<br /><br />
prior to the exercise of the applicable Warrant and (y) in<br /><br />
all other cases, the average of the daily closing prices for<br /><br />
the shorter of (i) the 20 consecutive trading days ending on<br /><br />
the last full trading day on the exchange or market<br /><br />
specified in the second succeeding sentence prior to the<br /><br />
Time of Determination (as defined below) and (ii) the period<br /><br />
commencing on the date next succeeding the first public<br /><br />
announcement of the issuance, sale, distribution or granting<br /><br />
in question through such last full trading day prior to the<br /><br />
Time of Determination. The term "Time of Determination" as<br /><br />
used herein shall be the time and date of the earlier to<br /><br />
occur of (A) the date as of which the current market price<br /><br />
is to be computed and (B) the last full trading day on such<br /><br />
exchange or market before the commencement of "ex-dividend"<br /><br />
trading in the Common Stock relating to the event giving<br /><br />
rise to the adjustment required by paragraph (a), (b), (c)<br /><br />
or (d).<br /><br />
The closing price for any day shall be the last<br /><br />
reported sale price regular way or, in case no such reported<br /><br />
sale takes place on such day, the average of the closing bid<br /><br />
and asked prices regular way for such day, in each case (1)<br /><br />
on the principal national securities exchange on which the<br /><br />
shares of Common Stock are listed or to which such shares<br /><br />
are admitted to trading or (2) if the Common Stock is not<br /><br />
listed or admitted to trading on a national securities<br /><br />
exchange, in the over-the-counter market as reported by the<br /><br />
Nasdaq NMS or any comparable system or (3) if the Common<br /><br />
Stock is not listed on the Nasdaq NMS or a comparable<br /><br />
system, as furnished by two members of the American Stock<br /><br />
Exchange, Inc. selected from time to time in good faith by<br /><br />
the Board of Directors of the Company for that purpose.<br /><br />
In<br /><br />
the absence of all of the foregoing, or if for any other<br /><br />
reason the current Market Price per Share cannot<br /><br />
be<br /><br />
determined pursuant to the foregoing provisions of this<br /><br />
Section 6(f), the current Market Price per Share shall be<br /><br />
the fair market value thereof as determined in good faith by<br /><br />
the Board of Directors of the Company.<br /><br />
shall<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(g)<br /><br />
Certain Distributions. If the Company<br /><br />

<br /><br />
in Options or Convertible Securities, then, for purposes of<br /><br />

(h)<br /><br />
Consideration Received. If any shares of<br /><br />
Common Stock, Options or Convertible Securities shall be<br /><br />
issued, sold or distributed for a consideration other than<br /><br />
cash, the amount of the consideration other than cash<br /><br />
received by the Company in respect thereof shall be deemed<br /><br />

determined in good faith by the Board of Directors of the<br /><br />
Company). If any Options shall be issued in connection with<br /><br />
the issuance and sale of other securities of the Company,<br /><br />
together comprising one integral transaction in which no<br /><br />
specific consideration is allocated to such Options by the<br /><br />
parties thereto, such Options shall be deemed to have been<br /><br />
issued without consideration; provided, however, that if<br /><br />
such Options have an exercise price equal to or greater than<br /><br />
the current Market Price per Share of the Common Stock on<br /><br />
the date of issuance of such Options, then such Options<br /><br />
shall be deemed to have been issued for consideration equal<br /><br />
to such exercise price.<br /><br />
(i)<br /><br />
Deferral of Certain Adjustments.<br /><br />
No<br /><br />
adjustment to the Exercise Price (including the related<br /><br />
adjustment to the number of Shares purchasable upon the<br /><br />
exercise of each Warrant) shall be required hereunder unless<br /><br />
such adjustment, together with other adjustments carried<br /><br />
forward as provided below, would result in an increase or<br /><br />
decrease of at least one percent (1%) of the Exercise Price;<br /><br />
provided, however, that any adjustments which by reason of<br /><br />
this paragraph (i) are not required to be made shall be<br /><br />
carried forward and taken into account in any subsequent<br /><br />
adjustment. No adjustment need be made for a change in the<br /><br />
par value of the Common Stock. All calculations under this<br /><br />
Section 6 shall be made to the nearest 1/1,000 of one cent<br /><br />
or to the nearest l/1,000th of a Share, as the case may be.<br /><br />
(j)<br /><br />
Changes in Options and Convertible<br /><br />
Securities.<br /><br />
If the exercise price provided for in any<br /><br />
Options referred to in Section 6(c) above, the additional<br /><br />
consideration, if any, payable upon the conversion or<br /><br />
exchange of any Convertible Securities referred to in<br /><br />
Section 6(c) above, or the rate at which any Convertible<br /><br />
Securities referred to in Section 6(c) above are convertible<br /><br />
into or exchangeable for Common Stock shall change at any<br /><br />
time (other than under or by reason of provisions designed<br /><br />
to protect against dilution upon an event which results in a<br /><br />
related adjustment pursuant to this Section 6), the Exercise<br /><br />
Price then in effect and the number of Shares purchasable<br /><br />
upon the exercise of each Warrant shall forthwith be<br /><br />
readjusted (effective only with respect to any exercise of<br /><br />
any Warrant after such readjustment) to the Exercise Price<br /><br />
and number of Shares so purchasable that would then be in<br /><br />
effect had the adjustment made upon the issuance, sale,<br /><br />
distribution or granting of such Options or Convertible<br /><br />
Securities been made based upon such changed purchase price,<br /><br />
additional consideration or conversion rate, as the case may<br /><br />
be, but only with respect to such Options and Convertible<br /><br />
Securities as then remain outstanding.<br /><br />
(k)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Expiration of Options and Convertible<br /><br />
Securities.<br /><br />
If, at any time after any adjustment to the<br /><br />
number of Shares purchasable upon the exercise of each<br /><br />
Warrant shall have been made pursuant to Sections 6(c) or<br /><br />
(j) above or this Section 6(k), any Options or Convertible<br /><br />
Securities shall have expired unexercised, the number of<br /><br />
such Shares so purchasable shall, upon such Expiration, be<br /><br />
readjusted and shall thereafter be such as they would have<br /><br />
been had they been originally adjusted (or had the original<br /><br />
adjustment not been required, as the case may be) as if (i)<br /><br />
the only shares of Common Stock deemed to have been issued<br /><br />
in connection with such Options or Convertible Securities<br /><br />
were the shares of Common Stock, if any, actually issued or<br /><br />
sold upon the exercise of such Options or Convertible<br /><br />
Securities and (ii) such shares of Common Stock, if any,<br /><br />
were issued or sold for the consideration actually received<br /><br />
by the Company upon such exercise plus the aggregate<br /><br />
consideration, if any, actually received by the Company for<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the issuance, sale, distribution or granting of all such<br /><br />
Options or Convertible Securities, whether or not exercised;<br /><br />
provided, however, that no such readjustment shall have the<br /><br />
effect<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
decreasing the number of such shares<br /><br />
so<br /><br />
purchasable by an amount (calculated by adjusting such<br /><br />
decrease to account for all other adjustments made pursuant<br /><br />
to this Section 6 following the date of the original<br /><br />
adjustment referred to above) in excess of the amount of the<br /><br />
adjustment initially made in respect of the issuance, sale,<br /><br />
distribution or granting of such Options or Convertible<br /><br />
Securities.<br /><br />

the nearest whole cent or (ii) aggregate all such fractional<br /><br />
shares into a whole number of shares and sell such aggregated<br /><br />
fractional shares on behalf of the holders entitled thereto in a<br /><br />
public or private sale and distribute the net cash proceeds from<br /><br />
the sale thereof to such holders pro rata. While the Company<br /><br />
will endeavor to use its best efforts to secure the best<br /><br />
available sales price for such aggregated fractional shares, such<br /><br />
price shall not necessarily be the highest price obtainable for<br /><br />
such shares. Holders of Warrants, by their acceptances of this<br /><br />
Warrant Certificate, expressly waive any and all rights to<br /><br />
receive any fraction of a share of Common Stock or a stock<br /><br />
certificate or scrip representing a fraction of a share of Common<br /><br />
Stock.<br /><br />

CONSULTING AGREEMENT<br /><br />
<br /><br />
THIS CONSULTING AGREEMENT ("Agreement"), effective as<br /><br />
of June 15, 1998 and expiring on the later of March 31, 1999 or<br /><br />
the date on which the Company fileds its 1998 Form 10-K report<br /><br />
with the Securities and Exchange Commisison, by and between XCL<br /><br />
Ltd., a Delaware corporation., with offices at 110 Rue Jean<br /><br />
Lafitte, Lafayette, Louisiana 70508 (hereinafter the "Company")<br /><br />
and Patrick B. Collins, 14018 Taylorcrest, Houston, Texas 77079<br /><br />
(hereinafter "Consultant").<br /><br />
W I T N E S S E T H:<br /><br />
WHEREAS, Consultant has substantial experience and<br /><br />
ability in financial reporting and oil and gas accounting; and<br /><br />
WHEREAS, the Company desires to retain and secure for<br /><br />
itself the experience and ability of Consultant for the purpose<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
assisting<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Company with its<br /><br />
financial<br /><br />
reporting<br /><br />
requirements; and<br /><br />
WHEREAS, the Company and Consultant desire to enter<br /><br />
into a consulting agreement to set forth this proposed consulting<br /><br />
relationship;<br /><br />
NOW, THEREFORE, the parties to this Agreement<br /><br />
agree as follows:<br /><br />
<br /><br />
hereby<br /><br />
<br /><br />
ARTICLE I<br /><br />
Rights and Duties Under Consulting Agreement<br /><br />
1.1<br /><br />
Term of Agreement and Duties.<br /><br />
The Company<br /><br />
and Consultant agree that for the period commencing June 15, 1998<br /><br />
and expiring on the later of March 31, 1999 or the date on which<br /><br />
the company files its 1998 Form 10-K report with the Securities<br /><br />
and Exchange Commission, Consultant shall perform consulting<br /><br />
services for the Company with regard to the financial reporting<br /><br />
obligations of the Company, including oil and gas accounting<br /><br />
matters, review of 1998 financial statements, presentation of<br /><br />
financial statements, projections and footnotes thereto in any<br /><br />
debt<br /><br />
and equity offering memoranda of the Company.<br /><br />
The<br /><br />
Consultant's duty will also assist the Company and its outside<br /><br />
auditors with regard to any activity involving the preparation or<br /><br />
review of 1998 quarterly 10-Q reports, the annual 1998 10-K<br /><br />
report, and any Securities and Exchange Commission filign or<br /><br />
report the Company is required to file during the term of this<br /><br />
agreement.<br /><br />

shares of Common Stock of the Company at an exercise price of<br /><br />
$3.75 per share, exercisable for a five-year period.<br /><br />

1.7<br /><br />
Confidentiality of<br /><br />
Company's<br /><br />
Business.<br /><br />
Consultant acknowledges that the Company's business is highly<br /><br />
competitive and that the Company's books, records and documents,<br /><br />
the Company's technical information concerning its products,<br /><br />
equipment, services and processes, procurement procedures and<br /><br />
pricing techniques, the names of and other information (such as<br /><br />
credit and financial data) concerning the Company's customers and<br /><br />
business<br /><br />
affiliates,<br /><br />
all<br /><br />
comprise<br /><br />
confidential<br /><br />
business<br /><br />
information and trade secrets of the Company and are valuable,<br /><br />
special,<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
unique proprietary assets<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
Company<br /><br />
("Confidential Information"). Consultant further acknowledges<br /><br />
that protection of Company's Confidential Information against<br /><br />
unauthorized disclosure and use is of critical importance to the<br /><br />
company in maintaining its competitive position.<br /><br />
Accordingly,<br /><br />
Consulting hereby agrees that he will not, at any time during or<br /><br />
after the term of this Agreement, make any disclosure of any<br /><br />
Confidential Information, or make any use thereof, except for the<br /><br />
benefit of, and on behalf of, the Company.<br /><br />
However, the<br /><br />
Consultant's obligation under this Section 1.7 shall not extend<br /><br />
to information which is or becomes part of the public domain or<br /><br />
is available to the public by publication or otherwise than<br /><br />
through the Consultant. The provisions of this Section 1.7 shall<br /><br />
survive the termination of this Agreement. Money damages would<br /><br />
not be sufficient remedy for breach of this Section 1.7 by<br /><br />
Consultant, and the Company shall be entitled to specific<br /><br />
performance and injunctive relief as remedies for such breach or<br /><br />
any threatened breach. Such remedies for a breach of this<br /><br />
Section 1.7 by the Consultant, but shall be in addition to all<br /><br />
remedies available at law or in equity to the Company including<br /><br />
the recovery of damages from the Consultant. For the purposes of<br /><br />
this paragraph, the term Company shall also include affiliates of<br /><br />
the Company.<br /><br />
1.8<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Covenants of Consultant.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Consultant agrees to<br /><br />
<br /><br />
use his best efforts, skill and abilities so long as Consultant's<br /><br />
Services are retained hereunder to promote the best interest of<br /><br />
Company and its business. As part of the consideration for the<br /><br />
compensation to be paid to Consultant hereunder, and as an<br /><br />
additional incentive for the Company to enter<br /><br />
into<br /><br />
this<br /><br />
Agreement, Company and Consultant agree to the noncompetitive<br /><br />
provisions of this Section 1.8.<br /><br />
During the term of this<br /><br />
Agreement, Consultant agrees that:<br /><br />
(i)<br /><br />
Consultant will not directly or indirectly for<br /><br />
himself or for others consult, advise, counsel or<br /><br />
otherwise assist any customer, supplier, or direct<br /><br />
competitor of the Company or an affiliate on any matter<br /><br />
involving the Company that, in any manner, would have,<br /><br />
or is likely to have, an adverse effect upon the<br /><br />
Company or any affiliate;<br /><br />
(ii)<br /><br />
Consultant will not knowingly or intentionally<br /><br />
do or say any act or thing which will or may impair,<br /><br />
damage, or destroy the food will and esteem of the<br /><br />
Company with any of its suppliers, employees, and<br /><br />
others who may at any time have or have hd business<br /><br />
relations with the Company;<br /><br />
(iii)<br /><br />
Consultant will not reveal to any third<br /><br />
person any differences of opinion, if there be such at<br /><br />
any time, between him and the management of the Company<br /><br />
as to the Company's personnel, policies, practices or<br /><br />
prospects; and<br /><br />
(iv)<br /><br />
Consultant will not knowingly or intentionally<br /><br />
do any act or thing detrimental to the Company or its<br /><br />
business.<br /><br />
Consultant understands that the foregoing restrictions may<br /><br />
limit Consultant's ability to engage in a business similar to the<br /><br />
Company's business during the period provided for above, but<br /><br />
acknowledges that Consultant will receive sufficiently high<br /><br />
remuneration and other benefits from the Company hereunder to<br /><br />
justify such restrictions. The Company shall be entitled to<br /><br />
enforce the provisions of this Section 1.8 by resorting to<br /><br />
appropriate legal and equitable action.<br /><br />
It is expressly understood and agreed that the Company and<br /><br />
Consultant consider the restrictions contained in this Section<br /><br />
1.8 to be reasonable and necessary for the purposes of preserving<br /><br />
and protecting the goodwill and Confidential Information and<br /><br />
proprietary information of the Company. Nevertheless, if any of<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
aforesaid restrictions are found by a<br /><br />
court<br /><br />
having<br /><br />
jurisdiction to be unreasonable, or over broad as to geographic<br /><br />
area or time, or otherwise unenforceable, the parties intend for<br /><br />
the restrictions therein set forth to be modified by such court<br /><br />
so as to be reasonable and enforceable and, as so modified by the<br /><br />
court, to be fully enforced.<br /><br />

ARTICLE II<br /><br />
Miscellaneous<br /><br />
2.1<br /><br />
Succession.<br /><br />
This Agreement shall inure to<br /><br />
the benefit of and be binding upon the Company, its successors<br /><br />
and assigns, and upon Consultant. Consultant shall be prohibited<br /><br />
from assigning this Agreement without prior written approval of<br /><br />
the Company.<br /><br />
2.2<br /><br />
Notice.<br /><br />
Any notice to be given to the<br /><br />
Company hereunder shall be deemed sufficient if addressed to the<br /><br />
Company in writing and personally delivered or mailed<br /><br />
by<br /><br />
certified mail to its office at the address set forth above. Any<br /><br />
notice to be given to Consultant hereunder shall be sufficient if<br /><br />
addressed to it in writing and personally delivered or mailed by<br /><br />
certified mail to its address set forth above. Either party may,<br /><br />
by notice as aforesaid, designate a different address for the<br /><br />
receipt of notice.<br /><br />
2.3<br /><br />
Amendment.<br /><br />
This Agreement may not be<br /><br />
amended or supplemented in any respect, except by a subsequent<br /><br />
written instrument entered into by both parties hereto.<br /><br />
2.5<br /><br />
Severability.<br /><br />
In the event any provision of<br /><br />
this<br /><br />
Agreement shall be held to be illegal, invalid<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
unenforceable for any reasons, the illegality, invalidity, or<br /><br />
unenforceablity thereof shall not affect the remaining provisions<br /><br />
hereof, but such illegal, invalid, or unenforceable provision<br /><br />
shall be fully severable and this Agreement shall be construed<br /><br />
and enforced as if the illegal, invalid, or unenforceable<br /><br />
provision had never been included herein.<br /><br />

occurred if (Y) any "person" (as such term is used in Section<br /><br />
13(d) and 14(d) of the Exchange Act), other than XCL or any<br /><br />

power of XCL's then outstanding securities, unless such person<br /><br />
owns, directly or indirectly, as of the date the Plan is amended,<br /><br />
more than 25% of the combined voting power of XCL's then<br /><br />
outstanding securities, in which case, if any such person (a<br /><br />
"Major Stockholder") becomes the beneficial owner, directly or<br /><br />
indirectly, of 33a% or more of the combined voting power of XCL's<br /><br />
then outstanding securities; provided, further, however, that<br /><br />
acquisition of 33a% or more of such combined voting power shall<br /><br />
not constitute a "change in control of XCL" if (1) such combined<br /><br />
voting power does not exceed 372% or more of the combined voting<br /><br />
power of XCL's then outstanding securities, and (2) either (i) to<br /><br />
the extent any such increase in a Major Stockholder's beneficial<br /><br />
ownership results from a redemption or purchase by XCL of its<br /><br />
securities, or (ii) if the Board of Directors of XCL, by vote of<br /><br />
two-thirds (b) of the full Board, in good faith, determines<br /><br />
(hereinafter referred to as a "Determination") both (A) that such<br /><br />
acquisition does not constitute, in fact, a change in the control<br /><br />
of XCL and (B) that such Major Stockholder does not and cannot<br /><br />
then control XCL or (Z) during any period of two consecutive<br /><br />
years prior to the date of such Determination, individuals who at<br /><br />
the beginning of such period constituted the Board of Directors<br /><br />
cease for any reason to constitute at least a majority thereof,<br /><br />
unless the election of each director who was not a director at<br /><br />
the beginning of such period has been approved in advance by<br /><br />
directors representing at least two-thirds of the directors then<br /><br />
in office who were directors at the beginning of the period.<br /><br />
Further notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement or the<br /><br />
Plan to the contrary, upon the occurrence of a "change in control<br /><br />
of XCL" and the lapse of the Forfeiture Restrictions on the<br /><br />
Shares resulting therefrom, Grantee shall have the right at any<br /><br />
time during the sixty-day period immediately following such<br /><br />
"change<br /><br />
in control of XCL" to require the Company to purchase<br /><br />
from Grantee at their then Fair Market Value up to 40% (as<br /><br />
elected by Grantee) of the Shares as to which the Forfeiture<br /><br />
Restrictions lapsed as a result of such "change in control of<br /><br />
XCL". Grantee shall exercise the put option provided pursuant to<br /><br />
the<br /><br />
preceding sentence by written notice to the<br /><br />
Company<br /><br />
specifying the number of Shares which Grantee demands that the<br /><br />
Company purchase. The purchase price for Shares purchased by the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Company<br /><br />
from Grantee pursuant to the put option provided<br /><br />
hereunder shall be paid in cash and in full no later than thirty<br /><br />
days after the date of Grantee's notice to Company of Grantee's<br /><br />
exercise of the put option provided herein and tender of the<br /><br />
Shares as to which such put option is being exercised.<br /><br />
3.<br /><br />

The number of<br /><br />
Shares subject hereto shall be proportionately adjusted for any<br /><br />
increase or decrease in the number of issued Shares resulting<br /><br />
from the subdivision or consolidation of Shares, or the payment<br /><br />
of a stock dividend on the Shares or increase in the Shares<br /><br />
outstanding effected without receipt of consideration by the<br /><br />
Company, provided that any fractional Shares resulting from such<br /><br />
adjustments shall be eliminated.<br /><br />
If the Company shall at any time merge or consolidate with<br /><br />
or into another corporation, Grantee (or other party entitled to<br /><br />
the Award) will thereafter receive the securities or property to<br /><br />
which a holder of the number of Shares then deliverable upon the<br /><br />
lapse of the Forfeiture Restrictions of the Award would have been<br /><br />
entitled upon such merger or consolidation, and the Company shall<br /><br />
take such steps in connection with such merger or consolidation<br /><br />
as may be necessary to assure that provisions of the Plan shall<br /><br />
thereafter be applicable, as nearly as reasonably may be, in<br /><br />
relation to any securities or property thereafter deliverable<br /><br />
upon lapse of the Forfeiture Restrictions of the Award. A sale<br /><br />
of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company for a<br /><br />
consideration<br /><br />
(apart from the assumption<br /><br />
of<br /><br />
obligations)<br /><br />
constituted primarily of securities shall be deemed a merger or<br /><br />

the<br /><br />
Company, other than pursuant to a merger or consolidation as<br /><br />
hereinabove provided, the Forfeiture Restrictions on the Award<br /><br />

days (or such shorter period as shall elapse between the date the<br /><br />

Date.<br /><br />
This Option shall not terminate upon the Optionee's<br /><br />

than termination of such employment by the Company for "cause" or<br /><br />
