PREAMBLE<br /><br />
This Contract is entered into in Beijing on this 20th<br /><br />
_____ day of August of 1998 by and between China National<br /><br />
Petroleum Development Corporation (hereafter abbreviated as<br /><br />
"CNPC"), a company organized and existing under the laws of<br /><br />
the People's Republic of China, having its headquarters<br /><br />
domiciled in Beijing, the People's Republic of China, as one<br /><br />
<br /><br />
71<br /><br />
<br /><br />
part; and XCL Cathay Ltd., an international business company<br /><br />
organized under the laws of the British Virgin Islands with<br /><br />
corporate headquarters domiciled in Roadtown, Tortola,<br /><br />
B.V.I., (hereafter referred to as the "Foreign Contractor"),<br /><br />
and being a subsidiary of XCL Ltd., a company organized and<br /><br />
existing under the laws of the State of Delaware, United<br /><br />
States of America, having its corporate headquarters<br /><br />
domiciled in Delaware, as the other part.<br /><br />
WITNESSETH<br /><br />
WHEREAS, all Petroleum resources under the territory,<br /><br />
internal water, territorial sea, and continental shelf of<br /><br />
the People's Republic of China and under all sea areas<br /><br />
within the limits of national jurisdiction over the maritime<br /><br />
resources of the People's Republic of China are owned by the<br /><br />
People's Republic of China;<br /><br />
WHEREAS, the State Council of the People's Republic of<br /><br />
China has authorized CNPC to be responsible for the<br /><br />
negotiation, signature and implementation of the contracts<br /><br />
for the exploitation of China's onshore Petroleum resources<br /><br />
in cooperation with foreign enterprises and to have the<br /><br />
exclusive right to explore for, develop, produce and market<br /><br />
the Petroleum of the Contract Area; and<br /><br />
WHEREAS, the Foreign Contractor desires and agrees to<br /><br />
provide funds, and apply its appropriate and advanced<br /><br />
technology and managerial experience to cooperate with CNPC<br /><br />
for the exploitation of Petroleum resources within the<br /><br />
Contract Area and agrees to be subject to the laws, decrees,<br /><br />
and other rules and regulations of the People's Republic of<br /><br />
China in the implementation of the Contract.<br /><br />
NOW, THEREFORE IT IS MUTUALLY AGREED as hereafter set<br /><br />
forth:<br /><br />
Article 1<br /><br />
Definitions<br /><br />
The following words and terms used in the Contract<br /><br />
shall have, unless otherwise specified in the Contract, the<br /><br />
following meaning:<br /><br />
1.1 "Petroleum" means Crude Oil and Natural Gas<br /><br />
deposited in the subsurface and being extracted or already<br /><br />
extracted, including any valuable non-hydrocarbon substances<br /><br />
produced in association with Crude Oil and/or Natural Gas<br /><br />
separated or extracted therefrom.<br /><br />
1.2 "Crude Oil" means solid and liquid hydrocarbons in<br /><br />
their natural states and also includes any liquid<br /><br />
hydrocarbons extracted from Natural Gas except for methane<br /><br />
(CH4).<br /><br />
1.3 "Natural Gas" means Non-associated Natural Gas and<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas in their natural state.<br /><br />
1.4 "Non-associated Natural Gas" means all gaseous<br /><br />
hydrocarbons produced from gas reservoirs, and includes wet<br /><br />
gas, dry gas and residue gas remaining after the extraction<br /><br />
of liquid hydrocarbons from wet gas.<br /><br />
1.5 "Associated Natural Gas" means all gaseous<br /><br />
hydrocarbons produced in association with Crude Oil from oil<br /><br />
reservoirs, and includes residue gas remaining after the<br /><br />
extraction of liquid hydrocarbons therefrom.<br /><br />
1.6 "Oil Field" means an accumulation of Petroleum<br /><br />
within the Contract Area composed of one or several oilbearing zones, within one trap or within traps of the same,<br /><br />
independent geological structure, which may or may not be<br /><br />
complicated by faulting, and which has been determined to be<br /><br />
of commercial value in accordance with the procedures<br /><br />
stipulated in Article 11 hereof.<br /><br />
1.7 "Gas Field" means an accumulation of Petroleum<br /><br />
within the Contract Area composed of one or several gas-<br /><br />
<br /><br />
bearing zones, within one trap or traps of the same,<br /><br />
independent geological structure, which may or may not be<br /><br />
complicated by faulting, and which has been determined to be<br /><br />
of commercial value in accordance with the procedures<br /><br />
stipulated in Article 18 hereof.<br /><br />
1.8 "Petroleum Operations" means the Appraisal<br /><br />
Operations, the Development Operations, the Production<br /><br />
Operations, and other activities related to these Operations<br /><br />
carried out under the Contract.<br /><br />
1.9 "Appraisal Operations" means operations carried<br /><br />
out for the purpose of confirming Petroleum-bearing traps by<br /><br />
means of geological, geophysical, geochemical and other<br /><br />
methods; all the work undertaken to determine the<br /><br />
commerciality of traps in which Petroleum has been<br /><br />
discovered including Appraisal Well drilling and feasibility<br /><br />
studies, Trial Production, formulation of the Overall<br /><br />
Development Program; and activities related to all such<br /><br />
operations.<br /><br />
1.10 "Development Operations" means operations carried<br /><br />
out for the realization of Petroleum production from the<br /><br />
date of approval of the Overall Development Program for any<br /><br />
Oil Field and/or Gas Field by the Department or Unit,<br /><br />
including design, construction, installation, drilling, and<br /><br />
the related research work as well as production activities<br /><br />
carried out before the Date of Commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production.<br /><br />
1.11 "Production Operations" means operations and all<br /><br />
activities related thereto carried out for Petroleum<br /><br />
production of an Oil Field and/or Gas Field from the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of Commercial Production, such as extraction,<br /><br />
injection, stimulation, treatment, storage, transportation,<br /><br />
lifting, etc.<br /><br />
1.12 "Progressive Appraisal and Development Program"<br /><br />
means an operational procedure during which Appraisal<br /><br />
Operations and Development Operations are conducted during<br /><br />
the appraisal period and development and production period<br /><br />
and during which Trial Production, if feasible, is conducted<br /><br />
simultaneously with Appraisal Operations and/or Development<br /><br />
Operations.<br /><br />
1.13 "Basic Block" means a section of the surface of<br /><br />
the earth bounded by the segments of longitude and latitude<br /><br />
of equal distance of ten (10) minutes.<br /><br />
demarcated on the<br /><br />
map as Annex I hereto.<br /><br />
1.14 "Contract Area" means a surface area demarcated<br /><br />
with geographic coordinates for the cooperative exploitation<br /><br />
of Petroleum resources, and in the Contract, means the<br /><br />
surface area stipulated in Article 3.1 hereof.<br /><br />
1.15 "Appraisal Area" means a surface area within the<br /><br />
Contract Area which has not been relinquished before the<br /><br />
expiration of the appraisal period and in which Development<br /><br />
Operations have not begun.<br /><br />
1.16 "Development Area" means a portion of the<br /><br />
Contract Area covering an Oil Field and/or Gas Field and any<br /><br />
potential contiguous extension areas to such Field(s) within<br /><br />
the Contract Area which has been designated for development.<br /><br />
The Development Area(s) shall be proposed by the Operator,<br /><br />
demarcated by the Joint Management Committee ("JMC") and<br /><br />
delineated as such in the Overall Development Program<br /><br />
approved by the Department or Unit.<br /><br />
1.17 "Production Area" means a surface area within any<br /><br />
Development Area for the purpose of the performance of the<br /><br />
Production Operations within the said Development Area after<br /><br />
completion of the Development Operations.<br /><br />
1.18 "Date of Commencement of Commercial Production"<br /><br />
means, in respect of each Oil Field, the date on which a<br /><br />
cumulative total of sixty thousand (60,000) metric tons of<br /><br />
Crude Oil shall have been extracted and delivered out of the<br /><br />
Field; in respect of each Gas Field, the date on which a<br /><br />
cumulative total of sixty million (60,000,000) cubic meters<br /><br />
<br /><br />
of Natural Gas (under standard atmospheric conditions) shall<br /><br />
have been extracted and delivered out of the Field. If any<br /><br />
field produces both oil and gas, and if the gas is sold,<br /><br />
then the net amount received by the Parties for the gas sold<br /><br />
shall be converted, on an equivalent dollar basis, into a<br /><br />
volume of oil.<br /><br />
1.19 "Calendar Year" means a period of twelve (12)<br /><br />
consecutive Gregorian months under the Gregorian Calendar,<br /><br />
beginning on the first day of January and ending on the<br /><br />
thirty-first day of December of the same year.<br /><br />
1.20 "Contract Year" means a period of twelve (12)<br /><br />
consecutive Gregorian months under the Gregorian Calendar,<br /><br />
within the term of the Contract, beginning on the effective<br /><br />
date of the Contract or any anniversary thereof.<br /><br />
1.21 "Production Year" means, in respect of each Oil<br /><br />
Field and/or Gas Field, a period of twelve (12) consecutive<br /><br />
Gregorian months under the Gregorian Calendar beginning on<br /><br />
the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production of such<br /><br />
Field or any anniversary thereof.<br /><br />
1.22 "Calendar Quarter" means a period of three (3)<br /><br />
consecutive Gregorian months under the Gregorian Calendar<br /><br />
beginning on the first day of January, the first day of<br /><br />
April, the first day of July, or the first day of October.<br /><br />
1.23 "Exploratory Well" means any Wildcat and/or<br /><br />
Appraisal Well drilled within the exploration period,<br /><br />
including dryhole(s) and discovery well(s).<br /><br />
1.24 "Wildcat" means a well drilled on any geological<br /><br />
trap for the purpose of searching for Petroleum<br /><br />
accumulations, including wells drilled for the purpose of<br /><br />
obtaining geological and geophysical parameters.<br /><br />
1.25 "Appraisal Well" means any well drilled for the<br /><br />
purpose of evaluating the commerciality of a geological trap<br /><br />
in which Petroleum has been or may be discovered.<br /><br />
1.26 "Development Well" means a well drilled after the<br /><br />
date of approval of the Overall Development Program for the<br /><br />
purpose of producing Petroleum, increasing production or<br /><br />
accelerating extraction of Petroleum, including production<br /><br />
wells, injection wells and dry holes.<br /><br />
Any Appraisal Well<br /><br />
drilled during the production period shall be deemed a<br /><br />
Development Well.<br /><br />
1.27 "Work Program" means all types of plans<br /><br />
formulated for the performance of the Petroleum Operations,<br /><br />
including plans for appraisal, development and production.<br /><br />
1.28 "Overall Development Program" means a plan<br /><br />
prepared by the Operator for the development of an Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field which has been reviewed and adopted by JMC,<br /><br />
confirmed by CNPC and approved by the Department or Unit and<br /><br />
such plan shall include, but shall not be limited to,<br /><br />
recoverable reserves, the Development Well pattern, master<br /><br />
design, production profile, economic analysis and time<br /><br />
schedule of the Development Operations.<br /><br />
1.29 "Deemed Interest" means interest on the<br /><br />
development costs calculated in accordance with the rate of<br /><br />
interest stipulated in Article 12.2.3.2. hereof when the<br /><br />
development costs incurred in each Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field within the Contract Area are recovered by the Parties.<br /><br />
1.30 "Oil Field and/or Gas Field Straddling a<br /><br />
Boundary" means an Oil Field and/or Gas Field extending from<br /><br />
the Contract Area to one or more other contract areas and/or<br /><br />
areas in respect of which no Petroleum contracts have been<br /><br />
signed.<br /><br />
1.31 "Annual Gross Production of Natural Gas" means<br /><br />
the total amount of Natural Gas produced from each Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field within the Contract Area considered<br /><br />
separately in each Calendar Year, less the amount of Natural<br /><br />
Gas used for Petroleum Operations and the amount of losses,<br /><br />
and which is saved and measured by a measuring device at the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Delivery Point as defined in Article 1.43 herein.<br /><br />
1.32 "Annual Gross Production of Crude Oil" means the<br /><br />
total amount of Crude Oil produced from each Oil Field<br /><br />
within the Contract Area considered separately in each<br /><br />
Calendar Year, less the amount of Crude Oil used for<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations and the amount of losses, which is<br /><br />
saved and measured by a measuring device at the Delivery<br /><br />
Point as defined in Article 1.43 herein.<br /><br />
1.33 "Basement" means igneous rocks, metamorphic rocks<br /><br />
or rocks of such nature which, or formations below which,<br /><br />
could not contain Petroleum deposits in accordance with the<br /><br />
knowledge generally accepted in the international oil<br /><br />
industry; and shall also include such impenetrable rock<br /><br />
substances as salt domes, mud domes and any other rocks<br /><br />
which make further drilling impracticable or economically<br /><br />
unjustifiable by the modern drilling technology normally<br /><br />
utilized in the international oil industry.<br /><br />
1.34 "Contractor" means the Foreign Contractor<br /><br />
specified in the Preamble hereto, including assignee(s) in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 23 hereof.<br /><br />
1.35<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"Parties" means CNPC and Contractor.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
1.36 "Operator" means an entity responsible for the<br /><br />
performance of the Petroleum Operations under the Contract.<br /><br />
1.37 "Subcontractor" means an entity which provides<br /><br />
the Operator with goods or services for the purpose of<br /><br />
implementing the Contract.<br /><br />
1.38 "Third Party" means an individual or entity<br /><br />
except CNPC, the Contractor and any of their Affiliates.<br /><br />
1.39 "Chinese Personnel" means any citizen of the<br /><br />
People's Republic of China, including CNPC's personnel and<br /><br />
Chinese citizens employed by the Contractor and/or the<br /><br />
Subcontractor(s), involved in Petroleum Operations under the<br /><br />
Contract.<br /><br />
1.40 "Expatriate Employee" means any person employed<br /><br />
by the Contractor, Subcontractor(s), or CNPC who is not a<br /><br />
citizen of the People's Republic of China. Overseas Chinese<br /><br />
who reside abroad and have the nationality of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China and other overseas Chinese abroad, when<br /><br />
they are employed by the Contractor, Subcontractor(s) or<br /><br />
CNPC shall also be deemed to be Expatriate Employees within<br /><br />
the scope of the Contract.<br /><br />
1.41<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"Affiliate" means in respect of the Contractor:<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(a) any entity in which any company comprising the<br /><br />
Contractor directly or indirectly holds fifty percent (50%)<br /><br />
or more of the voting rights carried by its share capital;<br /><br />
or<br /><br />
(b) any entity which directly or indirectly holds<br /><br />
fifty percent (50%) or more of the aforesaid voting rights<br /><br />
of any company comprising the Contractor; or<br /><br />
(c) any other entity whose aforesaid voting rights are<br /><br />
held by an entity mentioned in (b) above in an amount of<br /><br />
fifty percent (50%) or more;<br /><br />
"Affiliate" means in respect of CNPC, any subsidiary,<br /><br />
branch or regional corporation of CNPC or CNPC and any<br /><br />
entity in which CNPC directly or indirectly holds fifty<br /><br />
percent (50%) or more of the voting rights carried by its<br /><br />
share capital.<br /><br />
1.42 "Department or Unit" means the department or unit<br /><br />
which is authorized by the State Council of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China to be responsible for administration of<br /><br />
the petroleum industry of the People's Republic of China..<br /><br />
1.43 "Delivery Point" means a point for the delivery<br /><br />
of Petroleum located within or outside the Contract Area and<br /><br />
specified in the Overall Development Program.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
1.44 "Date of Commencement of the Implementation of<br /><br />
the Contract" means the first day of the month following the<br /><br />
month in which the Contractor has received the notification<br /><br />
from CNPC of the approval by the Ministry of Foreign Trade<br /><br />
and Economic Cooperation of the People's Republic of China.<br /><br />
1.45<br /><br />
<br /><br />
"Dagang" means Dagang Oilfield (Group) Co., Ltd.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
1.46 "Trial Production" means, as to any Appraisal Well,<br /><br />
the oil and/or gas production which is produced during the<br /><br />
period from completion of that well to the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of Commercial Production in the Oil Field or<br /><br />
Gas Field in which that well is located.<br /><br />
1.47<br /><br />
"Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs" is defined in<br /><br />
Article 12.1.1 hereinafter.<br /><br />
1.48<br /><br />
"Remaining Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs" is<br /><br />
defined in Article 13.2.2.2(a)(2) hereinafter.<br /><br />
1.49<br /><br />
"Pre-Contract Development Costs" is defined in<br /><br />
Article 12.1.2 hereinafter.<br /><br />
Article 2<br /><br />
Objective of the Contract<br /><br />
2.1 The objective of the Contract is to appraise,<br /><br />
develop and produce Petroleum that exists and may exist in<br /><br />
the Contract Area.<br /><br />
2.2 The Contractor shall apply a Progressive Appraisal<br /><br />
and Development Program approach in its efforts to comply<br /><br />
with the objectives of the Contract.<br /><br />
2.3 The Contractor shall apply its appropriate and<br /><br />
advanced technology and assign its competent experts to<br /><br />
perform the Petroleum Operations.<br /><br />
2.4 During the performance of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations, the Contractor shall transfer its technology to<br /><br />
the Chinese Personnel and train them.<br /><br />
2.5 The Contractor shall pay all appraisal costs<br /><br />
required during Appraisal Operations with the exception of<br /><br />
all previous costs incurred by Dagang. In the event that<br /><br />
any Oil Field and/or Gas Field is developed within the<br /><br />
Contract Area, the development costs of such Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field or Fields shall be paid by the Parties in<br /><br />
proportion to their participating interests: fifty-one<br /><br />
percent (51%) by CNPC and forty-nine percent (49%) by the<br /><br />
Contractor. Contractor shall not be responsible for the<br /><br />
prior appraisal costs expended by Dagang, which are agreed<br /><br />
to be $19,312,000 U.S dollars, but Dagang's prior appraisal<br /><br />
costs shall be eligible for in accordance with the<br /><br />
provisions of Articles 12, 13 and 18, below. In the event<br /><br />
that CNPC elects to participate at a level less than fiftyone percent (51%) of the participating interest, or not to<br /><br />
participate in the development of the Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field, the Contractor shall pay the remaining development<br /><br />
costs necessary for the development of the Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field in accordance with Article 12.1.2 hereof.<br /><br />
2.6 If any Oil Field and/or Gas Field is developed<br /><br />
within the Contract Area, the Petroleum produced therefrom<br /><br />
shall, from the Date of Commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production of such Field, be allocated in accordance with<br /><br />
Articles 12, 13 and/or 18 hereof.<br /><br />
2.7 Nothing contained in the Contract shall be deemed<br /><br />
to confer any right on the Contractor other than those<br /><br />
rights expressly granted hereunder.<br /><br />
Article 3<br /><br />
Contract Area<br /><br />
<br /><br />
3.1 The Contract Area as of the date of signature of<br /><br />
the Contract comprises, in part, three (3) blocks, covering<br /><br />
a total of fifty and two tenths (50.2)) square kilometers,<br /><br />
as marked out by the geographic location and the coordinates<br /><br />
of the connecting points of the boundary lines in Annex I<br /><br />
attached hereto.<br /><br />
The said total area of the Contract Area shall be<br /><br />
reduced in accordance with Articles 4, 5, 11 and 18 hereof.<br /><br />
3.2 For the proper execution of operations under the<br /><br />
Contract, the Operator shall be permitted to use those<br /><br />
portions of the seabed, mudflats and land surface inside or<br /><br />
outside the Contract Area under the control of CNPC as may<br /><br />
be necessary for Petroleum Operations, for as long as<br /><br />
Appraisal Operations, Development Operations or Productions<br /><br />
Operations continue. All reasonable costs incurred by CNPC<br /><br />
for this purpose shall be reimbursed by the Operator from<br /><br />
the Joint Account.<br /><br />
3.3 The Operator shall be permitted to use for the<br /><br />
purpose of Petroleum Operations any water source located<br /><br />
within the Contract Area, subject to Government rules any<br /><br />
payment of reasonable charges at the rates not more than<br /><br />
rates charged to other users of similar water sources in the<br /><br />
area.<br /><br />
3.4 If the Operator is unable to secure in its own<br /><br />
name any rights to use of the surface area necessary for<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations or for the delivery of Crude oil to the<br /><br />
delivery point defined in any overall development plan, CNPC<br /><br />
will assist the Operator by securing such rights in CNPC's<br /><br />
name for the benefit of the joint venture. All reasonable<br /><br />
costs incurred by CNPC for this purpose shall be reimbursed<br /><br />
by Operator from the Joint Account.<br /><br />
3.5 Except for the rights as expressly provided by the<br /><br />
Contract, no right is granted in favor of the Contractor to<br /><br />
the surface area, lake bed, stream bed and subsoil or any<br /><br />
bodies of water or any natural resources or aquatic<br /><br />
resources other than Petroleum existing therein, and any<br /><br />
thing under the surface within the Contract Area.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 4<br /><br />
Contract Term<br /><br />
4.1 The term of the Contract shall include an<br /><br />
appraisal period, a development period and a production<br /><br />
period.<br /><br />
4.2 The appraisal period, beginning on the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of the Implementation of the Contract, shall be<br /><br />
divided into three (3) phases and shall consist of five (5)<br /><br />
consecutive Contract Years, unless the Contract is sooner<br /><br />
terminated, or the appraisal period is extended in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 25 hereof and/or Article 4.3 herein.<br /><br />
The three (3) phases shall be as follows:<br /><br />
The first phase of one (1) Contract Year (the<br /><br />
first Contract Year);<br /><br />
The second phase of two (2) Contract Years (the<br /><br />
second Contract Year through the third Contract<br /><br />
Year); and<br /><br />
The third phase of two (2) Contract Years (the<br /><br />
fourth Contract Year through the fifth Contract<br /><br />
Year).<br /><br />
4.3 Where time is insufficient to complete the<br /><br />
appraisal work on a Petroleum discovery prior to the<br /><br />
expiration of the appraisal period or where the time of the<br /><br />
appraisal work on a Petroleum discovery in accordance with<br /><br />
the appraisal Work Program approved by JMC as stated in<br /><br />
Articles 11 and 18 hereof extends beyond the appraisal<br /><br />
period, the appraisal period as described in Article 4.2<br /><br />
herein shall be extended. The period of extension shall be<br /><br />
<br /><br />
whatever period CNPC regards as a reasonable period of time<br /><br />
required to complete the above mentioned appraisal work in<br /><br />
order to enable JMC to make a decision on the commerciality<br /><br />
of the said Petroleum discovery in accordance with Article<br /><br />
11 or 18 hereof, and until the Department or Unit approves<br /><br />
or finally rejects the Overall Development Program.<br /><br />
4.4 The development of any Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
within the Contract Area shall begin on the date of approval<br /><br />
by the Department or Unit of the Overall Development Program<br /><br />
of the said Oil Field and/or Gas Field, and end on the date<br /><br />
of the entire completion of the Development Operations set<br /><br />
forth in the Overall Development Program, excluding the time<br /><br />
for carrying out additional development projects in the<br /><br />
production period in accordance with Article 11.9 hereof.<br /><br />
The Contractor and CNPC will commence preparation of the<br /><br />
Overall Development Program when appraisal of any potential<br /><br />
Oil Field and/or Gas Field indicates by reinterpretation of<br /><br />
seismic and mapping and integrated reservoir study that such<br /><br />
field is commercial. The Overall Development Program will be<br /><br />
submitted for approval by the Department or Unit as soon as<br /><br />
approved by the JMC.<br /><br />
4.5 The production period of any Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field within the Contract Area shall be a period of twenty<br /><br />
(20) consecutive Production Years beginning on the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of Commercial Production unless otherwise<br /><br />
provided in Article 4.6 herein and Article 18.2 or 25<br /><br />
hereof. Under such circumstances as where the overall<br /><br />
development of an Oil Field and/or Gas Field is to be<br /><br />
conducted on a large scale, and the time span required<br /><br />
therefor is long, or where separate production of each of<br /><br />
the multiple oil or gas producing zones of an Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field is required, or under other special<br /><br />
circumstances, the production period thereof shall, when it<br /><br />
is necessary, be appropriately extended with the approval<br /><br />
of the Department or Unit.<br /><br />
4.6 Suspension Or Abandonment Of Production Of An Oil<br /><br />
Field and/or Gas Field.<br /><br />
4.6.1 In the event that the Parties agree to suspend<br /><br />
temporarily production from an Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
which has entered into commercial production, the Production<br /><br />
Area covered by that Oil Field and/or Gas Field may be<br /><br />
retained within the Contract Area. In no event shall the<br /><br />
period of such retention extend beyond the date of the<br /><br />
expiration of the production period of that Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field except as otherwise provided in Article 25.4<br /><br />
hereof. The duration of the relevant period of production<br /><br />
suspension and the arrangement for the maintenance<br /><br />
operations during the aforesaid period of suspension shall<br /><br />
be proposed by the Operator, and shall be decided by JMC<br /><br />
through discussion. With respect to the aforesaid Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field which has been suspended and retained<br /><br />
within the Contract Area, in the event that production is<br /><br />
restored during the period of such retention, the production<br /><br />
period of that Oil Field and/or Gas Field shall be extended<br /><br />
correspondingly. In the event that the Parties fail to<br /><br />
reach an agreement on the restoration of production by the<br /><br />
expiration of the production suspension period decided by<br /><br />
JMC through discussion, the party who wishes to restore<br /><br />
production shall have the right to restore production<br /><br />
solely. The other party may later elect to participate in<br /><br />
production but shall have no rights or obligations in<br /><br />
respect of such Field for the solely restored production<br /><br />
period.<br /><br />
4.6.2 Abandonment Of Production From An Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field Within The Production Period.<br /><br />
4.6.2.1 During the production period, either party to<br /><br />
the Contract may propose the abandonment of production from<br /><br />
any Oil and/or Gas Field within the Contract Area, provided,<br /><br />
however, that prior written notice shall be given to the<br /><br />
other party to the Contract. The other party shall make a<br /><br />
response in writing within ninety (90) days from the date on<br /><br />
which the said notice is received. If the other party also<br /><br />
agrees to abandon production from the said Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field, then abandonment costs shall be paid by the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Parties in proportion to their participating interests in<br /><br />
the development of such Oil Field and/or Gas Field. From<br /><br />
the date on which the other party makes the response in<br /><br />
writing, the production period of such Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field shall be terminated and such Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field shall be excluded from the Contract Area.<br /><br />
4.6.2.2 If the Contractor notifies CNPC in writing of<br /><br />
its decision on abandoning production from an Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field, and CNPC decides not to abandon production<br /><br />
from such Oil Field and/or Gas Field, then from the date on<br /><br />
which the Contractor receives CNPC's written response of its<br /><br />
aforesaid decision, all of the Contractor's rights and<br /><br />
obligations, including but not limited to the<br /><br />
responsibilities for payment of abandonment in respect of<br /><br />
such Field, shall be terminated automatically, provided that<br /><br />
the Contractor shall not transfer to CNPC any of the<br /><br />
Contractor's liabilities and obligations in respect of the<br /><br />
said Field. The said Field shall be excluded from the<br /><br />
Contract Area.<br /><br />
4.7 The term of the Contract shall not go beyond<br /><br />
thirty (30) consecutive Contract Years from the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of the Implementation of the Contract, unless<br /><br />
otherwise stipulated hereunder.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 5<br /><br />
Relinquishment<br /><br />
5.1 In any of the following cases, the Contractor<br /><br />
shall relinquish the remaining Contract Area except any<br /><br />
Development Area and/or Production Area:<br /><br />
(a) at the expiration of the last phase of the<br /><br />
appraisal period and development period; or<br /><br />
(b) at the expiration of the extended period, in the<br /><br />
event that the appraisal period and development period is<br /><br />
extended in accordance with Article 4.3. or Article 25<br /><br />
hereof.<br /><br />
5.2<br /><br />
At the expiration of the production period of the<br /><br />
last producing Oil Field and/or Gas Field within the<br /><br />
Contract Area, the contractor shall relinquish all rights to<br /><br />
the entire Contract Area.<br /><br />
Article 6<br /><br />
Minimum Appraisal Work Commitment<br /><br />
and Expected Minimum Appraisal Expenditures<br /><br />
6.1<br /><br />
The Contractor shall begin to perform the on<br /><br />
site Appraisal Operations within three (3) months after the<br /><br />
Date of Commencement of the Implementation of the Contract<br /><br />
and spud the first Appraisal Well within ten (10) moths<br /><br />
after the Date of Commencement of Implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract, unless otherwise agreed by the Parties.<br /><br />
6.2<br /><br />
The Contractor shall fulfill the minimum<br /><br />
appraisal work commitment and expected minimum appraisal<br /><br />
expenditures for each phase of the appraisal period in<br /><br />
accordance with the following provisions:<br /><br />
6.2.1<br /><br />
During the first phase of the appraisal<br /><br />
period, the Contractor shall:<br /><br />
(a) reprocess and reinterpret a minimum of<br /><br />
approximately three hundred (300) kilometers of existing 2D seismic data and seventy (70) square kilometers of<br /><br />
existing 3-D seismic data, provided necessary support data<br /><br />
is available. Contractor will have access to additional<br /><br />
seismic data outside the Contract Area as needed to make<br /><br />
geological and geophysical evaluations of the Contract Area;<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(b) drill one (1) Appraisal Well with the footage of<br /><br />
three thousand (3,000) meters;<br /><br />
(c) spend a minimum of one million ($1,000,000) U.S.<br /><br />
dollars upgrading the artificial island and to recondition<br /><br />
the causeway and causeway drilling pad in preparation of<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations; and<br /><br />
(d) spend a minimum of four million ($4,000,000) U.S.<br /><br />
dollars (including the expenditures described in (c), above)<br /><br />
for such Appraisal Operations.<br /><br />
6.2.2 During the second phase of the appraisal<br /><br />
period, the Contractor shall:<br /><br />
(a) drill two (2) Appraisal Wells, one with the<br /><br />
footage of three thousand (3,000) meters, and one with the<br /><br />
footage of three thousand five hundred (3,500) meters;<br /><br />
(b) if the decision is made to drill from the<br /><br />
artificial island, the Contractor will spend a minimum of an<br /><br />
additional one million ($1,000,000) U.S. dollars upgrading<br /><br />
the drilling rig and other facilities on the artificial<br /><br />
island;<br /><br />
(c) If Contractor concludes and the JMC agrees that it<br /><br />
is feasible from an engineering, geological and economic<br /><br />
viewpoint to reevaluate the nine (9) existing wellbores on<br /><br />
the Contract Area, Contractor will commit to re-evaluate a<br /><br />
minimum of three (3) of the existing wells.<br /><br />
(d) spend a minimum of six million ($6,000,000) U.S.<br /><br />
dollars as its expected minimum appraisal expenditures for<br /><br />
such Appraisal Operations.<br /><br />
(e) Formulate the Overall Development Program if<br /><br />
appraisal of any potential Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
indicates that such a field is commercial.<br /><br />
6.2.3 During the third phase of the appraisal period,<br /><br />
the Contractor shall:<br /><br />
(a) drill two (2) Appraisal Wells with the footage of<br /><br />
three thousand (3,000) meters each; and<br /><br />
(b) spend a minimum of six million ($6,000,000) U.S.<br /><br />
dollars as its expected minimum appraisal expenditures for<br /><br />
such Appraisal Operations.<br /><br />
6.2.4 With respect to the minimum appraisal work<br /><br />
commitment for each phase of the appraisal period committed<br /><br />
by the Contractor in accordance with Articles 6.2.1, 6.2.2.<br /><br />
and 6.2.3 herein when calculating whether the minimum<br /><br />
appraisal work commitment has been fulfilled, the number of<br /><br />
Appraisal Wells and the kilometers of seismic lines<br /><br />
reprocessed and reinterpreted shall be the basis of such<br /><br />
calculation. However, the Appraisal Wells abandoned for<br /><br />
technical reasons without reaching their predetermined<br /><br />
geological objective shall not count as Appraisal Wells<br /><br />
actually fulfilled by the Contractor thereunder, without the<br /><br />
consent of CNPC.<br /><br />
6.3<br /><br />
At the expiration of the first phase or the<br /><br />
second phase of the appraisal period, the Contractor has the<br /><br />
following options:<br /><br />
(a)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
to enter the next phase and continue appraisal; or<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(b)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
to terminate the Contract.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
6.4<br /><br />
At the expiration of any phase of the appraisal<br /><br />
period, if the actual appraisal work fulfilled by the<br /><br />
Contractor is less than the minimum appraisal work<br /><br />
commitment set forth for the said appraisal phase and if the<br /><br />
Contractor elects to enter the next phase and continue<br /><br />
appraisal under Article 6.3 (a) herein, the Contractor shall<br /><br />
give reasons to CNPC for the underfulfillment, and with the<br /><br />
consent of CNPC, the unfulfilled balance of the said phase<br /><br />
shall be added to the minimum appraisal work commitment for<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the next appraisal phase.<br /><br />
In the event of a commercial appraisal at any time<br /><br />
within the appraisal period, JMC shall, at the request of<br /><br />
any party to the Contract, discuss the possibility of<br /><br />
increasing the appraisal work. Any Appraisal Wells involved<br /><br />
in such increase shall be deducted from the minimum<br /><br />
appraisal work commitment.<br /><br />
6.5 Where the Contractor has fulfilled ahead of time<br /><br />
the minimum appraisal work commitment for any phase of the<br /><br />
appraisal period, the duration of such appraisal phase<br /><br />
stipulated in Article 4.2 hereof shall not be shortened<br /><br />
thereby, and if the appraisal work actually fulfilled by<br /><br />
the Contractor exceeds the minimum appraisal work commitment<br /><br />
for the said appraisal phase, the excess part shall be<br /><br />
deducted from and credited against the minimum appraisal<br /><br />
work commitment for the next appraisal phase.<br /><br />
6.6<br /><br />
If any addition or deduction is made under<br /><br />
Article 6.4 or Article 6.5 herein in regard to the minimum<br /><br />
appraisal work commitment for any phase of appraisal period,<br /><br />
the increased or reduced appraisal work shall become the new<br /><br />
minimum appraisal work commitment for the Contractor to<br /><br />
fulfill in the said phase.<br /><br />
6.7<br /><br />
At the expiration of any phase during the<br /><br />
appraisal period, if the appraisal work actually fulfilled<br /><br />
by the Contractor is less than the minimum appraisal work<br /><br />
commitment for such phase or less than the new minimum<br /><br />
appraisal work commitment as mentioned in Article 6.6<br /><br />
herein, and if, regardless of whether the expected minimum<br /><br />
appraisal expenditures are fulfilled or not fulfilled, the<br /><br />
Contractor elects to terminate the Contract under Article<br /><br />
6.3 (b) herein or if the said phase is the last phase of the<br /><br />
appraisal period, the Contractor shall, within thirty (30)<br /><br />
days from the date of the decision of election to terminate<br /><br />
the Contract or thirty (30) days from the date of the<br /><br />
expiration of the exploration period, pay CNPC any<br /><br />
unfulfilled balance of the minimum appraisal work commitment<br /><br />
(or of the new one) in U.S. dollars after it has been<br /><br />
converted into a cash equivalent using the method provided<br /><br />
in Annex II-Accounting Procedure attached hereto. However,<br /><br />
if the minimum appraisal work commitment for the appraisal<br /><br />
period is fulfilled while its expected corresponding minimum<br /><br />
appraisal expenditures are not fulfilled, the unfulfilled<br /><br />
part shall be deemed as a saving and shall not be paid to<br /><br />
CNPC.<br /><br />
Article 7<br /><br />
Management Organization and Its Functions<br /><br />
7.1 For the purpose of the proper performance of the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations, the Parties shall establish a Joint<br /><br />
Management Committee (JMC) within forty-five (45) days from<br /><br />
the effective date of the Contract.<br /><br />
7.1.1 CNPC and the Contractor shall each appoint an<br /><br />
equal number of representatives (three to five), to form<br /><br />
JMC, and each party to the Contract shall designate one of<br /><br />
its representatives as its chief representative. All the<br /><br />
aforesaid representatives shall have the right to present<br /><br />
their views on the proposals at the meetings held by the<br /><br />
JMC. When a decision is to be made on any proposal, the<br /><br />
chief representative from each party to the Contract shall<br /><br />
be the spokesman on behalf of the party to the Contract.<br /><br />
The chairman of the JMC shall be the chief<br /><br />
representative designated by CNPC, and the vice chairman<br /><br />
shall be the chief representative designated by the<br /><br />
Contractor. The chairman of JMC shall preside over the<br /><br />
meetings of JMC. In his absence, one representative present<br /><br />
at the meeting from CNPC shall be designated to act as the<br /><br />
chairman of the meeting. In the absence of the vice<br /><br />
chairman, one representative present at the meeting from the<br /><br />
Contractor shall be designated to act as vice chairman at<br /><br />
the meeting. The Parties may, according to need, designate<br /><br />
a reasonable number of advisors who may attend, but shall<br /><br />
<br /><br />
not be entitled to vote at JMC meetings.<br /><br />
7.1.2 A regular meeting of JMC shall be held at least<br /><br />
once a Calendar Quarter, and other meetings, if necessary,<br /><br />
may be held at any time at the request of any party to the<br /><br />
Contract, upon giving reasonable notice to the other party<br /><br />
of the date, time and location of the meeting and the items<br /><br />
to be discussed.<br /><br />
7.2<br /><br />
<br /><br />
The Parties shall empower JMC to:<br /><br />
<br /><br />
7.2.1 Review and adopt the Work Program and budget<br /><br />
proposed by the Operator;<br /><br />
7.2.2 determine the commerciality of each trap on<br /><br />
which a Petroleum discovery has been made in accordance with<br /><br />
the Operator's appraisal report and report its decision to<br /><br />
CNPC for confirmation;<br /><br />
7.2.3 review and adopt the Overall Development Program<br /><br />
and budget for each Oil Field and/or Gas Field;<br /><br />
7.2.4 approve or confirm the following items of<br /><br />
procurement and expenditures:<br /><br />
(a) approve procurement of any item within the budget<br /><br />
with a unit price exceeding Five Hundred Thousand U.S.<br /><br />
dollars (U.S.$ 500,000) or any single purchase order of<br /><br />
total monetary value exceeding Two Million U.S. dollars<br /><br />
(U.S. $2,000,000);<br /><br />
(b) approve a lease of equipment, or an engineering<br /><br />
subcontract or a service contract within the budget worth<br /><br />
more than One Million U.S. dollars (U.S. $1,000,000); and<br /><br />
(c) confirm excess expenditures pursuant to Article<br /><br />
10.2.1 hereof and the expenditures pursuant to Article<br /><br />
10.2.2 hereof;<br /><br />
7.2.5 determine and announce the Date of Commencement<br /><br />
of Commercial Production of each Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
within the Contract Area;<br /><br />
7.2.6 determine the type and scope of information and<br /><br />
data provided to any Third Party and Affiliate in relation<br /><br />
to the Petroleum Operations in accordance with Article 22.5<br /><br />
hereof and Annex IV - Data Control Agreement;<br /><br />
7.2.7 demarcate boundaries of the Development Area and<br /><br />
the Production Area of each Oil Field and/or Gas Field;<br /><br />
7.2.8 review and approve plans for transfer of the<br /><br />
Production Operations in accordance with Article 8.7 hereof;<br /><br />
7.2.9 review and approve the insurance program<br /><br />
proposed by the Operator and emergency procedures on safety<br /><br />
and environmental protection;<br /><br />
7.2.10<br /><br />
<br /><br />
review and approve personnel training programs;<br /><br />
<br /><br />
7.2.11 discuss, review, decide and approve other<br /><br />
matters that have been proposed by either party to the<br /><br />
Contract or submitted by the expert groups or the Operator;<br /><br />
and<br /><br />
7.2.12 review and examine matters required to be<br /><br />
submitted to relevant authorities of the Chinese Government<br /><br />
and/or CNPC for approval.<br /><br />
7.2.13<br /><br />
Approve Trial Production for any Appraisal<br /><br />
Well when feasible.<br /><br />
7.3 Decisions of JMC shall be made unanimously through<br /><br />
consultation. All decisions made unanimously shall be<br /><br />
deemed as formal decisions and shall be equally binding upon<br /><br />
the Parties. When matters arise on which agreement cannot<br /><br />
be reached, the Parties may convene another meeting in an<br /><br />
attempt to find a new solution thereto based on the<br /><br />
principle of mutual benefit.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
7.3.1 In the appraisal period, the Parties shall<br /><br />
endeavor to reach agreement through consultation on<br /><br />
appraisal programs and annual appraisal Work Programs. If<br /><br />
the Parties fail to reach agreement through consultation,<br /><br />
the Contractor's proposal shall prevail, provided that such<br /><br />
proposal is not in conflict with the relevant provisions in<br /><br />
Articles 4, 5, and 6 hereof.<br /><br />
7.3.2 If it is considered by the chairman and/or the<br /><br />
vice chairman or their nominees that a matter requires<br /><br />
urgent handling or may be decided without convening a<br /><br />
meeting, JMC may make decisions through conference telephone<br /><br />
calls, telefax transmissions or the circulation of documents<br /><br />
to produce decisions.<br /><br />
7.4<br /><br />
bodies:<br /><br />
7.4.1<br /><br />
<br /><br />
JMC shall establish the following subordinate<br /><br />
Secretariat<br /><br />
<br /><br />
The secretariat shall be a permanent organization<br /><br />
consisting of two (2) secretaries. One secretary shall be<br /><br />
appointed by each of the Parties. The secretaries shall not<br /><br />
be members of JMC, but may attend meetings of JMC as<br /><br />
observers. The duties of the secretariat are as follows:<br /><br />
(a)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
to keep minutes of meetings;<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(b) to prepare summaries of and resolutions for JMC<br /><br />
meetings;<br /><br />
(c)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
to draft and transmit notices of meetings: and<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(d) to receive and transmit proposals, reports or<br /><br />
plans, etc. submitted by the Operator and/or any party to<br /><br />
the Contract, which require discussion, review and/or<br /><br />
approval by JMC.<br /><br />
7.4.2<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Expert Groups<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Advisory expert groups shall be established in<br /><br />
accordance with the requirements of the Petroleum Operations<br /><br />
in various periods. Each expert group shall consist of an<br /><br />
equal number of CNPC and the Contractor's personnel, and,<br /><br />
with the agreement of JMC, any other personnel. JMC shall<br /><br />
discuss and decide upon their establishment or dissolution,<br /><br />
size, and the appointment of their leaders in accordance<br /><br />
with requirements of their work. The expert groups shall<br /><br />
have the following functions;<br /><br />
(a) to discuss and study matters assigned to them by<br /><br />
JMC and submitted by the Operator to JMC for its review and<br /><br />
approval and any other matter assigned to them by JMC and to<br /><br />
make constructive suggestions to JMC;<br /><br />
(b) to have access to and observe and investigate the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations conducted by the Operator at its office<br /><br />
and operating sites as work requires and to submit relevant<br /><br />
reports to JMC; and<br /><br />
(c) to attend meetings of JMC as observers at the<br /><br />
request of JMC.<br /><br />
7.5 When the Contractor acts as the Operator, CNPC<br /><br />
shall have the right to assign professional representatives<br /><br />
to the Operator's administrative and technical departments<br /><br />
which are related to the Petroleum Operations, who may work<br /><br />
on a long-term basis together with the Operator's staff.<br /><br />
The professional representatives shall have access to<br /><br />
the centers of research, design, and data processing related<br /><br />
only to the execution of the Contract and to the operating<br /><br />
sites to observe all of the activities and study all the<br /><br />
information with respect to the Petroleum Operations. Such<br /><br />
access to the aforesaid centers outside the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China shall be decided by JMC through discussion<br /><br />
and shall be arranged by the Operator. The Operator shall<br /><br />
use all reasonable endeavors to assist the professional<br /><br />
representatives to have access to Third Parties' sites. The<br /><br />
Operator's staff shall regularly discuss their work with the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
professional representatives of CNPC. The work of<br /><br />
professional representatives of CNPC shall be arranged by<br /><br />
the manager(s) of the departments of the Operator in which<br /><br />
professional representatives work.<br /><br />
Professional representatives of CNPC, except for the<br /><br />
professional representatives in charge of procurement who<br /><br />
shall undertake their functions in accordance with Article<br /><br />
7.6 herein, shall not interfere in the decision making on<br /><br />
relevant matters by departmental manager(s) of the Operator.<br /><br />
However, such professional representatives shall have the<br /><br />
right to make proposals and comments to departmental<br /><br />
manager(s) of the Operator or to report directly to CNPC<br /><br />
representatives in JMC.<br /><br />
When CNPC acts as the Operator, the Contractor may also<br /><br />
assign professional representatives including professional<br /><br />
representatives in charge of procurement.<br /><br />
7.5.1. On the principle of mutual cooperation and<br /><br />
coordination, the Operator shall provide the professional<br /><br />
representatives with necessary facilities and assistance to<br /><br />
perform office work and to observe the operating sites, etc.<br /><br />
7.5.2. The number of professional representatives<br /><br />
shall be decided by JMC though consultations.<br /><br />
7.6 When one of the companies comprising the<br /><br />
Contractor acts as the Operator, in respect of the items<br /><br />
listed in the procurement plan, the procedures and<br /><br />
provisions herebelow shall be followed:<br /><br />
7.6.1. The procurement department of the Operator<br /><br />
shall inform the professional representatives appointed by<br /><br />
CNPC in charge of procurement of all the items of<br /><br />
procurement.<br /><br />
7.6.2. The Operator shall be subject to Articles 15.1<br /><br />
and 15.3 hereof and reach agreement through consultation<br /><br />
with the professional representatives of CNPC in charge of<br /><br />
procurement when preparing the procurement plan in<br /><br />
accordance with the Work Program and budget. The<br /><br />
professional representatives of CNPC in charge of<br /><br />
procurement shall work out an inventory listing the<br /><br />
equipment and materials which can be made and provided in<br /><br />
China and a list of manufacturers, engineering and<br /><br />
construction companies and enterprises in China which can<br /><br />
provide services and undertake subcontracting work.<br /><br />
7.6.3. Unless otherwise agreed upon by the Parties,<br /><br />
the Operator shall, in general, make procurement by means of<br /><br />
calling for bids and shall notify at the same time<br /><br />
manufacturers and enterprises concerned both inside and<br /><br />
outside China, and the work of calling for bids shall be<br /><br />
done within the territory of China.<br /><br />
7.6.4. When any procurement is to be made by means of<br /><br />
calling for bids, the manufacturers and enterprises in China<br /><br />
applying for bidding, which are included in a list delivered<br /><br />
in advance to the Operator by the professional<br /><br />
representative of CNPC in charge of procurement, shall be<br /><br />
invited. The professional representatives of CNPC in charge<br /><br />
of procurement shall have the right to take part in the work<br /><br />
of calling for bids, including examination of the list of<br /><br />
bidders to be invited, preparing and issuing bidding<br /><br />
documents, opening bids, evaluation of bids, negotiation,<br /><br />
and award of contracts through consultation, as well as<br /><br />
negotiation for subcontracts and services contracts.<br /><br />
7.6.5. With respect to the items of procurement by<br /><br />
means of not calling for bids, the Operator's procurement<br /><br />
department and the professional representatives of CNPC in<br /><br />
charge of procurement shall, in accordance with the<br /><br />
provisions specified in Article 7.6.2 herein define which<br /><br />
items are to be procured in the People's Republic of China<br /><br />
and which items are to be procured abroad.<br /><br />
7.6.6 With respect to the use of personnel, equipment<br /><br />
and services to be procured in the People's Republic of<br /><br />
China, it is expressly understood that quality and costs<br /><br />
<br /><br />
shall be competitive with personnel, equipment and services<br /><br />
that can be procured outside of the People's Republic of<br /><br />
China subject to Article 15 hereof.<br /><br />
7.7 All costs and expenses with respect to the staff<br /><br />
members of the Parties in the subordinate bodies of JMC<br /><br />
established in accordance with Article 7.4 herein, and those<br /><br />
with respect to the professional representatives referred to<br /><br />
in Article 7.5 herein and wages and salaries, costs and<br /><br />
expenses incurred by the representatives of JMC referred to<br /><br />
in Article 7.1.1 herein while attending JMC meetings shall<br /><br />
be paid by the Operator and charged respectively to the<br /><br />
appraisal costs, development costs and production costs in<br /><br />
accordance with Annex II-Accounting Procedure hereto.<br /><br />
7.8 The specific responsibilities and working<br /><br />
procedures within JMC shall be discussed and determined by<br /><br />
JMC in accordance with the relevant provisions herein.<br /><br />
7.9 For the purpose of assisting the Operator in the<br /><br />
proper implementation of Development Operations, an<br /><br />
Integrated Project Team ( the "IPT") shall be established to<br /><br />
act as a working group under the direction of the Operator.<br /><br />
Within the IPT in working roles, and charged with oversight<br /><br />
of development planning and execution will be a group of six<br /><br />
(6) persons designated by the Parties hereto. The sixperson group (the "Management Group") will consist of three<br /><br />
(3) CNPC designees and three (3) designees of the<br /><br />
Contractor, including one Operator designee who shall be<br /><br />
General Manager of the IPT and one CNPC designee who shall<br /><br />
be Deputy Manager. The Management Group will operate on the<br /><br />
principles of cooperation and mutual consultation. The IPT<br /><br />
shall be established within thirty (30) days from the date<br /><br />
of approval of the Overall Development Program.<br /><br />
The specific organization, staffing and working system<br /><br />
of the IPT and the responsibilities and competence of<br /><br />
various positions, including those of CNPC's personnel<br /><br />
assigned to the IPT, shall be determined by the parties<br /><br />
through consultation based on the principal of efficiency of<br /><br />
operations. The IPT shall comprise those personnel<br /><br />
designated by the parties and the number of CNPC's personnel<br /><br />
shall be no less than one third (1/3) of the total number of<br /><br />
personnel within the IPT. The working location(s) of the<br /><br />
members of the IPT shall be decided according to the needs<br /><br />
of the work.<br /><br />
Article 8<br /><br />
Operator<br /><br />
8.1 The Parties agree that XCL Cathay Ltd. ("XCL")<br /><br />
shall act as the Operator for the Petroleum Operations<br /><br />
within the Contract Area, unless otherwise stipulated in<br /><br />
Article 8.7 herein.<br /><br />
8.2 For the implementation of the Contract, the<br /><br />
companies comprising the Contractor shall register with the<br /><br />
State Administration for Industry and Commerce of the<br /><br />
People's Republic of China in accordance with the relevant<br /><br />
provisions of the said State Administration for Industry and<br /><br />
Commerce and shall obtain the necessary approval from CNPC.<br /><br />
The person in charge of the Operator shall have the<br /><br />
full right to represent the Contractor in respect of the<br /><br />
performance of the Petroleum Operations. The names,<br /><br />
positions and resumes of the staff and an organization chart<br /><br />
of the Operator shall be submitted in advance to CNPC and<br /><br />
the appointment of the Operator's senior staff shall be<br /><br />
subject to the consent of CNPC.<br /><br />
The parent corporation of each company comprising the<br /><br />
Contractor which is not itself a parent corporation shall,<br /><br />
at the request of CNPC, provide CNPC with a written<br /><br />
performance guarantee with terms acceptable to CNPC.<br /><br />
8.3<br /><br />
8.3.1<br /><br />
<br /><br />
The Operator shall have the following obligations:<br /><br />
To apply the appropriate and advanced technology<br /><br />
<br /><br />
and business managerial experience of the Contractor,<br /><br />
including each company comprising the Contractor or its and<br /><br />
their Affiliates, to perform the Petroleum Operations<br /><br />
reasonably, economically and efficiently in accordance with<br /><br />
sound international practice.<br /><br />
8.3.2 To prepare Work Programs and budgets related to<br /><br />
the Petroleum Operations and to carry out the approved Work<br /><br />
Programs and budgets.<br /><br />
8.3.3 To be responsible for procurement of<br /><br />
installations, equipment, and supplies and entering into<br /><br />
subcontracts and service contracts related to the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations, in accordance with the approved Work Programs<br /><br />
and budgets and the applicable provisions of Articles 7.2.4,<br /><br />
7.6 and 10.2 hereof.<br /><br />
8.3.4 To prepare in advance, in accordance with<br /><br />
Article 16 hereof, a personnel training program and budget<br /><br />
before the commencement of the Appraisal Operations,<br /><br />
Development Operations and Production Operations,<br /><br />
respectively, and, in accordance with the said program and<br /><br />
budget, to be responsible for preparing an annual personnel<br /><br />
training program and budget and carrying out the annual<br /><br />
program and budget after approval by JMC.<br /><br />
8.3.5 To establish an insurance program, and to enter<br /><br />
into and implement the insurance contracts in accordance<br /><br />
with Article 21 hereof.<br /><br />
8.3.6 To issue cash-call notices to all the parties to<br /><br />
the Contract to raise the required funds based on the<br /><br />
approved budgets and in accordance with Article 12 hereof<br /><br />
and Annex II-Accounting Procedure hereto.<br /><br />

8.4 In the course of the performance of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations, any direct loss arising out of the gross<br /><br />
negligence or willful misconduct of the Operator or its<br /><br />
employees shall be solely borne by the Operator. The<br /><br />
Operator shall make its best efforts in accordance with the<br /><br />
international Petroleum industry practice to include<br /><br />
provisions similar to this Article 8.4 herein in related<br /><br />
subcontracts and service contracts.<br /><br />
8.5 In the course of the performance of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations, the Operator shall handle the information,<br /><br />
samples or reports in accordance with the following<br /><br />
provisions:<br /><br />
8.5.1 The Operator shall provide CNPC with various<br /><br />

reasonably required by non-operator(s) and referred to in<br /><br />
Articles 8.5.1. and 8.5.2. herein.<br /><br />

8.5.4.2 Manuals, technical specifications, design<br /><br />
