8.6 In the course of performing the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations, the Operator shall abide by the laws, decrees,<br /><br />
and other rules and regulations with respect to<br /><br />
environmental protection and safety of the People's Republic<br /><br />
of China and shall endeavor in accordance with<br /><br />
international Petroleum industry practice to:<br /><br />
8.6.1 Minimize the damage and destruction to<br /><br />
environment, community and ecology;<br /><br />
8.6.2 Control blowouts promptly and prevent or avoid<br /><br />
waste or loss of Petroleum discovered in, or produced from,<br /><br />
the Contract Area;<br /><br />
8.6.3 Prevent Petroleum from flowing into low pressure<br /><br />
formations or damaging adjacent Petroleum-bearing<br /><br />
formations;<br /><br />
8.6.4 Prevent water from flowing into Petroleumbearing formations through dry holes or other wells, except<br /><br />
for the purpose of secondary recovery;<br /><br />
8.6.5 Prevent land, forests, crops, buildings and<br /><br />
other installations from being damaged and destroyed; and<br /><br />
8.6.6<br /><br />
health.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Minimize the danger to personnel safety and<br /><br />
<br /><br />
8.7 Transfer And Take Over Of The Production<br /><br />
Operations.<br /><br />
Before the full recovery of all appraisal and<br /><br />
development costs incurred in accordance with the Work<br /><br />
Program of any Oil Field and/or Gas Field within the<br /><br />
Contract Area, CNPC may, after agreement reached through<br /><br />
consultations with JMC, take over the Production Operations<br /><br />
of that Oil Field and/or Gas Field, if conditions permit.<br /><br />
After the full recovery of all appraisal and development<br /><br />
costs incurred in accordance with the Work Program of any<br /><br />
Oil Field and/or Gas Field within the Contract Area, CNPC<br /><br />
shall, at any time, have the right by giving written notice<br /><br />
to the Contractor, to take over the Production Operations of<br /><br />
that Oil Field and/or Gas Field. The transfer and take over<br /><br />
shall be effected in accordance with the procedures<br /><br />
described hereunder.<br /><br />
8.7.1 The Contractor shall submit a transfer plan of<br /><br />
the Production Operations to CNPC and JMC respectively<br /><br />
<br /><br />
within sixty (60) days following the date of receiving the<br /><br />
written notice from CNPC. Such transfer plan shall include,<br /><br />
but not be limited to, a list of various posts to be taken<br /><br />
over by CNPC, a schedule of transfer by stages, inventories<br /><br />
of the relevant facilities and equipment and an inventory of<br /><br />
all documents, manuals, data and information necessary for<br /><br />
the Production Operations. Where the transfer of some of<br /><br />
the Production Operations involves any Third Party, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall consult with CNPC in advance and propose a<br /><br />
solution thereto in the transfer plan. However, this<br /><br />
situation shall not be taken by the Contractor as an excuse<br /><br />
to delay and hinder the transfer of the Production<br /><br />
Operations.<br /><br />
JMC shall, within thirty (30) days after receiving the<br /><br />
said plan, review and approve it.<br /><br />
8.7.2 CNPC shall, within sixty (60) days from the date<br /><br />
of receiving the transfer plan of the Production Operations<br /><br />
approved by JMC, submit to the Contractor and JMC<br /><br />
respectively the lists and resumes of CNPC personnel who<br /><br />
will take over the posts. The personnel named in the lists<br /><br />
shall be persons who have been trained by the Contractor in<br /><br />
accordance with provisions set forth in Article 16 hereof or<br /><br />
personnel who are considered by CNPC to be competent.<br /><br />
Within one hundred and eighty (180) days from the date of<br /><br />
receiving CNPC's lists of the personnel who will take over<br /><br />
the operations, the Contractor shall arrange for such<br /><br />
personnel to undergo step by step practical training for<br /><br />
the posts to be taken over by them and shall assist CNPC to<br /><br />
manage the qualification test.<br /><br />
8.7.3 Within three hundred and thirty (330) days from<br /><br />
the date of receiving the written notice from CNPC, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall submit to JMC a report on the completion of<br /><br />
preparation for the transfer of the Production Operations.<br /><br />
Such report shall include the results of the qualification<br /><br />
test for CNPC's personnel who will take over the Production<br /><br />
Operations and shall be confirmed by JMC within thirty (30)<br /><br />
days after the receipt of the said report. The transfer of<br /><br />
the Production Operations shall begin on the date when JMC<br /><br />
makes such confirmation.<br /><br />
8.7.3.1 When the completion of preparations for the<br /><br />
transfer of the Production Operations is confirmed by JMC,<br /><br />
the Contractor shall, in accordance with the transfer<br /><br />
schedule by stages, transfer to CNPC's take-over personnel<br /><br />
control of all facilities and equipment relating to the<br /><br />
Production Operations in the Oil Field and/or Gas Field, and<br /><br />
all documents, manuals, data and information regarding the<br /><br />
use and operation of such facilities and equipment, so that<br /><br />
CNPC's personnel are able to manage the Production<br /><br />
Operations.<br /><br />
8.7.3.2 If JMC believes that preparations for the<br /><br />
transfer of the Production Operations have not been<br /><br />
completed and sets another deadline for the completion of<br /><br />
preparations for the transfer of the Production Operations,<br /><br />
the preparations for the transfer shall be completed prior<br /><br />
to the deadline and the transfer shall begin thereafter.<br /><br />
8.7.4 The transfer in respect of the accounting and<br /><br />
financial aspects shall be handled in accordance with Annex<br /><br />
II-Accounting Procedure hereto.<br /><br />
8.7.5 During the preparation for the transfer of the<br /><br />
Production Operations and in the course of the actual<br /><br />
transfer, the Contractor shall perform the functions<br /><br />
provided for in Articles 8.3, 8.4, 8.5 and 8.6 herein in<br /><br />
respect of an Oil Field and/or Gas Field undergoing the<br /><br />
transfer of the Production Operations, until the date when<br /><br />
CNPC has completely assumed control of and taken over the<br /><br />
Production Operations of the Oil Field and/or Gas Field.<br /><br />
Thereafter, the functions of the Operator provided for in<br /><br />
Articles 8.3, 8.4, 8.5 and 8.6 herein shall be an analogy<br /><br />
applicable to CNPC.<br /><br />
8.7.6 After CNPC has taken over the Production<br /><br />
Operations and become the Operator of an Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field, the Contractor shall still have the obligation<br /><br />
<br /><br />
pursuant to Article 2 hereof, to provide CNPC with the<br /><br />
relevant technical and personnel training assistance, and<br /><br />
the costs incurred thereby shall be charged to the operating<br /><br />
costs in accordance with the provisions of Annex IIAccounting Procedure hereto.<br /><br />
8.7.7 When CNPC takes over the Production Operations<br /><br />
in any Oil Field and/or Gas Field, the Chinese Personnel<br /><br />
employed by the Contractor for the Production Operations of<br /><br />
the said Oil Field and/or Gas Field shall be transferred to<br /><br />
CNPC's employment. If CNPC needs to retain the services of<br /><br />
any of the Expatriate Employees employed by the Contractor<br /><br />
or the Contractor still needs to keep some of the Chinese<br /><br />
Personnel in its employment, an agreement shall be reached<br /><br />
through consultation between the Parties prior to the<br /><br />
transfer.<br /><br />
8.7.8 The expenses incurred in the transfer and take<br /><br />
over of the Production Operations shall be charged to the<br /><br />
operating costs.<br /><br />
8.8 With a view to efficiently conducting the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations and Work Programs approved by JMC, the<br /><br />
Operator shall have the right to lease and/or use lands with<br /><br />
compensation therefor and to obtain rights of way subject to<br /><br />
Chinese laws and customs. Any costs incurred by the<br /><br />
Operator for this purpose shall be charged to appraisal<br /><br />
costs, development costs and operating costs having regard<br /><br />
to the date on which these costs are actually incurred.<br /><br />
Article 9<br /><br />
Assistance Provided by CNPC<br /><br />
9.1<br /><br />
To enable the Contractor to carry out<br /><br />
expeditiously and efficiently the Petroleum Operations, CNPC<br /><br />
shall have the obligation to assist the Contractor at its<br /><br />
request to:<br /><br />
9.1.1 Obtain the approvals or permits needed to open<br /><br />
accounts with the Bank of China;<br /><br />
9.1.2 Go through the formalities of exchanging foreign<br /><br />
currencies;<br /><br />
9.1.3 Obtain office space, office supplies,<br /><br />
transportation and communication facilities and make<br /><br />
arrangements for accommodation as required;<br /><br />
9.1.4.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Go through the formalities of the Customs;<br /><br />
<br /><br />
9.1.5 Obtain entry and exit visas for the Expatriate<br /><br />
Employees who will come to China for implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract and for their dependents who will visit them or<br /><br />
reside in China for a long period and provide assistance for<br /><br />
their transportation and moving as well as medical services<br /><br />
and travel in China;<br /><br />
9.1.6 Obtain necessary permission to send abroad, if<br /><br />
necessary, documents, data and samples for analysis or<br /><br />
processing during the Petroleum Operations; and<br /><br />
9.1.7 Contact departments engaged in fishing, aquatic<br /><br />
products, meteorology, ocean shipping, civil aviation,<br /><br />
railway, transportation, communication and services for<br /><br />
supply bases, etc., for relevant matters and otherwise<br /><br />
assist the Contractor in obtaining on a timely basis<br /><br />
approvals necessary for the conduct of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations under the Contract.<br /><br />
9.2 In accordance with Article 15 hereof, CNPC shall<br /><br />
assist the Contractor with the recruitment of the Chinese<br /><br />
Personnel.<br /><br />
9.3 CNPC shall, at the request of the Contractor, sell<br /><br />
to the Contractor data and samples concerning the Contract<br /><br />
Area other than those produced as a result of Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations hereunder in accordance with any relevant rules<br /><br />
and regulations and CNPC shall also assist the Contractor to<br /><br />
<br /><br />
arrange the purchase of any marine, hydrological,<br /><br />
metrological and other data available from the relevant<br /><br />
departments in China.<br /><br />
9.4 CNPC shall, at the request of the Contractor, also<br /><br />
assist the Contractor with the matters other than those<br /><br />
under Article 9.1, 9.2 and 9.3 herein if possible.<br /><br />
9.5 All expenses incurred in the assistance provided<br /><br />
by CNPC in accordance with this Article 9 shall be paid by<br /><br />
the Contractor and shall be handled in accordance with the<br /><br />
provisions of Annex II-Accounting Procedures hereto.<br /><br />
Article 10<br /><br />
Work Program and Budget<br /><br />
10.1 Before the fifteenth (15th) of September of each<br /><br />
Calendar Year after the Contract becomes effective, the<br /><br />
Operator shall complete and submit to JMC for its review an<br /><br />
annual Work Program and budget for the next Calendar Year.<br /><br />
JMC shall complete the review of the annual Work Program and<br /><br />
budget and submit them to CNPC for review and approval<br /><br />
before the fifteenth (15th) of October of the Calendar Year<br /><br />
in which they are submitted to JMC. Within fifteen (15)<br /><br />
days following the receipt of the annual Work Program and<br /><br />
budget, CNPC shall notify JMC in writing of its approval or<br /><br />
any modifications thereto with its detailed reasons. If<br /><br />
CNPC requests any modifications on the aforesaid annual Work<br /><br />
Program and budget, the Parties shall promptly hold meetings<br /><br />
to make modifications and any modifications agreed upon by<br /><br />
the Parties shall be effected immediately. In case CNPC<br /><br />
fails to notify JMC of its approval within fifteen (15)<br /><br />
days, the annual Work Program and budget proposed by the<br /><br />
Operator shall be deemed to have been approved by CNPC. The<br /><br />
Operator shall make its best efforts to perform the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations in accordance with the approved or<br /><br />
modified annual Work Program and budget.<br /><br />
10.1.2<br /><br />
The Operator shall submit a preliminary<br /><br />
appraisal Work Program and budget to the JMC prior to<br /><br />
commencement of the drilling of an Appraisal Well.<br /><br />
10.1.3<br /><br />
If the JMC approves the preliminary<br /><br />
appraisal Work Program and budget thereof, they will submit<br /><br />
the preliminary appraisal Work Program and budget thereof to<br /><br />
CNPC for review and approval. Within fifteen (15) days<br /><br />
following the receipt of the preliminary appraisal Work<br /><br />
Program and budget thereof, CNPC shall notify JMC in writing<br /><br />
of its approval or any modifications thereto with its<br /><br />
detailed reasons. If CNPC requests any modifications on the<br /><br />
aforesaid preliminary appraisal Work Program and budget<br /><br />
thereof, the Parties shall promptly hold meetings to discuss<br /><br />
modifications and any modifications agreed upon by the<br /><br />
Parties shall be effected immediately. In case CNPC fails<br /><br />
to notify JMC of its approval or disapproval within fifteen<br /><br />
(15) days following the receipt of the preliminary appraisal<br /><br />
Work Program, the preliminary appraisal Work Program and<br /><br />
budget thereof proposed by the Operator shall be deemed to<br /><br />
have been approved by CNPC. The Operator shall make its<br /><br />
best efforts to perform the Appraisal Operations in<br /><br />
accordance with the approved or modified preliminary<br /><br />
appraisal Work Program and budget thereof.<br /><br />
10.1.4<br /><br />
CNPC and JMC acknowledge that the<br /><br />
preliminary appraisal Work Program may need modifications as<br /><br />
the Operator drills Appraisal Wells. The Operator will<br /><br />
immediately notify CNPC if modifications to the plan<br /><br />
outlined in the preliminary Work Program appear to be<br /><br />
necessary along with detailed reasons. In case CNPC fails<br /><br />
to notify Operator of its approval or disapproval of the<br /><br />
modifications within one hundred twenty (120) hours, the<br /><br />
modifications shall be deemed to have been approved by CNPC.<br /><br />
The modifications to be made shall, in no case, reduce the<br /><br />
minimum appraisal work commitment stipulated in Article 6.2<br /><br />
hereof.<br /><br />
10.2 The Operator may, in accordance with the<br /><br />
following provisions, incur excess expenditures or<br /><br />
<br /><br />
expenditures outside the budget in carrying out the Work<br /><br />
Program and budget, provided that the objectives in the<br /><br />
approved Work Program and budget are not changed:<br /><br />
10.2.1 In carrying out an approved budget for a<br /><br />
single item, such as the drilling of a well, the Operator<br /><br />
may, if necessary, incur excess expenditures of no more than<br /><br />
ten percent (10%) of the budgeted amount. The Operator<br /><br />
shall report quarterly the aggregate amount of all such<br /><br />
excess expenditures to JMC for confirmation.<br /><br />
10.2.2 For the efficient performance of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations, the Operator may, without approval, undertake<br /><br />
certain individual projects which are not included in the<br /><br />
Work Program and budget, for a maximum expenditure of One<br /><br />
Hundred Thousand U.S. dollars (U.S. $100,000), but the<br /><br />
Operator shall, within ten (10) days after such expenditures<br /><br />
are incurred, report to JMC for confirmation. In case of<br /><br />
emergency, the Operator may incur emergency expenditures for<br /><br />
the amount actually needed but shall report such<br /><br />
expenditures to JMC as soon as they are made. However, the<br /><br />
said emergency expenditures shall not be subject to Articles<br /><br />
10.2.3 and 10.2.4 herein.<br /><br />
10.2.3 In the event that the aggregate of excess<br /><br />
expenditures under Article 10.2.1 herein and expenditures<br /><br />
under Article 10.2.2 herein incurred in a Calendar Year<br /><br />
cause the total expenditures of that Calendar Year to exceed<br /><br />
the approved annual budget, such excess shall not exceed<br /><br />
five percent (5%) of the approved annual budget for that<br /><br />
Calendar Year. If the aforesaid excess is expected to be in<br /><br />
excess of five percent (5%) of the annual budget, the<br /><br />
Operator shall present its reasons therefor to JMC and<br /><br />
obtain its approval for incurring such expenditures.<br /><br />
10.2.4 When JMC confirms the excess expenditures<br /><br />
mentioned in Article 10.2.1 herein, and the expenditures<br /><br />
mentioned in Article 10.2.2 herein;<br /><br />
(a) If expenditures or excess expenditures are<br /><br />
determined to be reasonable, the Operator may incur such<br /><br />
expenditures or excess expenditures again during the same<br /><br />
Calendar Year, subject to Article 10.2 herein; or<br /><br />
(b) If expenditures or excess expenditures are<br /><br />
determined to be unreasonable, the Operator shall not<br /><br />
such expenditures or excess expenditures again during<br /><br />
same Calendar Year and such unreasonable expenditures<br /><br />
excess expenditures shall be dealt with in accordance<br /><br />
Article 5.4 of Annex II-Accounting Procedure hereto.<br /><br />

<br /><br />
Article 11<br /><br />
Determination of Commerciality<br /><br />
11.1<br /><br />
The preliminary appraisal Work Program in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 10.1.2 will consist of the minimum<br /><br />
Work Program as stipulated in Article 6.2.<br /><br />
11.2<br /><br />
After the approval by the JMC of the<br /><br />
preliminary appraisal Work Program referred to in Article<br /><br />
10.1.3 hereof, the Operator shall carry out the operations<br /><br />
as soon as possible without unreasonable delay in accordance<br /><br />
with the timetable set forth in the approved preliminary<br /><br />
appraisal Work Program referred to in Article 11.1 herein.<br /><br />
11.3 Within one hundred and eighty (180) days after<br /><br />
the completion of the last Appraisal Well, the Operator<br /><br />
shall submit to JMC a detailed report on the appraisal of<br /><br />
the commerciality of the discovered Petroleum-bearing trap.<br /><br />
Under special circumstances, the above-mentioned periods may<br /><br />
be reasonably extended upon agreement of the Parties.<br /><br />
The appraisal report shall include an evaluation of<br /><br />
geology, development, engineering and economics and the<br /><br />
Overall Development Program to be approved. The Overall<br /><br />
Development Program shall include the Maximum Efficient Rate<br /><br />
(MER) determined in accordance with international Petroleum<br /><br />
industry practice.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
11.4 Within thirty (30) days following the submission<br /><br />
of the appraisal report on any Crude Oil bearing trap, JMC<br /><br />
shall convene a meeting to review such report. When JMC<br /><br />
decides unanimously after its review that the said Crude Oil<br /><br />
bearing trap is an Oil Field with commercial value and is to<br /><br />
be developed, or the Contractor considers, in accordance<br /><br />
with Article 11.6.2 herein, that a Crude Oil bearing trap is<br /><br />
an Oil Field with commercial value and decides it is to be<br /><br />
developed, JMC shall submit to CNPC for confirmation the<br /><br />
appraisal report and the Overall Development Program of the<br /><br />
said Oil Field to be developed and CNPC shall submit the<br /><br />
Overall Development Program of the Oil Field to the<br /><br />
Department or Unit as soon as possible for its review and<br /><br />
approval. The Operator shall perform the Development<br /><br />
Operations in accordance with the Overall Development<br /><br />
Program of each Oil Field approved by the Department or<br /><br />
Unit. If such Development Operations do not commence within<br /><br />
ninety (90) days after the date of approval of the Overall<br /><br />
Development Program of an Oil Field by the Department or<br /><br />
Unit, or if an intentional delay caused unilaterally by the<br /><br />
Contractor acting as the Operator results in a suspension or<br /><br />
a halt of ninety (90) continuous days in the Development<br /><br />
Operations of an Oil Field, the Contractor shall be deemed<br /><br />
to have automatically waived all its rights in the said Oil<br /><br />
Field.<br /><br />
11.5 If, after the appraisal, JMC determines that a<br /><br />
Crude Oil bearing trap is non-commercial, such Crude Oil<br /><br />
bearing trap may, at the Contractor's option, be retained<br /><br />
within the Contract Area during the term of the appraisal<br /><br />
period; before the expiration of the appraisal period, if,<br /><br />
because of certain positive factors, JMC considers<br /><br />
unanimously that it is necessary to reappraise the<br /><br />
commerciality of the Crude Oil bearing trap, the Operator<br /><br />
shall submit a further appraisal report on such Crude Oil<br /><br />
bearing trap to JMC for its review and adoption; if the<br /><br />
JMC's determination of non-commerciality of such Crude Oil<br /><br />
bearing trap has not altered by the expiration of the<br /><br />
appraisal period, the relevant area of such Crude Oil<br /><br />
bearing trap shall be excluded from the Contract Area.<br /><br />
11.6 If JMC can not reach an agreement on the<br /><br />
commerciality of a Crude Oil bearing trap, the Parties<br /><br />
shall make their best efforts to seek another solution<br /><br />
thereto. However, if JMC can not reach an agreement on the<br /><br />
commerciality of any Crude Oil bearing trap within ninety<br /><br />
(90) days following the submission of the appraisal report<br /><br />
prepared by the Operator in accordance with Article 11.3<br /><br />
herein or any further appraisal report prepared by the<br /><br />
Operator in accordance with Article 11.5 herein, then such<br /><br />
trap shall be dealt with in accordance with the following<br /><br />
procedure:<br /><br />
11.6.1 If the Contractor considers a Crude Oil bearing<br /><br />
trap without commercial value, then the Contractor shall be<br /><br />
deemed to have waived its rights to participate in the<br /><br />
development of that Crude Oil bearing trap. The relevant<br /><br />
area covered by that Crude Oil bearing trap shall, however,<br /><br />
be retained within the Contract Area until the expiration of<br /><br />
the appraisal period. In case that CNPC decides, within the<br /><br />
appraisal period, to develop solely and to pay the<br /><br />
development costs of such Oil Field, then, at any time<br /><br />
within the development period, the Contractor shall be<br /><br />
allowed to elect to participate in the development. If the<br /><br />
Contractor decides, within the development period of such<br /><br />
Oil Field, to participate in the development of such Oil<br /><br />
Field by giving a written notice to CNPC, then, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall pay CNPC an amount of money, in addition to<br /><br />
the forty-nine percent (49%) of the development costs spent<br /><br />
by CNPC on the said Oil Field with Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
up to the date of the Contractor's submission of the written<br /><br />
notice to CNPC. Such amount shall be equal to three times<br /><br />
(300%) the foregoing development costs paid by CNPC with<br /><br />
Deemed Interest thereon and such amount of money shall not<br /><br />
be recovered by the Contractor after commercial production<br /><br />
of the Oil Field commences. Thereafter, the development<br /><br />
costs to be incurred in such Oil Field shall be provided by<br /><br />
the Parties in proportion to their respective participating<br /><br />
interests. In the event that the Contractor still decides<br /><br />
<br /><br />
not to participate in the development of the said Oil Field<br /><br />
by the expiration of the development period of such Oil<br /><br />
Field, then the said Oil Field shall be excluded from the<br /><br />
Contract Area upon the Date of Commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production of the said Oil Field.<br /><br />
11.6.2 If CNPC considers a Crude Oil bearing trap to<br /><br />
have no commercial value while the Contractor considers that<br /><br />
it is a Crude Oil bearing trap having commercial value, the<br /><br />
Contractor may solely provide the entire development costs<br /><br />
and undertake development of the said Oil Field, and the<br /><br />
said Oil Field shall be deemed as an Oil Field in which CNPC<br /><br />
has no participating interests. The entire risk related to<br /><br />
the development costs spent for the said Oil Field shall be<br /><br />
borne solely by the Contractor.<br /><br />
11.6.3 Unless otherwise decided by CNPC, the<br /><br />
Development Operations and Production Operations of an Oil<br /><br />
Field solely financed by CNPC shall still be, upon agreement<br /><br />
between the Parties through consultation, performed by the<br /><br />
Operator subject to agreement on terms and conditions<br /><br />
entered into by CNPC and the Operator.<br /><br />
11.7 In the event of an Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
Straddling a Boundary, CNPC shall arrange for the Contractor<br /><br />
and the neighboring parties involved to work out a unitized<br /><br />
Overall Development Program for such Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field and to negotiate the relevant provisions thereof.<br /><br />
11.8 If a Petroleum-bearing trap without commercial<br /><br />
value within the Contract Area can be more economically<br /><br />
developed as a commercial Oil Field by linking it up with<br /><br />
facilities located outside the Contract Area, the<br /><br />
development of such Oil Field shall be dealt with in the<br /><br />
same manner as provided in Article 11.7 herein.<br /><br />
11.9 The procedures specified in this Article 11 shall<br /><br />
be applied, by analogy, to determination of additional<br /><br />
development projects in any Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
within the Contract Area during the production period, such<br /><br />
projects being designed to increase the level of production<br /><br />
and/or total quantity of Petroleum recoverable from the said<br /><br />
Field.<br /><br />
11.10<br /><br />
It is anticipated that Trial Production will<br /><br />
be conducted in connection with Appraisal Operations. If<br /><br />
Trial Production is to be conducted in any Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field within the Contract Area, the Parties shall agree<br /><br />
to the procedure of such Trial Production.<br /><br />
Article 12<br /><br />
Financing and Cost Recovery<br /><br />
12.1 Funds required for the Petroleum Operations shall<br /><br />
be raised by the Operator in accordance with Work Programs<br /><br />
and budgets determined pursuant to the relevant provisions<br /><br />
of the Contract, the provisions described in Annex IIAccounting Procedure hereto, and the provisions described<br /><br />
herebelow.<br /><br />
12.1.1 All of the appraisal costs required for<br /><br />
Appraisal Operations shall be provided by the Contractor,<br /><br />
with the exception of the previous costs incurred by Dagang<br /><br />
which are calculated to be nineteen million three hundred<br /><br />
twelve thousand ($19,312,000) U.S. dollars (hereinafter<br /><br />
referred to as Dagang's "Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs").<br /><br />
However, the appraisal costs required for the fulfillment of<br /><br />
the minimum appraisal work commitment shall be deemed the<br /><br />
equity capital of the Contractor.<br /><br />
12.1.2<br /><br />
With the exception of the previous<br /><br />
development costs incurred by Dagang, which are calculated<br /><br />
to be eleven million six hundred eighty one thousand<br /><br />
($11,681,000) U.S. dollars (hereinafter referred to as<br /><br />
Dagang's "Pre-Contract Development Costs"), which are to be<br /><br />
borne solely by Dagang, the development costs required for<br /><br />
Development Operations in each Oil Field and/or Gas Field<br /><br />
within the Contract Area shall be provided by CNPC and the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Contractor in proportion to their respective participating<br /><br />
interests: fifty-one percent (51%) by CNPC and forty-nine<br /><br />
percent (49%) by the Contractor, unless CNPC applies<br /><br />
provisions in the second paragraph of this Article 12.1.2<br /><br />
herein.<br /><br />
In the event that CNPC, at its option, decides not to<br /><br />
participate in the development of an Oil Field and/or Gas<br /><br />
Field, or decides to participate in the development to an<br /><br />
extent less than fifty-one percent (51%) of the<br /><br />
participating interest, CNPC shall notify the Contractor in<br /><br />
writing of its decision to not participate or to participate<br /><br />
at a specific percentage which is less than fifty-one (51%)<br /><br />
participating interest before the appraisal report is to be<br /><br />
reviewed by JMC pursuant to Article 11.4 or Article 18.2.2<br /><br />
hereof. In such case, if CNPC does not participate in the<br /><br />
development of such Field, the development costs therein<br /><br />
shall be borne solely by the Contractor, or in the event<br /><br />
CNPC participates in the development of such Field to an<br /><br />
extent of less than fifty-one percent (51%) of the<br /><br />
participating interests, such development costs shall be<br /><br />
borne by the Parties in proportion to their actual<br /><br />
respective participating interests.<br /><br />
12.1.3 The operating costs incurred for the<br /><br />
performance of the Production Operations of each Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field before the Date of Commencement of<br /><br />
Commercial Production shall be considered as development<br /><br />
costs. The operating costs so incurred after the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of Commercial Production shall be paid<br /><br />
respectively by CNPC and the Contractor in proportion to<br /><br />
their participating interests of the development costs of<br /><br />
the said Field.<br /><br />
12.1.4 For the purpose of implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract, CNPC shall agree that the Contractor may, when<br /><br />
financing, use the entitlement of its share of production<br /><br />
under the Contract as a security for loans, provided that<br /><br />
the Contractor shall apply to CNPC in advance and the<br /><br />
application therefor shall be examined by CNPC, and provided<br /><br />
further that the right and interests of CNPC under the<br /><br />
Contract shall not be impaired thereby.<br /><br />
12.2 All the costs incurred in the performance of<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations shall be recovered in accordance with<br /><br />
Annex II-Accounting Procedure hereto and the provisions<br /><br />
described as follows:<br /><br />
12.2.1 The operating costs for any given Calendar Year<br /><br />
actually incurred by CNPC and the Contractor in respect of<br /><br />
each Oil Field pursuant to Article 12.1.3 herein shall be<br /><br />
recovered in kind by the Parties out of the Crude Oil<br /><br />
produced from the said Oil Field during that Calendar Year<br /><br />
in accordance with Annex II-Accounting Procedure hereto,<br /><br />
after the operating costs have been converted into a<br /><br />
quantity of Crude Oil on the basis of the Crude Oil price<br /><br />
determined in accordance with Article 14 hereof.<br /><br />
Unrecovered operating costs shall be carried forward to the<br /><br />
succeeding Calendar Year.<br /><br />
12.2.2<br /><br />
The appraisal costs incurred by the Parties<br /><br />
shall be recovered as follows:<br /><br />
After the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production<br /><br />
of an Oil Field within the Contract Area, the appraisal<br /><br />
costs incurred by the Parties in respect of the Contract<br /><br />
Area shall be recovered in kind out of the Crude Oil<br /><br />
produced from any Oil Field within the Contract Area in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 13.2.2 hereof, after the appraisal<br /><br />
costs have been converted into a quantity of Crude Oil based<br /><br />
on the Crude Oil price determined in accordance with Article<br /><br />
14 hereof. The appraisal costs shall be recovered without<br /><br />
interest.<br /><br />
If no Oil Field and/or Gas Field is developed within<br /><br />
the Contract Area, the appraisal costs incurred by the<br /><br />
Parties shall be deemed as their loss. Under no<br /><br />
circumstances shall CNPC or Contractor be required to<br /><br />
reimburse the Parties for such loss.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
12.2.3 The development costs in respect of each Oil<br /><br />
Field incurred by CNPC and the Contractor and Deemed<br /><br />
Interest thereon for each Oil Field shall be recovered as<br /><br />
follows:<br /><br />
12.2.3.1 After the Date of Commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production of any Oil Field within the Contract Area, the<br /><br />
development costs in respect of such Field incurred by CNPC<br /><br />
and the Contractor and Deemed Interest thereon calculated in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 12.2.3.2 herein shall be recovered<br /><br />
in kind out of the Crude Oil produced from such Field in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 13.2.2.2 hereof, after the<br /><br />
development costs have been converted into a quantity of<br /><br />
Crude Oil based on the Crude Oil price determined in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 14 hereof.<br /><br />
12.2.3.2 Deemed Interest on the development costs<br /><br />
incurred by CNPC and the Contractor for each Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field within the Contract Area shall be<br /><br />
calculated with the fixed annual compound rate of nine<br /><br />
percent (9%) from the first day of the month following the<br /><br />
month in which such development costs expended by each party<br /><br />
to the Contract are actually received in the bank account of<br /><br />
the Joint Account opened by the Operator. Dagang's PreContract Development Costs will earn Deemed Interest at the<br /><br />
fixed annual compound rate of nine percent (9%), commencing<br /><br />
from the date that the Overall Development Program for the<br /><br />
Oil Field and/or Gas Field has received all necessary<br /><br />
approvals.<br /><br />
The detailed method of such calculation shall<br /><br />
be as provided in Annex II-Accounting Procedure hereto.<br /><br />
12.2.4 The amount of Crude Oil up to a quantity of<br /><br />
sixty thousand (60,000) metric tons extracted and delivered<br /><br />
from an Oil Field before the Date of Commencement of<br /><br />
Commercial Production shall be allocated in accordance with<br /><br />
Article 13 hereof.<br /><br />
12.3 The provisions in Article 12.2 herein shall<br /><br />
apply, by analogy, to Gas Fields.<br /><br />
Article 13<br /><br />
Crude Oil Production and Allocation<br /><br />
13.1 The Operator shall, in accordance with the<br /><br />
production profile, adjusted as the case may be, set forth<br /><br />
in the Overall Development Program for each Oil Field as<br /><br />
approved by the Department or Unit, work out a Crude Oil<br /><br />
production plan for each Oil Field in each Calendar Year and<br /><br />
carry out Crude Oil production pursuant to such plan.<br /><br />
13.2 The Annual Gross Production of Crude Oil of each<br /><br />
Oil Field within the Contract Area in each Calendar Year<br /><br />
within the production period shall be allocated in<br /><br />
accordance with the following sequence and proportions.<br /><br />
13.2.1 The percentages of the Annual Gross Production<br /><br />
of Crude Oil specified in paragraphs (a) and (b) hereunder<br /><br />
shall be used for payments of the Value-Added Tax and<br /><br />
royalty, respectively, and shall be paid in kind to the<br /><br />
relevant authorities of the Chinese Government through CNPC.<br /><br />
(a) Value Added Tax shall be paid in accordance with<br /><br />
relevant regulations of the People's Republic of China; and<br /><br />
(b) Royalty shall be paid in accordance with relevant<br /><br />
regulations of the People's Republic of China.<br /><br />
13.2.2 Sixty percent (60%) of the Annual Gross<br /><br />
Production of Crude Oil shall be deemed as the "cost<br /><br />
recovery oil" and shall be used for payments for cost<br /><br />
recovery in the following sequence:<br /><br />
13.2.2.1 Payment in kind for the operating costs<br /><br />
actually incurred but not yet recovered by the Parties<br /><br />
pursuant to Article 12.2.1 hereof after the price of the<br /><br />
said "cost recovery oil" has been determined in accordance<br /><br />
with Article 14 hereof.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
13.2.2.2 The remainder of the "cost recovery oil"<br /><br />
shall, after payment for operating costs in accordance with<br /><br />
Article 13.2.2.1 herein, be deemed as "investment recovery<br /><br />
oil". Such "investment recovery oil" shall be used for the<br /><br />
recovery of the appraisal costs in respect of the Contract<br /><br />
Area which were incurred and not yet recovered by the<br /><br />
Parties, and shall be used for the recovery of the<br /><br />
development costs in respect of the Oil Field itself which<br /><br />
were incurred and not yet recovered by CNPC and the<br /><br />
Contractor in accordance with Articles 12.2.2 and 12.2.3<br /><br />
hereof, and Deemed Interest thereon. The method of recovery<br /><br />
and the recovery sequence are as follows:<br /><br />
(a) Beginning in the Calendar Year during which the<br /><br />
production of any Oil Field within the Contract Area<br /><br />
commences, the "investment recovery oil" referred to in<br /><br />
Article 13.2.2.2 herein, based on the price which has been<br /><br />
determined in accordance with Article 14 hereof shall be<br /><br />
paid in kind first to the Parties for the recovery of the<br /><br />
appraisal costs thereon which were incurred in respect of,<br /><br />
and have not yet been recovered from, the Contract Area.<br /><br />
Such "investment recovery oil" for any Calendar Year shall<br /><br />
be shared by the Parties for the recovery of the unrecovered<br /><br />
appraisal costs on the following basis:<br /><br />
(1) "Investment recovery oil" shall be allocated 49% to<br /><br />
recover Contractor's appraisal costs and 51% to recover<br /><br />
Dagang's Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs.<br /><br />
(2) If, at the end of the appraisal period, the<br /><br />
Contractor's appraisal costs do not exceed eighteen million,<br /><br />
five hundred fifty-five thousand ($18,555,000) U.S. dollars,<br /><br />
then the portion of Dagang's Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs<br /><br />
that will not be recovered proportionate with Contractor's<br /><br />
appraisal costs (hereinafter referred to as Dagang's<br /><br />
"Remaining Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs") shall be carried<br /><br />
forward to be recovered as at the same time as development<br /><br />
costs are recovered on the first Oil field to attain<br /><br />
Commencement of Commercial Production, as provided in<br /><br />
Article 13.2.2.2 (b)(1),below. Remaining Pre-Contract<br /><br />
Appraisal costs shall accrue Deemed Interest beginning on<br /><br />
the first day of the Contract Year following the end of the<br /><br />
appraisal period described in Article 4.2.<br /><br />
(3) If Contractor's appraisal costs exceed eighteen<br /><br />
million, five hundred fifty-five thousand ($18,555,000) U.S.<br /><br />
dollars, then, after Dagang has fully recovered all of its<br /><br />
Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs, Contractor's remaining<br /><br />
appraisal costs shall be recovered from 100% of "investment<br /><br />
recovery oil", as an incentive to Contractor's appraisal<br /><br />
efforts.<br /><br />
The unrecovered appraisal costs shall be carried forward to<br /><br />
succeeding Calendar Years until fully recovered.<br /><br />
(b)(1) In the case of the first Oil Field to attain<br /><br />
Commencement of Commercial Production, beginning in the<br /><br />
Calendar Year during which the appraisal costs incurred by<br /><br />
the Parties in respect of the Contract Area have been fully<br /><br />
recovered, the remainder of the "investment recovery oil" of<br /><br />
such Oil Field shall be used for the simultaneous recovery<br /><br />
of (1) the development costs incurred and not yet recovered<br /><br />
respectively by CNPC and the Contractor and Deemed Interest<br /><br />
thereon in respect of such Field, (2) Dagang's Pre-Contract<br /><br />
Development Costs and Deemed Interest thereon calculated in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 12.2.3.2, above, and (3) Dagang's<br /><br />
Remaining Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs without Deemed<br /><br />
Interest on the following basis:<br /><br />
I. Until Dagang has fully recovered its Pre-Contract<br /><br />
Development Costs together with Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
together with its Remaining Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs<br /><br />
together with Deemed Interest thereon, such "investment<br /><br />
recovery oil" shall be shared on the following basis after<br /><br />
the price of such remainder of the "investment recovery oil"<br /><br />
has been determined in accordance with Article 14 hereof:<br /><br />
(1) the Contractor's share of such "investment<br /><br />
recovery oil" shall be based on the ratio of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(A) Contractor's share of the budgeted costs<br /><br />
to develop the Oil Field, as set forth in the approved<br /><br />
Overall Development Program<br /><br />
to<br /><br />
(B) (1)CNPC's share of the budgeted costs to<br /><br />
develop the Oil Field, as set forth in the approved Overall<br /><br />
Development Program, plus (2) Dagang's Pre-Contract<br /><br />
Development Costs, plus (3) Dagang's Remaining Pre-Contract<br /><br />
Appraisal Costs;<br /><br />
(2) the balance of "investment recovery oil"<br /><br />
shall be allocated to CNPC and Dagang. The unrecovered<br /><br />
development costs and Deemed Interest thereon, unrecovered<br /><br />
Pre-Contract Development Costs and Deemed Interest thereon,<br /><br />
and unrecovered Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs and Deemed<br /><br />
Interest thereon shall be carried forward to succeeding<br /><br />
Calendar Years until fully recovered.<br /><br />
II. After Dagang has fully recovered its Pre-Contract<br /><br />
Development Costs together with Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
together with its Remaining Pre-Contract Appraisal Costs<br /><br />
together with Deemed Interest thereon, such "investment<br /><br />
recovery oil" for any Calendar Year shall be used for the<br /><br />
simultaneous recovery of the development costs incurred and<br /><br />
not yet recovered respectively by CNPC and the Contractor<br /><br />
and Deemed Interest thereon is respect of such Field in<br /><br />
proportion to their respective participating interests<br /><br />
therein after the price of such remainder of the "investment<br /><br />
recovery oil" has been determined in accordance with Article<br /><br />
14 hereof. The unrecovered development costs and Deemed<br /><br />
Interest thereon shall be carried forward to succeeding<br /><br />
Calendar Years until fully recovered.<br /><br />
(b)(2) In the case of each Oil Field other than the<br /><br />
first Oil Field to attain commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production, beginning in the Calendar Year during which the<br /><br />
appraisal exploration costs incurred by the Parties in<br /><br />
respect of the Contract Area have been fully recovered, the<br /><br />
remainder of the "investment recovery oil" of such an Oil<br /><br />
Field shall be used for the simultaneous recovery of the<br /><br />
development costs incurred and not yet recovered<br /><br />
respectively by CNPC and the Contractor and Deemed Interest<br /><br />
thereon in respect of such Field in proportion to their<br /><br />
respective participating interests therein after the price<br /><br />
of such remainder of the "investment recovery oil" has been<br /><br />
determined in accordance with Article 14 hereof. The<br /><br />
unrecovered development costs and Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
shall be carried forward to succeeding Calendar Years until<br /><br />
fully recovered.<br /><br />
(c) During the production period of an Oil Field,<br /><br />
costs for an additional development project incurred<br /><br />
pursuant to Article 11.9 hereof and Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
shall be recovered together with the unrecovered development<br /><br />
costs and Deemed Interest thereon. If the development costs<br /><br />
and Deemed Interest thereon have been fully recovered, then<br /><br />
costs for the said additional development project and Deemed<br /><br />
Interest thereon shall be recovered from the "investment<br /><br />
recovery oil" of such Field referred to in Article 13.2.2.2<br /><br />
herein in accordance with the provisions specified in<br /><br />
Article 13.2 herein. The unrecovered costs for the<br /><br />
additional development project and Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
shall be carried forward to succeeding Calendar Years until<br /><br />
fully recovered.<br /><br />
(d) After the recovery of an Oil Field's development<br /><br />
costs and Deemed Interest thereon and/or costs for the<br /><br />
additional development project and Deemed Interest thereon<br /><br />
from the said Field by the Parties, the remainder of the<br /><br />
"investment recovery oil" shall automatically be regarded as<br /><br />
part of the "remainder oil" referred to in Article 13.2.3<br /><br />
herein. By the date of expiration of the production period<br /><br />
of an Oil Field pursuant to Article 4.5 hereof, if any<br /><br />
development costs and Deemed Interest thereon and/or costs<br /><br />
for the additional development project incurred in respect<br /><br />
of such Field and Deemed Interest thereon have not yet been<br /><br />
fully recovered, then such unrecovered costs and Deemed<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Interest thereon shall be regarded as a loss, and the<br /><br />
Parties shall bear the loss in proportion to their<br /><br />
respective participating interests. Any unrecovered PreContract Appraisal Costs and Deemed Interest thereon or PreContract Development Costs and Deemed Interest thereon shall<br /><br />
be regarded as a loss and be borne by Dagang.<br /><br />
