13.2.4 The "allocable remainder oil" of each Oil Field<br /><br />
in each Calendar Year referred to in Article 13.2.3 herein<br /><br />
shall be shared by the Parties in proportion to their<br /><br />
respective participating interests in the development costs,<br /><br />
fifty-one percent (51%) for CNPC and forty-nine percent<br /><br />
(49%) for the Contractor. In the event that CNPC does not<br /><br />
participate in the development of an Oil Field within the<br /><br />
Contract Area, the Contractor shall obtain one hundred<br /><br />
percent (100%) of the "allocable remainder oil" of that<br /><br />
Field. In the event that CNPC participates to an extent<br /><br />
less than fifty-one percent (51%) in the development of an<br /><br />
Oil Field within the Contract Area, the "allocable remainder<br /><br />
oil" of such Field in that Calendar Year shall be shared by<br /><br />
the Parties in proportion to their actual respective<br /><br />
participating interests in such Oil Field.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
13.3 Pursuant to the method of allocation specified in<br /><br />
this Article, the Contractor may obtain an aggregate amount<br /><br />
of Crude Oil consisting of the following three categories:<br /><br />
13.3.1 The total amount of Crude Oil as converted from<br /><br />
the actual operating costs paid by the Contractor in all Oil<br /><br />
Fields in proportion to its participating interests in the<br /><br />
development costs stipulated in 12.1.3 hereof when<br /><br />
recovering such costs;<br /><br />
13.3.2 The total amount of the "investment recovery<br /><br />
oil" from all Oil Fields due to the Contractor provided for<br /><br />
in Article 13.2.2.2 herein; and<br /><br />
13.3.3 The total amount of the "allocable remainder<br /><br />
oil" of all Oil Fields due to the Contractor in accordance<br /><br />
with Article 13.2.4 herein.<br /><br />
13.4 In the event that the Contractor wishes to<br /><br />
purchase a portion of or all of the total amount of the<br /><br />
Crude Oil obtained by CNPC from the "investment recovery<br /><br />
oil" in addition to the Crude Oil obtained by the Contractor<br /><br />
in accordance with Article 13.3 herein, the Parties shall<br /><br />
negotiate the terms and conditions of purchasing such Crude<br /><br />
Oil and reach an agreement as a supplementary document<br /><br />
hereto.<br /><br />
13.5 CNPC and each company comprising the Contractor<br /><br />
shall, throughout the entire Contract term, have the right<br /><br />
and obligation, in each Calendar Quarter to lift and take,<br /><br />
and separately dispose of their respective full shares of<br /><br />
all Crude Oil produced, and determined pursuant to Articles<br /><br />
13.3 and 13.4 herein.<br /><br />
In the event that the Crude Oil production of any Oil<br /><br />
Field is reduced because CNPC or any company comprising the<br /><br />
Contractor does not lift and take its full share of Crude<br /><br />
Oil or lifts nothing, then such reduction in Crude Oil<br /><br />
production shall not affect the full shares of Crude Oil due<br /><br />
to or the shares of Crude Oil available to be lifted and<br /><br />
disposed of by the other party as provided in Article 13.6<br /><br />
(c) herein.<br /><br />
13.6 A Crude Oil lifting procedure shall be agreed<br /><br />
upon by the Parties no later than six (6) months prior to<br /><br />
the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production within the<br /><br />
Contract Area, and shall include, but not be limited to:<br /><br />
(a) Operator's notification of Crude Oil production to<br /><br />
CNPC and the Contractor;<br /><br />
(b) Notification by CNPC and each company comprising<br /><br />
the Contractor of its expected offtake to the Operator;<br /><br />
(c) Operator's notification to CNPC and each company<br /><br />
comprising the Contractor of the final Crude Oil lifting<br /><br />
schedule which shall be binding on CNPC and each company<br /><br />
comprising the Contractor;<br /><br />
(d) Limitation and calculation of overlift and<br /><br />
underlift of CNPC and each company comprising the<br /><br />
Contractor; and provisions to ensure timely and ratable<br /><br />
lifting of Crude Oil;<br /><br />
(e) Determination of allowable operational tolerance<br /><br />
of liftings; and<br /><br />
(f) other terminal procedures as may be required to<br /><br />
reflect the particular circumstances.<br /><br />
13.7 For the purpose of implementing the procedures as<br /><br />
described in Article 13.6 herein, CNPC and each company<br /><br />
comprising the Contractor shall jointly set up a Crude Oil<br /><br />
lifting coordination group consisting of representatives<br /><br />
each appointed by CNPC and each company comprising the<br /><br />
Contractor, with the representative of CNPC as the chairman.<br /><br />
Such group shall be responsible for the preparation of Crude<br /><br />
Oil lifting plans of Calendar Year, of Calendar Quarter and<br /><br />
of calendar month and shall also be responsible for the<br /><br />
reasonable and unified arrangements and adjustments of the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
aforesaid Crude Oil lifting plans through close contact with<br /><br />
any operator in charge of the storage and loading<br /><br />
facilities.<br /><br />
Article 14<br /><br />
Quality, Quantity,<br /><br />
Price and Destination of Crude Oil<br /><br />
14.1 In accordance with Article 13.3 hereof, the<br /><br />
Contractor may obtain the aggregate amount of three (3)<br /><br />
categories of the Crude Oil referred to in Articles 13.3.1,<br /><br />
13.3.2 and 13.3.3 hereof. In addition the Contractor may<br /><br />
purchase a portion or all of the total amount of the Crude<br /><br />
Oil allocated to CNPC from the "investment recovery oil" in<br /><br />
all Oil Fields within the Contract Area in accordance with<br /><br />
Article 13.4 hereof.<br /><br />
14.2<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Quality of the Crude Oil.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
14.2.1 The quality analysis of the Crude Oil produced<br /><br />
from each Oil Field within the Contract Area shall be<br /><br />
undertaken at the Delivery Point. Such analysis shall be<br /><br />
carried out on a sample taken by the State Administration of<br /><br />
Import and Export Commodity Inspection (hereafter referred<br /><br />
to as the "Administration") or any representative agency<br /><br />
delegated by the Administration pursuant to standards issued<br /><br />
by the State Bureau of Standardization of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China or by the Department or Unit.<br /><br />
14.2.2 The Crude Oil quality analysis referred to in<br /><br />
Article 14.2.1 above shall include the following:<br /><br />
(a) density at 20 degrees Centigrade, in grams per<br /><br />
cubic centimeter;<br /><br />
(b) sulfur content, in weight percentage;<br /><br />
(c)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
water content, in weight percentage; and<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(d)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
basic sediment content, in weight percentage.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
14.3<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Quantity of the Crude Oil.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
14.3.1 The quantity measurement of the Crude Oil<br /><br />
produced from each Oil Field within the Contract Area, when<br /><br />
being lifted, shall be made at a Delivery Point and with<br /><br />
measuring devices both to be agreed upon by the Parties. A<br /><br />
relevant measuring organization of the Chinese Government or<br /><br />
a representative agency delegated thereby shall, at<br /><br />
appropriate regular intervals, calibrate all the measuring<br /><br />
devices, conduct special testing and issue certificates or<br /><br />
confirmation with respect thereto before the measuring<br /><br />
devices are put into use. The quality and quantity of the<br /><br />
Crude Oil delivered shall be authenticated in accordance<br /><br />
with the commodity quality certificate and weight<br /><br />
certificate issued by the Administration and such quality<br /><br />
and quantity shall be the basis for the accounting<br /><br />
settlement.<br /><br />
14.3.2 If any party to the Contract believes that the<br /><br />
Crude Oil measuring devices, sampling or analysis are<br /><br />
inaccurate, or has any objection to the results specified in<br /><br />
the above mentioned certificates, on-site investigations,<br /><br />
technical exchanges and discussions may be conducted by the<br /><br />
Parties to resolve the issue in a manner satisfactory to the<br /><br />
Parties.<br /><br />
14.4<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Determination of the Crude Oil Price.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
14.4.1 The price of various grades of the Crude Oil<br /><br />
shall be expressed as FOB price at the Delivery Point.<br /><br />
Determination of the Crude Oil price shall be made with<br /><br />
reference to the prevailing price in arm's length<br /><br />
transactions of the long term contract sales of similar<br /><br />
quality crude oil on the main world oil markets and the<br /><br />
adjustments in such price shall be made in accordance with<br /><br />
such determinants as the quality of the Crude Oil, the terms<br /><br />
<br /><br />
of delivery, transportation, payment and other terms.<br /><br />
The aforesaid price in arm's length transactions in<br /><br />
this Article refers to a price at which a seller sells its<br /><br />
crude oil to a buyer who is independent of the seller, but<br /><br />
not including the prices used by them for government to<br /><br />
government transactions which do not reflect international<br /><br />
oil market price, crude oil exchange, barter or spot<br /><br />
transactions.<br /><br />
14.4.2 Where the Crude Oil produced from each Oil<br /><br />
Field within the Contract Area differs in grades, the prices<br /><br />
of such Crude Oil with different quality shall be<br /><br />
individually determined.<br /><br />
14.4.3 The price of the Crude Oil produced from all<br /><br />
the Oil Fields within the Contract Area shall be denominated<br /><br />
in U.S. dollars per metric ton. However, if an<br /><br />
international currency other than the U.S. dollar prevails<br /><br />
on the main world oil markets as the pricing unit of crude<br /><br />
oil, the Parties may also use that international currency<br /><br />
therefor upon mutual agreement.<br /><br />
14.4.4<br /><br />
Oil price.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Procedure for the Determination of the Crude<br /><br />
<br /><br />
14.4.4.1 The Crude Oil price shall be determined each<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter. In case the crude oil price prevailing on<br /><br />
most world oil markets fluctuates, CNPC and the Contractor<br /><br />
each shall have the right to propose, at any time, that a<br /><br />
new Crude Oil price be negotiated and determined.<br /><br />
14.4.4.2 The Contractor shall, no later than fortyfive (45) days prior to commencement of any Calendar<br /><br />
Quarter, notify CNPC of its proposed price for the Crude Oil<br /><br />
to be lifted in such Calendar Quarter (for the purpose of<br /><br />
this Article thereafter referred to as the said Calendar<br /><br />
Quarter).<br /><br />
14.4.4.3 CNPC shall notify the Contractor of its<br /><br />
decided price within ten (10) days after the receipt of the<br /><br />
aforesaid proposed price notified by the Contractor. In the<br /><br />
absence of a different price notified by CNPC to the<br /><br />
Contractor within ten (10) days after the receipt of the<br /><br />
aforesaid notification, the proposed price notified by the<br /><br />
Contractor as referred to in Article 14.4.4.2 herein shall<br /><br />
be applied to the Crude Oil to be lifted in the said<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter.<br /><br />
14.4.4.4 The Contractor shall, within five (5) days<br /><br />
following its receipt of notice of a price decided by CNPC,<br /><br />
state to CNPC whether the price is acceptable. If it is<br /><br />
acceptable, the said decided price shall be regarded as the<br /><br />
price agreed upon by the Parties for the said Calendar<br /><br />
Quarter. If not acceptable, the Parties shall, within ten<br /><br />
(10) days, carry out further negotiation in an amicable<br /><br />
manner to determine the price for the said Calendar Quarter.<br /><br />
14.4.4.5 In the event that the Parties still cannot<br /><br />
reach an agreement on the Crude Oil price for the said<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter through further negotiations by the<br /><br />
Parties, the Contractor may lift the Crude Oil in accordance<br /><br />
with the quota specified for the said Calendar Quarter in<br /><br />
Article 13.2 hereof, and the Crude Oil price for the<br /><br />
preceding Calendar Quarter shall apply provisionally to the<br /><br />
Crude Oil of such quota and/or the payment shall be made<br /><br />
accordingly. Then, the Parties shall negotiate further on<br /><br />
the Crude Oil price for the said Calendar Quarter taking<br /><br />
into account relevant independent and non-proprietary market<br /><br />
data on Third Party long-term-contract-sales of crude oil in<br /><br />
substantial quantities on the main world oil markets,<br /><br />
adjusted for quality, transportation and other applicable<br /><br />
differentials. The Parties shall each take into account the<br /><br />
information supplied and discussed and attempt to agree on a<br /><br />
Crude Oil price based upon such information by the end of<br /><br />
the said Calendar Quarter.<br /><br />
(A) In the event that the Parties still cannot reach<br /><br />
an agreement on the Crude Oil price by the end of the said<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter, then the Crude Oil price shall be the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
weighted average FOB price of the Crude Oil of the same or<br /><br />
similar quality sold by CNPC and/or the Contractor to a<br /><br />
Third Party or Third Parties and produced in the said<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter from the Oil Fields described hereafter,<br /><br />
adjusted for such differences as the quality, delivery,<br /><br />
transportation, payment and other terms, but excluding the<br /><br />
government to government transactions which do not reflect<br /><br />
international oil market price, crude oil exchange, barter<br /><br />
or spot transactions.<br /><br />
The application of the above-mentioned price of Crude<br /><br />
Oil sold to a Third Party or Third Parties shall be in the<br /><br />
following sequence:<br /><br />
(i) Firstly, the price, calculated and determined in<br /><br />
accordance with the above-mentioned stipulations, of the<br /><br />
Crude Oil produced from the relevant Oil Field or Oil Fields<br /><br />
in the Contract Area and sold to a Third Party or Third<br /><br />
Parties shall be applied;<br /><br />
(ii) In the event no sales as referred to in paragraph<br /><br />
(i) above were made in the said Calendar Quarter, the price,<br /><br />
calculated and determined in accordance with the abovementioned stipulations, of the Crude Oil produced from other<br /><br />
Oil Fields in the Contract Area and sold to a Third Party or<br /><br />
Third Parties shall be applied; and<br /><br />
(iii) In the event no sales mentioned in paragraphs<br /><br />
(i) and (ii) above were made in the said Calendar Quarter,<br /><br />
the price, calculated and determined in accordance with the<br /><br />
above-mentioned stipulations, of the Crude Oil produced from<br /><br />
the oil fields of other contract areas for Chinese-foreign<br /><br />
cooperative exploitation of petroleum resources and sold to<br /><br />
a Third Party or Third Parties shall be applied;<br /><br />
(B) In the event there are no such Third Party sales<br /><br />
of the Crude Oil during the said Calendar Quarter, then the<br /><br />
Crude Oil price for the said Calendar Quarter shall be equal<br /><br />
to the same Crude Oil price of the preceding Calendar<br /><br />
Quarter adjusted by the differences in the individual<br /><br />
arithmetic average of the daily weighted average of the<br /><br />
official government selling price of a basket of three or<br /><br />
more internationally traded Crude Oils in the said Calendar<br /><br />
Quarter compared with that of such basket of Crude Oils for<br /><br />
the preceding Calendar Quarter. The adjusted price shall be<br /><br />
the Crude Oil price for the said Calendar Quarter. The<br /><br />
Crude Oils selected for the basket shall each be similar in<br /><br />
quality to that from the Contract Area and chosen from<br /><br />
different countries and shall reflect the conditions of the<br /><br />
main world oil markets and shall be mutually agreed upon by<br /><br />
the Parties at a reasonable time prior to the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of the Commercial Production of Crude Oil.<br /><br />
(C) If the Parties are unable to agree on a Crude Oil<br /><br />
Price for a Calendar Quarter in which Crude Oil is first<br /><br />
produced and delivered from or the production of Crude Oil<br /><br />
is restored in a Field in the Contract Area, then the Crude<br /><br />
Oil for the Calendar Quarter shall be priced and/or paid in<br /><br />
accordance with the arithmetic average price of the prices<br /><br />
finally proposed by the Parties in the Calendar Quarter.<br /><br />
Based on the Crude Oil price agreed upon by the Parties for<br /><br />
the succeeding Calendar Quarter, the Crude Oil price for the<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter shall be determined by adjusting<br /><br />
retroactively by the differences between the arithmetic<br /><br />
average prices of the basket of the Crude Oils for the<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter and the succeeding Calendar Quarter in<br /><br />
accordance with the calculation method referred to in<br /><br />
paragraph 14.4.4.5 (B) herein.<br /><br />
14.4.4.6 If, due to the delayed announcement of crude<br /><br />
oil prices by the main world oil-producing countries or the<br /><br />
main world oil markets, or if, as agreed by CNPC and the<br /><br />
Contractor, an unstable main world oil market exists, then<br /><br />
the period for the determination of the price referred to in<br /><br />
Article 14.4.4.2 herein may be extended to the end of the<br /><br />
said Calendar Quarter in question.<br /><br />
14.4.4.7 If the Crude Oil prices are adjusted<br /><br />
retroactively by the main world oil-producing countries,<br /><br />
then the Crude Oil price may be retroactively adjusted by<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the Parties after consultation, provided that the period for<br /><br />
such retroactive adjustment shall not exceed the current<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter.<br /><br />
14.4.5 The Crude Oil for each Calendar Quarter due to<br /><br />
CNPC pursuant to Article 13 hereof shall be converted into<br /><br />
an amount of money in the currency utilized pursuant to<br /><br />
Article 14.4.3 herein based on the Crude Oil price for that<br /><br />
Calendar Quarter finally determined in accordance with the<br /><br />
aforesaid provisions specified in Article 14.4 herein and<br /><br />
such amount of money shall be entered into the Joint Account<br /><br />
as of the date on which such Crude Oil is lifted.<br /><br />
14.4.6 The Crude Oil for each Calendar Quarter due to<br /><br />
the Contractor pursuant to Article 13 hereof shall be<br /><br />
converted into a amount of money in the currency utilized<br /><br />
pursuant to Article 14.4.3 herein based on the Crude Oil<br /><br />
price for the Calendar Quarter finally determined in<br /><br />
accordance with the aforesaid provisions specified in<br /><br />
Article 14.4 herein and such amount of money shall be<br /><br />
entered into the Joint Account as of the date on which the<br /><br />
Crude Oil is lifted.<br /><br />
14.4.7 Notwithstanding any provision in this Article<br /><br />
14.4 to the contrary, if Contractor agrees to sell its share<br /><br />
of production into the Chinese domestic market by a sale to<br /><br />
CNPC or its designated subsidiary, the realized price<br /><br />
received by the Contractor shall be deemed a Third Party<br /><br />
price for the purposes of this Article 14.4.<br /><br />
14.5 Terms of payment for the purchased Crude Oil<br /><br />
pursuant to Article 13.4.<br /><br />
14.5.1 Before the Crude Oil price is determined, the<br /><br />
time limit for payment shall be agreed upon by the Parties<br /><br />
through consultation in accordance with the practice then<br /><br />
prevailing on the main world oil markets.<br /><br />
14.5.2 In case the Contractor is in default of such<br /><br />
payment, the Contractor shall pay interest on arrears of the<br /><br />
payment, starting from the first day of such default. The<br /><br />
interest rate shall be the seven day term London Interbank<br /><br />
Offered Rate (LIBOR) for U.S. dollars quoted by Midland Bank<br /><br />
in London at eleven (11:00) a.m. on the first working day<br /><br />
following the due date of payment plus five percent (5%).<br /><br />
14.6<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Destination of the Crude Oil.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
14.6.1 The destination of the Crude Oil lifted by the<br /><br />
Contractor shall be at the discretion of the Contractor,<br /><br />
except as stipulated in Article 14.6.2 herein.<br /><br />
14.6.2 In accordance with the decisions of the Chinese<br /><br />
Government, CNPC shall notify the Contractor of any<br /><br />
prohibited destinations which infringe on the political<br /><br />
interests of the People's Republic of China. The Contractor<br /><br />
shall not deliver the Crude Oil to the prohibited<br /><br />
destinations as notified.<br /><br />
Article 15<br /><br />
Preference to the Employment of the<br /><br />
Chinese Personnel, Goods and Services<br /><br />
15.1 The Contractor shall give preference to CNPC<br /><br />
and/or local goods, equipment and service when procuring<br /><br />
necessary goods, and leasing equipment as well as entering<br /><br />
into subcontracts or other service contracts for the<br /><br />
performance of the Petroleum Operations provided that they<br /><br />
are competitive in terms of price, quality, term of<br /><br />
delivery, technology and service.<br /><br />
15.2 The Contractor shall give preference to the<br /><br />
employment of CNPC Personnel in the performance of the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations. For this purpose, the Contractor<br /><br />
shall submit in advance to CNPC and JMC, respectively, all<br /><br />
plans for the employment of CNPC Personnel listing all the<br /><br />
<br /><br />
posts and the number of persons involved. CNPC shall, in<br /><br />
accordance with the plan, provide or assist in recruiting<br /><br />
Chinese employee candidates for such employment. For the<br /><br />
performance of Petroleum Operations, the Contractor shall<br /><br />
have the obligation to employ competent CNPC Personnel and<br /><br />
to employ those who have become qualified after being<br /><br />
trained in accordance with the training program. The<br /><br />
Contractor shall, in the employment, give preference to the<br /><br />
CNPC Personnel who have participated in the training program<br /><br />
provided by the Contractor.<br /><br />
15.3 The engineering design corporations under CNPC<br /><br />
shall have the right to participate in the master designs<br /><br />
and engineering designs made by the Contractor for the<br /><br />
purpose of the implementation of the Contract. Engineering<br /><br />
design companies within the territory of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China shall be given preference in entering into<br /><br />
the subcontracts for the aforesaid master designs and<br /><br />
engineering designs, provided that their technical level,<br /><br />
price and delivery time are competitive.<br /><br />
15.4 After the Contractor signs equipment leasing<br /><br />
contracts, service contracts or subcontracts with CNPC or<br /><br />
its Affiliates in accordance with Article 15.1 herein, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall endeavor to provide technical assistance to<br /><br />
CNPC or its Affiliates, at the request of CNPC, so as to<br /><br />
enable them to meet the needs of operations to be<br /><br />
undertaken. The expenses so incurred shall be borne by CNPC<br /><br />
or its Affiliates.<br /><br />
Article 16<br /><br />
Training of Chinese Personnel and Transfer of Technology<br /><br />
16.1 In the implementation of the Contract, the<br /><br />
Contractor or its Affiliates, including each company<br /><br />
comprising the Contractor, shall apply in the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations their appropriate and advanced technology and<br /><br />
managerial experience, including their proprietary<br /><br />
technology, e. g. patent, know-how or other confidential<br /><br />
technology, etc. At the same time, the Contractor shall<br /><br />
have the obligation to transfer technology and experience,<br /><br />
the necessary data and/or information for mastering those<br /><br />
technologies and experience, to CNPC and its Affiliates.<br /><br />
Provided however, such technology to be transferred shall be<br /><br />
proprietary to the Contractor and if the transfer of any of<br /><br />
such technology is restricted in any way during the term of<br /><br />
the Contract, the Contractor shall, to the extent reasonably<br /><br />
possible, endeavor to obtain permission for the transfer of<br /><br />
such restricted technology. In the Petroleum Operations,<br /><br />
the Contractor shall train, in planned, systematic and<br /><br />
various ways, the Chinese Personnel relating to the<br /><br />
implementation of the Contract, for the purpose of improving<br /><br />
their knowledge and skill, so that such Chinese Personnel<br /><br />
shall gradually reach the level of knowledge and skill as<br /><br />
that possessed by the Contractor's employees.<br /><br />
16.2 Within ninety (90) days following the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of the Implementation of the Contract, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall, after consultation with CNPC, complete and<br /><br />
submit a training and technology transfer program for the<br /><br />
Chinese Personnel in the appraisal period and the<br /><br />
corresponding budget to JMC for review and approval, and<br /><br />
upon approval by JMC, put it into practice. The Contractor<br /><br />
shall, after the consultation with CNPC, complete and submit<br /><br />
training and technology transfer programs and corresponding<br /><br />
budgets for the Chinese Personnel in the development period<br /><br />
and production period, respectively, to JMC for its review<br /><br />
and approval before the commencement of Development<br /><br />
Operations and Production Operations, and upon approval by<br /><br />
JMC, put them into practice in time so as to have ample time<br /><br />
in advance for such training and technology transfer.<br /><br />
16.3 The purpose, requirement, fields of<br /><br />
specialization, scope of personnel, specific job categories,<br /><br />
type, method, etc. shall be determined through consultations<br /><br />
by the Parties.<br /><br />
16.4<br /><br />
<br /><br />
The expenses and costs incurred for performing<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the training and technology transfer program stipulated in<br /><br />
this Article shall be charged to the appraisal costs if such<br /><br />
costs are incurred before the date of approval of the<br /><br />
Overall Development Program of the first Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field, and shall be charged to the development costs if<br /><br />
such costs are incurred after the date of approval of the<br /><br />
Overall Development Program of the first Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field, and before the Date of Commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production of the first Oil Field and/or Gas Field, or shall<br /><br />
be charged to the operating costs if such costs are incurred<br /><br />
after the Date of Commencement of Commercial Production of<br /><br />
the first Oil Field and/or Gas Field.<br /><br />
16.4.1 The annual Work Program and Budget shall<br /><br />
include provisions for meeting the training and technology<br /><br />
transfer requirements of this Article 16. The training<br /><br />
program for CNPC Personnel shall be formulated to meet the<br /><br />
needs of the Petroleum Operations and shall be based on<br /><br />
principles of mutual benefit and efficiency of operation.<br /><br />
To the extent practicable, the training program shall<br /><br />
principally consist of CNPC Personnel working directly with<br /><br />
personnel of the Operator on matters that relate to the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations or in other ways agreed by the Parties.<br /><br />
The Parties shall establish the content and associated costs<br /><br />
for training and technology transfer through discussions<br /><br />
within the JMC and this amount shall be included in the<br /><br />
annual Work Program and Budget. The Parties agree that the<br /><br />
budget for the annual training program for all Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations shall be fifty thousand ($50,000) U.S. dollars<br /><br />
during Phase 1 of the Appraisal Period and eighty thousand<br /><br />
($80,000) U.S. dollars per year during Phases 2 and 3.<br /><br />
During Development Operations, the budget for the annual<br /><br />
training program shall be increased to one hundred fifty<br /><br />
thousand ($150,000) U.S. Dollars per year. These amounts<br /><br />
shall include the cost of training provided by the Operator.<br /><br />
Such costs and expenditures incurred during the production<br /><br />
period shall be determined by the Parties at the first<br /><br />
meeting of the JMC in the production period.<br /><br />
16.5 In the course of the implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract, the Parties shall have scientific and technical<br /><br />
cooperation and exchange in connection with the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations. The relevant provisions concerning the plan,<br /><br />
participating personnel and the type related to the<br /><br />
scientific and technical cooperation and exchange shall be<br /><br />
determined by the Parties. The expenses required by<br /><br />
scientific and technical cooperation and exchange shall be<br /><br />
included in the budget specified in Article 16.2 herein and<br /><br />
charged to the Joint Account. In the scientific and<br /><br />
technical cooperations, all inventions, experiments or<br /><br />
research results shall be shared by and belong to the<br /><br />
Parties who, subject to the provisions of Article 22 hereof,<br /><br />
shall not disclose them to any Third Party.<br /><br />
16.5.1 In the course of the implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract, those scientific research projects which are<br /><br />
required by the Petroleum Operations but not carried out by<br /><br />
the Parties, with the approval of JMC, may be commissioned<br /><br />
to, and carried out by, a Third Party, and the Parties shall<br /><br />
enter into subcontracts or service contracts with relevant<br /><br />
scientific departments within the territory of China,<br /><br />
provided that they are competitive. The aforesaid required<br /><br />
expenses shall be included in the budget specified in<br /><br />
Article 16.2 herein and charged to the Joint Account. All<br /><br />
inventions and experimental or research results developed<br /><br />
from the aforesaid research projects carried out by a Third<br /><br />
Party delegated by the Operator shall also be shared by and<br /><br />
belong to the Parties who, subject to the provisions of<br /><br />
Article 22 hereof, shall not disclose any of them to any<br /><br />
Third Party. The Operator shall endeavor to incorporate the<br /><br />
provisions herein in the subcontracts or service contracts<br /><br />
signed with the Third Party.<br /><br />
16.6 The advanced technology and managerial<br /><br />
experience, including proprietary technology, e. g. patent,<br /><br />
know-how or other confidential technology that the<br /><br />
Contractor shall transfer to CNPC, shall remain the<br /><br />
exclusive property of the owner and also be subject to the<br /><br />
confidentiality restrictions of Article 22 hereof.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 17<br /><br />
Ownership of Assets and Data<br /><br />
17.1 All assets purchased, installed and constructed<br /><br />
under the Work Program and budget for an Oil Field and/or<br /><br />
Gas Field within the Contract Area shall be owned by CNPC<br /><br />
from the date on which all the development costs actually<br /><br />
incurred by the Contractor in the development period of such<br /><br />
Oil Field and/or Gas Field have been fully recovered or from<br /><br />
the date on which the production period expires, even though<br /><br />
the aforesaid costs have not been fully recovered. The<br /><br />
Operator shall be responsible for the acceptance inspection<br /><br />
or testing of the said assets and CNPC may, as it deems<br /><br />
necessary, send its experts to participate in such<br /><br />
acceptance inspection or testing. In the production period,<br /><br />
the Operator may use these aforesaid CNPC-owned assets free<br /><br />
of charge for performing the Petroleum Operations. Such<br /><br />
assets shall not be used in any operations other than the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations or any operations by Third Parties<br /><br />
without the consent of the Parties.<br /><br />
17.2 Equipment and facilities which are owned by a<br /><br />
Third Party and are either leased by the Operator or<br /><br />
temporarily brought into the territory of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China for the performance of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations shall not be deemed as assets owned by CNPC.<br /><br />
Such equipment and facilities may be exported from the<br /><br />
People's Republic of China, but, export formalities shall be<br /><br />
handled by CNPC.<br /><br />
17.3 The ownership of all of the data, records,<br /><br />
samples, vouchers, and other original data obtained in the<br /><br />
course of performing the Petroleum Operations shall vest in<br /><br />
CNPC.<br /><br />
Article 18<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas<br /><br />
and Non-associated Natural Gas<br /><br />
18.1<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
18.1.1 The Associated Natural Gas produced from any<br /><br />
Oil Field within the Contract Area shall be primarily used<br /><br />
for purposes related to the operations of production and<br /><br />
production enhancement of Oil Fields such as gas injection,<br /><br />
gas lifting and power generation.<br /><br />
18.1.2 Based on the principle of full utilization of<br /><br />
the Associated Natural Gas and with no impediment to normal<br /><br />
production of the Crude Oil, the Overall Development Program<br /><br />
of each Oil Field shall include a plan of utilization of the<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas. If there is any excess Associated<br /><br />
Natural Gas in any Oil Field after utilization pursuant to<br /><br />
Article 18.1.1 herein (hereafter referred to as "excess<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas"), the Operator or the Contractor<br /><br />
shall carry out a feasibility study regarding the<br /><br />
utilization of such excess Associated Natural Gas of such<br /><br />
Oil Field. Such feasibility study, if carried out before<br /><br />
the Development Operations of an Oil Field, shall be<br /><br />
included as part of the feasibility study on the development<br /><br />
of the Oil Field. With respect to any Oil Field already<br /><br />
under commercial production, if a further feasibility study<br /><br />
on the utilization of its excess Associated Natural Gas is<br /><br />
required, such study shall be carried out by the Operator<br /><br />
and a report thereon shall be submitted to JMC for review<br /><br />
and discussion. If the Parties decide to utilize the excess<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas of any Oil Field, the construction of<br /><br />
facilities for such utilization and the production of the<br /><br />
excess Associated Natural Gas shall be carried out at the<br /><br />
same time as the Oil Field construction and production.<br /><br />
18.1.2.1 If the Parties agree that the excess<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas of an Oil Field has no commercial<br /><br />
value, then such gas shall be disposed of by the Operator,<br /><br />
provided that there is no impediment to normal production of<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the Crude Oil.<br /><br />
18.1.2.2 If any party to the Contract considers<br /><br />
unilaterally that the excess Associated Natural Gas of an<br /><br />
Oil Field has commercial value, such gas may be utilized by<br /><br />
that party to the Contract at its own expense without<br /><br />
affecting the amount of "cost recovery oil" and "allocable<br /><br />
remainder oil" due to the other party to the Contract which<br /><br />
does not invest in such utilization.<br /><br />
18.1.2.3 If the Parties agree that excess Associated<br /><br />
Natural Gas of an Oil Field has commercial value, they shall<br /><br />
make further investment in its utilization in proportion to<br /><br />
their respective participating interests in the development<br /><br />
of the Oil Field. If the Parties disagree on the commercial<br /><br />
utilization of such excess Associated Natural Gas of that<br /><br />
Oil Field, they shall, guided by the principle of mutual<br /><br />
benefit, carry out further negotiations to find a new<br /><br />
solution to utilization of the said excess Associated<br /><br />
Natural Gas and reach an agreement in writing. If the<br /><br />
Parties fail to reach an agreement through such<br /><br />
negotiations, CNPC shall reserve the right to dispose of<br /><br />
such excess Associated Natural Gas unilaterally.<br /><br />
18.1.3 Expenses incurred in the utilization of the<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas of any Oil Field as stipulated in<br /><br />
Article 18.1.1 herein, and those incurred in carrying out a<br /><br />
feasibility study on the utilization of the excess<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas after commencement of commercial<br /><br />
production of the Oil Field referred to in Article 18.1.2<br /><br />
herein shall be charged to the development costs of the Oil<br /><br />
Field.<br /><br />
18.2<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Non-associated Natural Gas.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
18.2.1 When any Non-associated Natural Gas Field<br /><br />
(hereafter referred to as the "Gas Field") is discovered<br /><br />
within the Contract Area, the Parties shall carry out<br /><br />
friendly negotiations regarding the development and<br /><br />
production of the Gas Field with a view to reaching an<br /><br />
agreement of principle, which shall form a supplementary<br /><br />
document to the Contract, and shall include the following<br /><br />
principles:<br /><br />
18.2.1.1 The price of the Natural Gas produced from<br /><br />
the Contract Area shall be determined based on general<br /><br />
pricing principles prevailing internationally taking into<br /><br />
consideration such factors as the market, the grade, quality<br /><br />
and quantity of the Natural Gas, etc.;<br /><br />
18.2.1.2 The Contract term for the Gas Field within<br /><br />
the Contract Area shall be separately determined according<br /><br />
to the conditions for development, production of such Field<br /><br />
and marketing of the Natural Gas; and<br /><br />
18.2.1.3 The allocation of the Natural Gas shall be in<br /><br />
conformity with the general principles of allocation for the<br /><br />
Crude Oil stipulated in Article 13 hereof. However, the<br /><br />
percentages of the allocation shall be adjusted by the<br /><br />
Parties through negotiations in light of actual conditions<br /><br />
in the Gas Field so that the Contractor shall be able to<br /><br />
obtain a reasonable economic benefit.<br /><br />
Following the signature of the agreement of principle<br /><br />
herein, the Operator shall work out an evaluation Work<br /><br />
Program for the discovered Gas Field in accordance with the<br /><br />
terms and conditions in the said agreement of principle and<br /><br />
submit it to JMC for its review and approval. Upon approval<br /><br />
by JMC, the Operator shall carry out an evaluation Work<br /><br />
Program.<br /><br />
The expenses incurred by the Operator in carrying<br /><br />
out the said evaluation Work Program shall be charged to the<br /><br />
appraisal costs of the Contract Area.<br /><br />
18.2.2 After completion of evaluation of a Gas Field,<br /><br />
the Operator shall submit a report thereon to JMC for review<br /><br />
and discussion.<br /><br />
18.2.2.1 If JMC decides unanimously that a gas<br /><br />
reservoir is noncommercial, the corresponding area covered<br /><br />
by the gas reservoir may be retained in the Contract Area<br /><br />
<br /><br />
during the appraisal period. But if, at the expiration of<br /><br />
the appraisal period, JMC still considers the said gas<br /><br />
reservoir to be noncommercial, the area covered by the gas<br /><br />
reservoir shall be excluded from the Contract Area. For a<br /><br />
Gas Field which has potential commercial value but which has<br /><br />
not been developed due to a lack of market or a shortage of<br /><br />
consuming facilities, the period for which the Gas Field is<br /><br />
retained in the Contract Area may be extended at the request<br /><br />
of any party to the Contract. Such extended period,<br /><br />
however, shall not exceed three (3) consecutive Contract<br /><br />
Years after the date of expiration of the appraisal period<br /><br />
hereunder. In case the time needed for the market to<br /><br />
develop or for the consuming facilities to be constructed<br /><br />
for the Gas Field exceeds such extended period, a further<br /><br />
extended period shall be subject to the approval of the<br /><br />
relevant authorities of the Chinese Government.<br /><br />
Prior to the expiration of the appraisal period, if<br /><br />
JMC considers that a gas reservoir which has been determined<br /><br />
to be noncommercial needs to be reappraised because of some<br /><br />
favorable factors, the Operator shall work out a new<br /><br />
evaluation report on that gas reservoir and submit it to JMC<br /><br />
for review and approval.<br /><br />
18.2.2.2 If the Contractor considers any gas reservoir<br /><br />
to be non-commercial, the Contractor shall be deemed to have<br /><br />
waived its rights of participating in the development of<br /><br />
that gas reservoir.<br /><br />
18.2.2.3 Where the Parties consider a gas reservoir to<br /><br />
be commercial, the Parties shall negotiate to reach an<br /><br />
agreement on the development of the said gas reservoir,<br /><br />
based on the terms and conditions provided in the agreement<br /><br />
of principle referred to in Article 18.2.1 herein. The<br /><br />
agreement concerning the development shall be a<br /><br />
supplementary document and an integral part hereof. If the<br /><br />
Parties fail to reach such agreement through negotiations<br /><br />
within three (3) years after the date of commencement of<br /><br />
such negotiations, CNPC shall have the right unilaterally to<br /><br />
put up the gas reservoir for bidding. In such case, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall still be entitled to participate in the<br /><br />
bidding.<br /><br />
18.3 If CNPC utilizes unilaterally the excess<br /><br />
Associated Natural Gas of an Oil Field or develops solely a<br /><br />
Gas Field and requires to apply thereto the Contractor's<br /><br />
appropriate and advanced technology and managerial<br /><br />
experience, the Parties shall negotiate terms and conditions<br /><br />
related thereto and the Operator shall carry out the<br /><br />
operations after an agreement has been reached on such terms<br /><br />
and conditions.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 19<br /><br />
Accounting, Auditing and Personnel Costs<br /><br />
19.1<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Accounting.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Annex II - Accounting Procedure hereto contains the<br /><br />
guidelines for the Operator to keep accounting books and<br /><br />
records and make financial settlements. The Operator shall<br /><br />
keep and settle the accounts for all the financial<br /><br />
activities in respect of the Contract Area and maintain all<br /><br />
the accounting books and records in accordance with Annex II<br /><br />
- - Accounting Procedure hereto in order to accurately reflect<br /><br />
the appraisal costs, development costs with Deemed Interest<br /><br />
thereon and operating costs incurred in the performance of<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations in respect of the Contract Area, as<br /><br />
well as quantity and monetary value of the production and<br /><br />
allocation of Crude Oil and Natural Gas. The Operator shall<br /><br />
submit detailed statements and relevant written reports to<br /><br />
JMC and the departments concerned.<br /><br />
19.2<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Auditing.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
19.2.1. Any Non-Operator party to the Contract shall<br /><br />
have the right to audit all the Operator's Joint Account<br /><br />
accounting books and records after the end of each Calendar<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Year and to give the Operator a written notice of the<br /><br />
auditing results. The audit of any Calendar Year shall be<br /><br />
completed within twenty-four (24) months after the end of<br /><br />
such Calendar Year. If written notice of the auditing<br /><br />
results and exceptions are not given by the non-Operator<br /><br />
party within such period or if the annual Joint Account<br /><br />
accounting books and records of the Operator are not audited<br /><br />
by any non-Operator party within such period, the Operator's<br /><br />
Joint Account accounting books and records shall be deemed<br /><br />
correct. A special auditing of the Operator's Joint Account<br /><br />
accounting books and records may be made due to some special<br /><br />
requirements during a Calendar Year.<br /><br />
19.2.2 If the auditing referred to in Article 19.2.1<br /><br />
herein is conducted, the Operator shall be given thirty (30)<br /><br />
days notice prior to the date of commencement of such<br /><br />
auditing. There shall be no impediment to normal Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations during any audit.<br /><br />
19.2.3 The auditors shall be entitled to access to all<br /><br />
relevant Joint Account records, files and other information<br /><br />
and may inspect such sites and facilities as are necessary.<br /><br />
19.2.4 Upon receipt of a notice of the non-Operator<br /><br />
party's exceptions to the auditing results, the Operator<br /><br />
shall resolve these matters in due time (no later than sixty<br /><br />
(60) days thereafter).<br /><br />
19.3<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Personnel Costs.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
19.3.1 The personnel costs means that remuneration and<br /><br />
other related charges paid on the basis of the working time<br /><br />
spent by personnel who are engaged in administration,<br /><br />
management, accounting, finance, tax, employee relations,<br /><br />
procurement, legal affairs, computer services, engineering,<br /><br />
geology, geophysics, drilling and the Production Operations<br /><br />
as well as all other work for the implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract.<br /><br />
19.3.1.1 The salaries or wages of personnel in various<br /><br />
subordinate bodies of JMC and of all employees engaged in<br /><br />
the performance of the Petroleum Operations shall be<br /><br />
included in the personnel costs as provided in Article<br /><br />
19.3.1 herein.<br /><br />
19.3.1.2 Personnel costs which are classified as the<br /><br />
overhead of the superior management organization pursuant to<br /><br />
Article 5.2.18 of Annex II - Accounting Procedure hereto<br /><br />
shall not be included in the personnel costs mentioned<br /><br />
herein.<br /><br />
19.3.2 After the Date of Commencement of the<br /><br />
Implementation of the Contract, the Operator shall work out<br /><br />
a staffing plan for its organization and planned personnel<br /><br />
costs with respect thereto (including an itemized plan of<br /><br />
personnel costs, such as basic salary or wage, overseas<br /><br />
allowance and area allowance, etc.) before the beginning of<br /><br />
each Calendar Year and submit such plan with the annual<br /><br />
Work Program and budget to JMC for review and examination.<br /><br />
CNPC shall have the right to audit the personnel costs<br /><br />
charged to the Joint Account.<br /><br />
19.3.3 The level of the salaries and wages paid to the<br /><br />
representatives appointed by CNPC to JMC established in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 7.1 hereof, the Chinese Personnel<br /><br />
working in various subordinate bodies of JMC established in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 7.4 hereof, the professional<br /><br />
representatives assigned by CNPC to all administrative and<br /><br />
technical departments of the Operator (the Contractor) in<br /><br />
accordance with Article 7.5 hereof and CNPC's personnel<br /><br />
employed by the Contractor shall be determined by the<br /><br />
Parties in the negotiations of the Contract.<br /><br />
The salaries and wages of the Chinese Personnel other<br /><br />
than CNPC's personnel employed by the Operator shall be<br /><br />
determined through consultation and specified in the<br /><br />
employment contracts. The settlement of accounts for the<br /><br />
salaries and wages of the Chinese Personnel mentioned in<br /><br />
Article 19.3.3 herein shall be made between CNPC and the<br /><br />
Operator, and the Operator shall not be liable for any<br /><br />
<br /><br />
individual income tax thereon.<br /><br />
Before the Date of Commencement of Commercial<br /><br />
Production of the first Oil Field and/or Gas Field, the<br /><br />
level of the salaries and wages and other related charges<br /><br />
paid to the Expatriate Employees shall be made by the<br /><br />
Contractor through consultation with CNPC. After the Date<br /><br />
of Commencement of Commercial Production of the first Oil<br /><br />
Field and/or Gas Field, the level of the salaries and wages<br /><br />
and other related charges paid to the Expatriate Employees<br /><br />
shall be discussed and agreed by the Parties.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 20<br /><br />
Taxation<br /><br />
20.1 The Contractor shall pay taxes to the Government<br /><br />
of the People's Republic of China subject to the tax laws<br /><br />
and regulations of the People's Republic of China.<br /><br />
20.2 The Contractor shall advise the Subcontractors<br /><br />
who render services for the Contract that they and their<br /><br />
employees shall pay taxes to the Government of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China subject to the tax laws and regulations of<br /><br />
the People's Republic of China.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 21<br /><br />
Insurance<br /><br />
21.1 The Operator shall work out an insurance program<br /><br />
for the Appraisal Operations and submit it to JMC for review<br /><br />
and approval within one hundred and twenty (120) days after<br /><br />
the Date of Commencement of the Implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract. The Operator shall, on behalf of the Parties,<br /><br />
obtain the insurance contracts in accordance with such<br /><br />
program as approved by JMC before commencement of Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations within the Contract Area.<br /><br />
Similar provisions shall apply in respect of<br /><br />
Development Operations and Production Operations.<br /><br />
21.2 All of the insurance items as approved in the<br /><br />
insurance program shall be insured in accordance with the<br /><br />
laws and regulations of the People's Republic of China and<br /><br />
on terms and conditions competitive with world markets.<br /><br />
21.3 The insurance program worked out by Operator<br /><br />
shall include, but not be limited to, the following<br /><br />
insurance covering;<br /><br />
(a) damages and expenses to all drilling installation<br /><br />
and equipment, including damages and expenses to the<br /><br />
properties used on worksites and supply bases for the<br /><br />
Petroleum Operations, while the equipment and properties<br /><br />
owned by a Third Party rendering services to the Operator<br /><br />
shall be handled in accordance with Article 21.5 herein;<br /><br />
(b) damages and expenses to any of the equipment or<br /><br />
installations for production, storage and transportation,<br /><br />
and buildings in the course of construction and<br /><br />
installation;<br /><br />
(c) damages and expenses to the Crude Oil and/or<br /><br />
Natural Gas production installations, facilities, equipment<br /><br />
and pipelines;<br /><br />
(d)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
liability to Third Parties;<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(e) liability for pollution and expenses for cleaning<br /><br />
up in the course of drilling and the Production Operations;<br /><br />
(f)<br /><br />
<br /><br />
expenses for killing blowouts;<br /><br />
<br /><br />
(g) liability incurred by the Operator in hiring<br /><br />
drilling rigs, vessels and aircraft serving the Petroleum<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Operations; and<br /><br />
(h) losses and expenses incurred during the<br /><br />
transportation and storage in transit of goods shipped from<br /><br />
different parts of the world to the worksites.<br /><br />
21.4 In the insurance contracts, the deductibles borne<br /><br />
by the Operator alone shall be determined by the Parties<br /><br />
through consultation, and losses within the deductible<br /><br />
limits shall be borne by the Parties.<br /><br />
21.5 When signing subcontracts or lease contracts, the<br /><br />
Operator shall endeavor to compel Subcontractors and lessors<br /><br />
to insure their risks under the relevant subcontracts in<br /><br />
accordance with the laws and regulations of the People's<br /><br />
Republic of China.<br /><br />
21.6 In the course of the Petroleum Operations, the<br /><br />
Parties shall cover separately accidental death and personal<br /><br />
injury insurance with respect to personnel assigned by them<br /><br />
respectively. The premiums in respect thereof shall be<br /><br />
dealt with in the following way: the premiums for<br /><br />
accidental death and personal injury insurance with respect<br /><br />
to personnel whose costs are charged to the Joint Account<br /><br />
pursuant to the provisions of the Contract shall be charged<br /><br />
to the Joint Account, and those with respect to other<br /><br />
personnel shall be borne respectively by the Parties by<br /><br />
which they are assigned.<br /><br />
21.7 Insurance companies owned by or affiliated with<br /><br />
any party to the Contract, or the Parties themselves, may<br /><br />
approach insurer(s) for reinsurance if they are interested<br /><br />
in covering any part of the insurance program hereof.<br /><br />
21.8 All motor vehicles serving the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations in communication, transportation and special<br /><br />
project shall be insured in accordance with the laws and<br /><br />
regulations of the People's Republic of China.<br /><br />
21.9 The premiums of insurance in the appraisal period<br /><br />
and the development period shall be charged to the appraisal<br /><br />
costs and development costs respectively and those in the<br /><br />
production period shall be charged to the operating costs.<br /><br />
21.10 Any claim under the insurance of the agreed<br /><br />
insurance program charged to the Joint Account shall be<br /><br />
handled by the Operator and any recovery made from insurers<br /><br />
shall be credited to the Joint Account.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 22<br /><br />
Confidentiality<br /><br />
22.1 CNPC shall, in conformity with applicable laws<br /><br />
and regulations of the Government of the People's Republic<br /><br />
of China on confidentiality and by taking into account the<br /><br />
international practice, determine the confidentiality<br /><br />
periods for which the Contract and all documents,<br /><br />
information, data and reports related to the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations within the Contract Area shall be kept<br /><br />
confidential.<br /><br />
22.2 Without the written consent of the other party,<br /><br />
no party to the Contract shall disclose, in the<br /><br />
confidentiality periods, the Contract, documents,<br /><br />
information, data and reports referred to in Article 22.1<br /><br />
herein or any other information regarded by JMC as<br /><br />
confidential, to any Third Party except the Third Parties in<br /><br />
Article 22.5 herein and to any Affiliates not directly<br /><br />
connected with the implementation of the Contract, and no<br /><br />
party to the Contract shall otherwise transfer, present,<br /><br />
sell or publish them in any way within the confidentiality<br /><br />
periods. However, if the Department or Unit decides to<br /><br />
invite any Third Party to conduct cooperative exploration<br /><br />
for and development of Petroleum in the sedimentary basin in<br /><br />
which the Contract Area is located and/or other adjacent<br /><br />
areas, CNPC may furnish the following original data and<br /><br />
information or the interpretation thereon with respect to<br /><br />
<br /><br />
the Contract Area to the relevant Third Parties:<br /><br />
(a) original data and information held by CNPC for<br /><br />
over two (2) years; and<br /><br />
(b) interpretation of original data and information,<br /><br />
which has been held by CNPC for over five (5) years<br /><br />
CNPC shall require relevant Third Parties to undertake<br /><br />
to keep confidential the aforesaid data, information, and<br /><br />
interpretation thereon furnished to tthem by CNPC.<br /><br />
22.3 During the term of the Contract and after<br /><br />
termination of the Contract, CNPC shall not disclose to any<br /><br />
Third Party any patent, know-how or proprietary technology<br /><br />
transferred to CNPC by the Contractor without the written<br /><br />
consent of the Contractor except for any technology, the<br /><br />
patent of which has expired and any proprietary and<br /><br />
confidential technology which have entered the public<br /><br />
domain.<br /><br />
22.4 After the termination of the Contract or after<br /><br />
any assignment of rights and/or obligations of the Contract<br /><br />
under Article 23 hereof, the Contractor and any assignee<br /><br />
shall, within the confidentiality periods, continue to be<br /><br />
obliged to keep confidential documents, information, data<br /><br />
and reports mentioned in Article 22.2 herein except for<br /><br />
official documents and information published with the<br /><br />
consent of the Parties.<br /><br />
22.5 For the implementation of the Contract, the<br /><br />
Operator may, after review by JMC and CNPC, furnish the<br /><br />
necessary documents, information, data and reports to Third<br /><br />
Parties and Affiliates related to the Petroleum Operations.<br /><br />
The Third Parties and Affiliates include:<br /><br />
22.5.1 Banks or other credit institutions from which<br /><br />
finance is sought by any party to the Contract for the<br /><br />
implementation of the Contract;<br /><br />
22.5.2 Third Parties and Affiliates which provide<br /><br />
services for the Petroleum Operations, including<br /><br />
Subcontractors and other service contractors; and<br /><br />
22.5.3 An assignee or assignees to whom the rights and<br /><br />
obligations under the Contract are intended to be assigned.<br /><br />
22.6 Necessary information, documents, data and<br /><br />
reports may be furnished by the Contractor in accordance<br /><br />
with the laws of its home country to the government and<br /><br />
stock exchange provided that the Contractor reports to JMC<br /><br />
in advance.<br /><br />
22.7 CNPC and each company comprising the Contractor,<br /><br />
when furnishing the documents, information, data and reports<br /><br />
to Third Parties and Affiliates as mentioned in Article 22.5<br /><br />
herein, shall require them to assume the confidentiality<br /><br />
obligations as set forth herein, or shall bear full<br /><br />
responsibility for any violation thereof.<br /><br />
Article 23<br /><br />
Assignment<br /><br />
23.1 The Contractor may assign part or all of its<br /><br />
rights and/or obligations under the Contract to its<br /><br />
Affiliate with the prior consent of CNPC and in accordance<br /><br />
with the following provisions:<br /><br />
(a) the Contractor shall submit to CNPC copies of a<br /><br />
written agreement on the corresponding part of its rights<br /><br />
and/or obligations to be assigned;<br /><br />
(b) the Contractor shall guarantee in writing to CNPC<br /><br />
the performance of the assigned obligations;<br /><br />
(c) no such assignment shall interfere with the<br /><br />
performance of the Petroleum Operations or affect the<br /><br />
organizational structure.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
23.2 The Contractor may assign part or all of its<br /><br />
rights and/or obligations under the Contract to any Third<br /><br />
Party, provided that such assignment shall be agreed to by<br /><br />
CNPC in advance and approved by Ministry of Foreign Trade<br /><br />
and Economic Cooperation in China ("MOFTEC"). However, CNPC<br /><br />
shall have the right of first refusal with respect to such<br /><br />
assignment provided that the conditions offered by CNPC are<br /><br />
comparable.<br /><br />
23.3 CNPC may authorize its subsidiaries, branches,<br /><br />
regional corporations or its Affiliates to implement the<br /><br />
Contract, but CNPC shall remain responsible for the<br /><br />
performance of the Contract.<br /><br />
23.4 CNPC may assign part of its rights and/or<br /><br />
obligations hereunder to a Chinese Government controlled<br /><br />
Third Party, provided that prior written consent of the<br /><br />
Government of the People's Republic of China shall be<br /><br />
obtained. CNPC shall guarantee the performance of the<br /><br />
assigned obligations and such assignment shall not interfere<br /><br />
with the performance of Petroleum Operations.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 24<br /><br />
Environmental Protection and Safety<br /><br />
24.1 In the performance of the Petroleum Operations,<br /><br />
the Operator shall be strictly subject to the laws, decrees<br /><br />
and regulations on environmental protection and safety<br /><br />
promulgated by the Chinese Government and make its best<br /><br />
efforts to prevent pollution and damage to the atmosphere,<br /><br />
oceans, rivers, lakes, ground water, harbors, land and<br /><br />
ecology and secure the safety and health of the operating<br /><br />
personnel. The Operator shall use all reasonable endeavors<br /><br />
to eliminate promptly any pollution occurring in the<br /><br />
performance of the Petroleum Operations and minimize its<br /><br />
consequences. Economic loss caused by any pollution shall<br /><br />
be charged to the Joint Account, unless otherwise provided<br /><br />
in Article 8.4 hereof.<br /><br />
24.2 When competent authorities under the Chinese<br /><br />
Government assign any person to inspect environmental<br /><br />
protection and safety within the scope of the Petroleum<br /><br />
Operations according to the laws, decrees, rules and<br /><br />
regulations, the Operator shall provide all necessary<br /><br />
facilities and assistance to enable the inspectors to carry<br /><br />
out such inspection smoothly.<br /><br />
24.3<br /><br />
In the performance of the Petroleum Operations<br /><br />
in any fixed fishing net casting area and/or aquatic<br /><br />
breeding area, the Operator shall make prior contact with<br /><br />
the appropriate authorities of the Chinese Government.<br /><br />
24.4 Before the commencement of Appraisal Operations,<br /><br />
the Operator shall provide CNPC with documentation on the<br /><br />
possible impact by the Appraisal Operations on the<br /><br />
environment and the adopted measures to prevent pollutions.<br /><br />
Before the Development Operations the Operator shall provide<br /><br />
CNPC with an environment impact statement as an integral<br /><br />
part of the Overall Development Program of the Oil Field<br /><br />
and/or Gas Field.<br /><br />
24.5 During the term of the Contract, the Operator<br /><br />
shall, after the completion of various Petroleum Operations,<br /><br />
level or restore or reclaim the land of the operating sites<br /><br />
in accordance with the local rules and regulations.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 25<br /><br />
Force Majeure<br /><br />
25.1 Except as to any payment under the Contract, no<br /><br />
party to the Contract shall be considered in default of the<br /><br />
performance of any of its obligations hereunder, if any<br /><br />
failure to perform or any delay in performing its<br /><br />
<br /><br />
obligations is in conformity with all the events described<br /><br />
as follows:<br /><br />
The performance of any obligations hereunder is<br /><br />
prevented, hindered or delayed because of any event or<br /><br />
combination of events which could not be foreseen and/or<br /><br />
which is beyond the control of such party;<br /><br />
The normally occurring weather conditions, such as<br /><br />
wind, wave and current, of the Contract Area shall not be<br /><br />
considered as an event of force majeure.<br /><br />
Any such event or combination of events is the direct<br /><br />
cause of preventing, hindering or delaying of such party's<br /><br />
performance of its obligations hereunder; and<br /><br />
When any such event or combination of events has<br /><br />
occurred, such party has taken all reasonable actions to<br /><br />
overcome any cause that prevents, hinders or delays<br /><br />
performance of its obligations and shall in so far as is<br /><br />
practicable continue to perform its obligations hereunder.<br /><br />
25.2 Notice of any event of force majeure and the<br /><br />
conclusion thereof shall forthwith be given to the other<br /><br />
party by the party claiming force majeure.<br /><br />
25.3 In the event of force majeure, the Parties shall<br /><br />
immediately consult in order to find an equitable solution<br /><br />
thereto and shall use all reasonable endeavors to minimize<br /><br />
the consequences of such force majeure.<br /><br />
25.4 If the Petroleum Operations in the Contract Area<br /><br />
are partially or entirely suspended as a result of the force<br /><br />
majeure referred to in Article 25.1 herein, the period of<br /><br />
the Petroleum Operations may be extended by a period not<br /><br />
exceeding the corresponding period of such suspension.<br /><br />
Within fifteen (15) days following the end of each Calendar<br /><br />
Year, the Operator shall report to JMC in writing on the<br /><br />
suspension of the Petroleum Operations caused by force<br /><br />
majeure, if any, during the preceding Calendar Year.<br /><br />
25.5<br /><br />
Should, however, the Force Majeure condition<br /><br />
continue for a period of twenty-four (24) consecutive<br /><br />
months, then Contractor shall have the option to terminate<br /><br />
this Contract without any further liability.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 26<br /><br />
Consultation and Arbitration<br /><br />
26.1 The Parties shall make their best efforts to<br /><br />
settle amicably through consultation any dispute arising in<br /><br />
connection with the performance or interpretation of any<br /><br />
provision hereof.<br /><br />
26.2 Any dispute mentioned in Article 26.1 herein that<br /><br />
has not been settled through such consultation within ninety<br /><br />
(90) days after the dispute arises may be referred to<br /><br />
arbitration at the request of and by either party to the<br /><br />
Contract. The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance<br /><br />
with the following provisions:<br /><br />
26.2.1 If agreed upon by the Parties, such dispute<br /><br />
shall be referred to arbitration conducted by the China<br /><br />
International Economic and Trade Arbitration Commission<br /><br />
("CIETAC") in accordance with the provisional arbitration<br /><br />
proceeding rules thereof.<br /><br />
26.2.2 If the Parties fail to reach an agreement on<br /><br />
the arbitration arrangement mentioned in Article 26.2.1<br /><br />
herein, the Parties shall establish an ad hoc arbitration<br /><br />
tribunal to conduct arbitration in accordance with the<br /><br />
following provisions:<br /><br />
26.2.2.1 The ad hoc arbitration tribunal shall consist<br /><br />
of three (3) arbitrators. The Parties shall each appoint an<br /><br />
arbitrator and the two arbitrators so appointed shall<br /><br />
designate a third arbitrator. If one of the Parties does<br /><br />
<br /><br />
not appoint its arbitrator within sixty (60) days after the<br /><br />
first appointment, or if the two arbitrators once appointed<br /><br />
fail to appoint the third within sixty (60) days after the<br /><br />
appointment of the second arbitrator, the relevant<br /><br />
appointment shall be made by the Arbitration Institute of<br /><br />
the Stockholm Chamber of Commerce, Sweden.<br /><br />
26.2.2.2 The third arbitrator shall be a citizen of a<br /><br />
country which has formal diplomatic relations with both the<br /><br />
People's Republic of China and any home country of the<br /><br />
companies comprising the Contractor, and shall not have any<br /><br />
economic interests of relationship with the Parties.<br /><br />
26.2.2.3 The place of arbitration shall be determined<br /><br />
by the Parties through consultations or, failing the<br /><br />
agreement of the Parties by a majority of arbitrators of the<br /><br />
ad hoc arbitration tribunal.<br /><br />
26.2.2.4 The ad hoc arbitration tribunal shall conduct<br /><br />
the arbitration in accordance with the arbitration rules of<br /><br />
United Nations Commission on International Trade Law<br /><br />
("UNCITRAL") of 1976. However, if the above-mentioned<br /><br />
arbitration rules are in conflict with the provisions of<br /><br />
this Article 26 including the provisions concerning<br /><br />
appointment of arbitrators, the provisions of this Article<br /><br />
26 shall prevail.<br /><br />
26.3 Both the Chinese and English languages shall be<br /><br />
official languages used in the arbitration proceedings. All<br /><br />
hearing materials, statements of claim or defence, award and<br /><br />
the reasons supporting them shall be written in both Chinese<br /><br />
and English.<br /><br />
26.4 Any award of arbitration shall be final and<br /><br />
binding upon the Parties.<br /><br />
26.5 The right to arbitrate disputes under the<br /><br />
Contract shall survive the termination of the Contract.<br /><br />
Article 27<br /><br />
Effectiveness and Termination of the Contract<br /><br />
27.1 After the Contract is signed, it shall be<br /><br />
approved by the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic<br /><br />
Cooperation of the People's Republic of China. The Contract<br /><br />
shall be effective on the date of such approval. However,<br /><br />
the Contractor's obligations shall begin on the Date of<br /><br />
Commencement of the Implementation of the Contract, as<br /><br />
defined in Article 1, herein above. CNPC shall notify the<br /><br />
Contractor of the said approval in writing as soon as<br /><br />
possible.<br /><br />
27.2 All annexes to the Contract shall be regarded as<br /><br />
integral parts of the Contract. If there is any<br /><br />
inconsistency between the provisions of the annexes and the<br /><br />
main body of the Contract, the main body of the Contract<br /><br />
shall prevail. All references to the "Contract" hereof<br /><br />
refer to the main body of the Contract.<br /><br />
27.3 If in the course of implementation of the<br /><br />
Contract the Parties decide through consultation to make<br /><br />
amendment to or supplement to any part of the Contract, a<br /><br />
written agreement signed by the authorized representatives<br /><br />
of the Parties shall be required. Such written agreement<br /><br />
shall be subject to the approval of the Ministry of Foreign<br /><br />
Trade and Economic Cooperation should there be any<br /><br />
significant modifications hereof. Such agreement shall be<br /><br />
regarded as an integral part of the Contract.<br /><br />
27.4 The Contract shall terminate under any of the<br /><br />
following circumstances:<br /><br />
27.4.1 exercise of the Contractor's election to<br /><br />
terminate the Contract under Article 6.3 (b) hereof;<br /><br />
27.4.2. failure to identify any commercial oil or gas<br /><br />
reservoir within the Contract Area by the expiration of the<br /><br />
appraisal period or the extended appraisal period granted<br /><br />
<br /><br />
under Articles 4.3 or 18.2.2.1 hereof;<br /><br />
27.4.3 if there is only one (1) commercial Oil Field<br /><br />
or Gas Field in production in the Contract Area, on<br /><br />
termination of the production period of such Field;<br /><br />
27.4.4. if there are two (2) or more commercial Oil<br /><br />
Fields or Gas Fields in production in the Contract Area, on<br /><br />
termination of the production period of the Field with the<br /><br />
latest termination date; or<br /><br />
27.4.5 at the end of the last day of the thirtieth<br /><br />
(30th) Contract Year from the Date of Commencement of the<br /><br />
Implementation of the Contract, unless the production period<br /><br />
is extended by approval of the Department or Unit under<br /><br />
Article 4.5. hereof or unless otherwise stipulated in<br /><br />
Articles 4.6.1, 18.2.1.2 or 25.4 hereof.<br /><br />
27.5 Before the expiration of the first phase of the<br /><br />
appraisal period as specified in Article 4.2 hereof, the<br /><br />
Contractor shall not propose terminating the Contract unless<br /><br />
the Contractor has fulfilled the minimum appraisal work<br /><br />
commitment for the first phase of the appraisal period ahead<br /><br />
of time.<br /><br />
27.6 If either party to the Contract commits a<br /><br />
material breach of the Contract, the other party to the<br /><br />
Contract shall have the right to demand that such breach be<br /><br />
remedied within a reasonable specified period of time. If<br /><br />
such breach is not remedied within such period of time, the<br /><br />
complaining party shall have the right to terminate the<br /><br />
Contract by giving ninety (90) days' written notice to the<br /><br />
defaulting party.<br /><br />
However, such material breach of the<br /><br />
Contract and unremedied material breach shall have been<br /><br />
judged by the final award of arbitration in accordance with<br /><br />
Article 26 hereof.<br /><br />
27.7 Notwithstanding the provisions in Article 6.8<br /><br />
hereof, CNPC has the right to unilaterally terminate the<br /><br />
Contract, except as otherwise provided in Article 25<br /><br />
hereof, in the event the Contractor failed to:<br /><br />
(1) spud the first Appraisal Well within ten (10)<br /><br />
months after the Date of Commencement of Implementation of<br /><br />
the Contract provided in Article 6.2 hereof; or<br /><br />
(2) fulfill the minimum appraisal work commitment as<br /><br />
specified in Article 6.2.1 herein at the expiration of the<br /><br />
first phase of the appraisal period specified in Article 4.2<br /><br />
hereof.<br /><br />
The Contractor shall within thirty (30) days from the<br /><br />
date CNPC decides to terminate the Contract as specified<br /><br />
above, pay CNPC any unfulfilled balance of the minimum<br /><br />
appraisal work commitment in the said period in U.S. dollars<br /><br />
after it has been converted into a cash equivalent using the<br /><br />
method provided in Annex II - Accounting Procedure.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
Article 28<br /><br />
The Applicable Law<br /><br />
28.1 The validity, interpretation and implementation<br /><br />
of the Contract shall be governed by the laws of the<br /><br />
People's Republic of China. Failing the relevant provisions<br /><br />
of the laws of the People's Republic of China for the<br /><br />
interpretation or implementation of the Contract, the<br /><br />
principles of the applicable laws widely used in the<br /><br />
petroleum resources countries acceptable to the Parties<br /><br />
shall be applicable.<br /><br />
28.2 If a material change occurs to the Contractor's<br /><br />
economic benefit after the effective date of the Contract<br /><br />
due to the promulgation of new laws, decrees, rules and<br /><br />
regulations or any amendment to the applicable laws,<br /><br />
decrees, rules and regulations made by the People's Republic<br /><br />
of China, the Parties shall consult promptly and make<br /><br />
necessary revisions and adjustments to the relevant<br /><br />
<br /><br />
provisions of the Contract in order to maintain the<br /><br />
Contractor's normal economic benefits hereunder.<br /><br />
Article 29<br /><br />
Language of Contract and Working Language<br /><br />
29.1 The text of the Contract, annexes and<br /><br />
supplementary documents attached hereto shall be written in<br /><br />
both Chinese and English languages, and both versions shall<br /><br />
have equal force and effect.<br /><br />
29.2 The Parties agree that both Chinese and English<br /><br />
shall be used as working languages. After the effective<br /><br />
date of the Contract, technical documents and information<br /><br />
concerning the Petroleum Operations hereunder shall, in<br /><br />
general, be written in English except for technical<br /><br />
documents and information available previously and from<br /><br />
Third Parties.<br /><br />
Unless otherwise agreed by CNPC, documents and<br /><br />
information in respect of administration shall be written in<br /><br />
both Chinese and English. Forms for production and other<br /><br />
reports and records shall be printed with headings in both<br /><br />
Chinese and English and may be filled out in either Chinese<br /><br />
or English.<br /><br />
<br /><br />
